care for yourself. That is the lesson after the sixth line. 

HEXAGRAM 4: YOUTHFUL FOLLY 

We come to the logical collective. The experience of the abstract side is always going from the 
present to the past, and the experience of the individual process is the dealing with the present. 
When we come to the logic process, there is the need to project into the future. Everything 
about the logic process is about finding a way in which we can be secure in the nature of the 
direction that we take in our lives so that humanity can be preserved. 

The 4 th hexagram is the need to be able to provide a solution that can be experimented with, to 
guarantee the perfection of the human process. Logic is universal in all life forms and so the 
logical mind is of enormous value to humanity It is the only part of the mind that directly asks 
questions and gives answers. The 4 th hexagram is called Youthful Folly. The question is 
coming from the 63, the gate of doubt, and what we have here is the channel of Logic, a design 
of mental ease mixed with doubt. 

The 4 th gate is the gate of formulization and the potential is the awareness to judge what is 
suspicious in the pattern or not. It is concentration on the pattern to come up with the answer. 
The question is: "Is it suspicious, or not?" The answer is about answering the question about the 
pattern. Everything about the logical process is about patterns. The doubt is always initiated by 
a pattern. The answer always has to do with whether that pattern is worthy of doubt. 

Remember the nature of the 18 th gate in the correction process. The 4 th gate, like the 18 th gate, 
has a gift. The 1 8 th gate has the ability to be able to recognize at any given moment what needs 
to be corrected. The 4 th gate has the gift of always being able to come up with an answer. Both 
of those are risky things because what can be corrected at any given moment and an answer 
that can be provided at any given moment is not necessarily the truth, nor is it necessarily 
something that will prove to be of value to humanity once it has been tested and experimented 
with. One always has to be deeply suspicious of logical answers. Answers are the beginning of 
a process. They are the generation of a formula. The 4th gate is the gate of formulization. An 
answer is a formula. The formula is: it is suspicious, or not. 

It says above the lines: The energy to beguile and succeed despite ignorance. Freedom 

from retribution. I am reminded of Groucho Marx, whom I love very much. A waiter came up to 
him and asked him, "How did you find your steak?" "Beside the tomatoes and underneath the 
lettuce." The capacity to come up with an answer has nothing to do with the truth. It is a gift to 
answer. I know; I have the fourth gate. It does not mean that it is the truth, and this is so 
important to understand. It can only be the truth after it has been tested and experimented with. 
It does not matter how clever the answer is. The fact of the matter is that, for the benefit of 
humanity, everything that is logical has to be tested and experimented with. The answer is only 
the beginning of a process. 

4.1 Pleasure 

The first line is always the foundation and it is introspection. The first line is called Pleasure. 
Understand, that that the whole thing about answers is that they are pleasurable. There is a 
pleasure in getting answers. That is why logic has to be seductive for us. It is necessary. It 
brings us pleasure to have answers. 

Ultimate pleasure cannot be achieved without perfect timing. To give an answer at the wrong 
time can be disastrous. People have to be ready for that. Moon exalted. The instinct to know the 
right moment and circumstances where pleasure is rewarded and not punished. You can give 

an answer at one time and have a very angry response. You give an answer at another time 
and everybody is happy. The same is true for correction. One moment you offer to correct 
somebody and they think that you are bitching and the next moment the very same thing can be 
accepted as being valuable. It is a matter of knowing what the timing is. 

Earth in detriment. Timing is not a product of discipline. Exaggerated self-discipline leads to the 
abuse of pleasure. The most important thing about people who have the fourth gate is that they 
don't decide the timing. They are ready for the right time. 

The potential to recognize that there is a natural timing to the understanding process. It is not 
about deciding the timing; it is about being ready for the right time. It is there, it comes. It is 
collective. In order for an answer to be valid, it still has to become an opinion. It still has to get 
its details. It still has to be experimented with. It has to go through that whole process. 

The other side is: The potential to recognize but the urge to force the timing. People who have 
this detriment always want to give you the answer at the wrong time. You are busy and they 
have the answer and they won't let you do your thing. They have to give you the answer when 
you do not appreciate it, and then it does not get shared properly. The first line knows very little 
about the other side. The key in all of this is to recognize the nature of timing, to be ready in the 
understanding and then you do not get punished. 

4.2 Acceptance 

Here, we get to the line of projection and we know with the projection that there is no

The line of Acceptance. The recognition of limitation in oneself and others leads to tolerance 
and the suspension of judgment. Moon exalted. The glorification of feelings. The mother which 
always pardons the errant child. Mars in detriment. The assertion of the ego at the expense of 
others' failures. 

In the white book, the Moon exalted. The potential to recognize that not everyone can 
understand. The first thing that happens to the person that is projecting out their answer and not

They are not ready for it. It is not the right time. It is not the right moment. It is not the right 
place. Because of that, they have the sense of "They don't understand me. Why don't they 
understand me?" Then there is this sense of "Maybe they will. It is too bad that they do not 
understand." There is this sense of "Poor them. I have to be patient with them," instead of

The other side is: The potential to take advantage of the lack of understanding in others. Here

Venus exalted. Where art is more valued than the artist. Understanding and collecting answers

Pluto in detriment. The rationalization of irresponsibility as an act of refocalization. They need to

The potential to enjoy the formulas with no regard to their practical application. None. It is just a

4.4 The Liar 

We reach the upper trigram and get to the resonance of the first line, the Pleasure and the

Sun exalted. Fantasy protects and nurtures a sense of purpose and reason, no matter how

This is pretending to understand, which can be wonderful. It can be very artistic. It helps to be

The potential to find or illustrate the formulas through fantasy. What really happens to these

The other side is: The potential danger to see the fantasy as fact. This is because the moment

Here we come to a real key to the nature of what the whole logical process is about. The fifth

The nature of seduction in terms of the logic process is the universalizing element of answers.

Allowing others to assume responsibility as a shield against potential punishment. You have to

Jupiter exalted. Unearned reward and recognition. Pluto in detriment. A life of lip service to

The potential to succeed through the understanding of others. Logic is a collective process and

The potential for cynicism that comes with always having to acknowledge the understanding of 
others. They have to 

understand you in order that you can get your understanding out. These people can be very

4.6 Excess 

Here you get to the sixth line, to the roof of the house and this line of transition. This is actually a

The line is called Excess. Repeated and conscious abuse of norms will not escape discipline. In

haven't been open to understanding. 

Mercury exalted. The development through experience of techniques to apply self-restraint. 
These people do not offer you their answers. They are looking for something else. They are

The other side of this has Mars in detriment. The gall to accept punishment as the price of 
excess. "Well, I don't want to understand so I am not going to school. I will not be what you think 
I should be. I am more interested in going out and living my life. The answer is not important to

In the white book, Mercury exalted. The potential in a logical process to recognize when the 
understanding is not complete and have the patience to wait out the process. The answer does

Mars in detriment. Despite recognizing the incompleteness a lack of patience with the process.

These are people who always wonder whether they have a life. What is very funny about these

17. Can I get an opinion? Will the facts help me? 

When you come to the 4.6, the logical gate, it is looking for the life. It is looking for an idea. It is

HEXAGRAM 5 WAITING 

The gate of Waiting. The fundamental attunement to natural rhythms. Waiting as an active state of 
awareness. The channel 5/15 is universal in all forms of life on this planet. Rhythm is the miracle of what 
it is to be alive. Whenever I deal with people that have the 5, 1 tell them the same thing: "Pay attention to 
your life and see what your natural rhythm is, and then fix it. If you discover that every day at four o'clock 
you like to have a siesta and you need that hour of rest because it is important for you, when you 
recognize that it is an important rhythm in your life, fix it and make it a habit, a ritual." Concentration 
needs the proper patterns to work through. The moment you realize that this is your ritual, a natural 
rhythm for you, you are using your energy properly. 

It is so important for 5's to be ritualistic, to recognize their natural rhythms and to fix them. In this form of 
waiting, fixing your natural rhythm is an active state of awareness. It is not awareness but a state. The 
moment that you are following your fixed natural rhythm, anything is possible because the energy is 
right. When the energy is right, anything is possible in the logic process. 

5.1 Perseverance 

The first line always speaks for the essence of a hexagram and the first line is Perseverance. If the captain 
must, he goes down with the ship. Understand what that means: if you notice that every day at four 
o'clock you are fatigued, then you need to rest. You fix this as a ritual in your life. Nobody is allowed to 
telephone you. Nobody is allowed to come and visit you. Nobody is allowed to disturb you. You are in 
your nice apartment building on the 39th floor and, all of a sudden, you hear a fire alarm while you are 
lying there on your sofa during your ritualized, fixed time. If the captain must, he goes down with the 
ship. Don't break your ritual. You may die in the fire, but 99 times out of a hundred you won't. Everybody 
else will have burnt apartments, but you will be fine and they will say, "Why didn't you come out?" You 
answer, "I was just lying down having my nap." 

If the captain must, he goes down with the ship. Don't let anybody interfere with your fixed rhythm and 
your ritual. If you need to eat at 8 o'clock in the morning and your lover says, "I eat at 11 o'clock," let 
your lover eat alone. Eat at 8 o'clock in the morning. This is the nature of this line. 

Mars exalted. Here again, the loveliness of what Mars can be. Courage in the face of adversity. "I am not 
going to respond. I stay here in my ritual no matter what, and nobody will take me out of it." This is the 
power that lies in this fifth gate. 

The Earth in detriment. The premature and often disastrous urge to cut one's losses. This is the moment in 
which, because there is no awareness (we are dealing with energy here), the ritual can be given up. "I will 
leave the apartment. 

It is okay if it burns but I want to save my life." They will die and the apartment won't burn. This is the 
irony of these things. 

The power to maintain one's own rhythm; or Weakness in maintaining one's rhythm when challenged. 
That is why Mars is so powerful in the exalted. Understand the basis of what this hexagram is saying; it is 
so important. No logical process can be a success without a fixed rhythm. You can't just study 24 hours 
and then go and pass an exam. If you study 20 minutes a day for two weeks, you might. You have to 
establish the proper rhythm and fix what works for you. This is what logic demands and it is also what 
leadership demands: rituals. Wte have flags and people who salute. We have all these rituals of state. Wte 
need all these fixed rituals; otherwise, the understanding process does not work. 

5.2 Inner Peace 

The second line has such a nice name, Inner Peace. The second and the fifth line both have Pluto in 
detriment. That Pluto experience is coming up in 2000 to 2002. We will have a lot of children coming 
into the world who will carry this energy deep inside of them, and there is going to be an explosion of 
discomfort out of that. 

Second lines are always projecting outwards. This line is projecting outwards that they have their fixed 
rhythm. "I have my natural fixed rhythm." That is what they are projecting out into the world. It may or 
may not be true. The ability to ignore the temptation to take premature action. These people project 
outwards the ability that they will not take premature action and that they live out their natural rhythm. 
They are projecting out that natural rhythm to others. 

Venus exalted. The gift of maintaining composure through idealizing tranquility. Pluto in detriment. Inner 
peace experienced as stagnation. It may be one thing to say "This is my natural rhythm," but that rhythm 
in itself may not be producing anything. So many people that have the 5 and the 15 have to spend so 
much time in their life doing nothing. This is all about being in the flow. Being in the flow does not mean 
that you are always moving. It means that you move, you rest, you move, you rest.... People who have the 
5 and people who have the 15 go through periods where they can't move; there is nothing to do. They 
suffer because of that and then they run around like crazy and then they suffer because of that. There is 
nothing to do and then they suffer because of that and then. 

In the white book, we have: The power to be comfortable with one's rhythm. This is what is being 
projected outwards: this comfort. Also: The drive for power that is constrained by a fixed rhythm. In the 
moment that the fixed rhythm does not feel good, they do not really know whether that is their natural 
rhythm or if they are living out a projected rhythm which they take for their natural rhythm, but it is 
stagnating because it does not take them anywhere. They do not feel like it is productive and in that 
moment, they may start looking for some other kind of rhythm and break their ritual. "Yes, I used to have 
a nap everyday at four o'clock but one day my apartment was on fire and I ran out." Now, I don't nap 
anymore because it is bad luck. 

They break from what they were projecting as their natural rhythm, and suddenly you find out that is not 
what they are at all. That is the child that says, "Every night from 7 o'clock to 8 o'clock I do my studies." 
One day you go over there and you open the door; you find the window open and they have been gone for 
hours because that fixed rhythm was leading to stagnation. Of course, they don't know underneath 
whether it is really their natural rhythm; there is this temptation to break that and try something else, with 
predictable results. 

5.3 Compulsiveness 

When we get to the third line, it has a very intense name, Compulsiveness. We know that this third line is 
about trial and error. One of the things to recognize about that is everybody who has the 5.3 is always 
convinced that their rhythm is a mistake. If they are lying flat on their back and they cannot move a 
muscle, they are sure that it is a mistake. They are sure that they should do something. If they are running 
around like mad and they cannot stop running around, they are convinced that it is a mistake because they 
are sure that they should be on vacation somewhere, lying flat on their back and doing nothing. They have 
a great deal of difficulty in accepting what their natural rhythm is because there is always this sense that 
there is something wrong with it. 

The fear engendered by the sense of helplessness resulting in unnecessary stress and activity. This sense 
of helplessness: "I have this rhythm and I am stuck with it, and I don't really like it. I want to be able to be 
busy or I am out being busy and I want to rest. I don't really like this." 

Neptune exalted. Compulsiveness can be limited in its negative effects through Nights of imagination.

HEXAGRAM 6 CONFLICT 

We have the 6th gate in the channel of Mating, a design focused on reproduction: Conflict, the gate of

that from meeting people who will have planets in those positions and are going to fix you in one end of 
the wave or the other. You have the transits that do that, as in any other process in the chart. The thing to 
recognize about the hope and pain wave, and I will illustrate that to you as we go through the lines, is that 
it operates in each part of the line. There is a hope and pain aspect to every part of these lines, whether we 
call them exalted or in detriment. The exalted will have a hope and pain wave and the detriment will have 
a hope and pain wave. It is not that the wave is going from one to the other. Don't confuse that. 

The 6th gate is the gate of the pH in our biology and this is what establishes the barriers. If you look at the

There are many things in that. The 6th gate is the place where the motor sits. That is the motor that

sterile. That is the other side. 

The 6th gate carries within it this law that growth cannot exist without the motor. That is why, the

In a sense, what you are really seeing is that out of the 6 and out of its motor come those three streams.

6.1 Retreat 

We start with the first line. We are talking about the foundation of intimacy, about the line of 
introspection, and it says Retreat. This is one of the first things to recognize about the nature of the 
emotional system: when it comes to intimacy, the very first lesson of this hexagram is to wait. It is about 
retreat. Wait and see. The Realization that wasting one's resources against overwhelming odds is not 
courage but folly. The moment that you step into that role relationship (the 59th gate is the role in which 
you find intimacy) you have to be very clear because you are in the wave. What felt good today can feel 
terrible tomorrow and there is nothing that you can do about that. 

Pluto exalted. The power of regeneration that can embrace retreat as a phase and not as a failure. On the 
other side: The inferiority complex, where retreat is experienced as personal weakness. What we have 
here in the first line is the wave of weakness and strength. This is the nature of all intimacy. This is the 
foundation after all. What has to be examined, what has to be looked into, what the introspection is, is 
into the weakness and the strength. Both of them have to be revealed. One of the things that I remind 
emotional people is that when you meet somebody, tell them, "I am an emotional person. You may not 
like me tomorrow." If they are ready to take a chance and see what you are like tomorrow, everything will 
be a little bit easier in your relationship. But if they discover that themselves, you will get all that wave 
back on you because they are going to mirror that emotional wave. 

The emotional stability to accept conflict. Think about how that emotional stability works with a wave of 
weakness and strength. You can feel weak and in that moment you accept intimacy. It does not mean that 
you are unstable because you are weak. You can be very stable and recognize that you are weak, and you 
need the intimacy to give yourself strength. At the same time, you can have the emotional stability to 
accept intimacy from the strength of your wave. Guess what? You get both because it is the wave. The 
thing to recognize about looking at any aspect of any line in any hexagram in the emotional system is that 
the line is always going to work both ways. It is going to work for both sides of the wave and everything 
in between as it moves through the arc of that wave. So you will always get both sides. If it is fixed, you 
get both sides of the side that is fixed. 

Emotional instability in times of conflict. When you are weak and unstable, you will accept intimacy, or 
when you're strong and unstable, you will accept intimacy. It does not make any difference. It is still 
going to operate in the wave. You will always get both ends. The nature of this first line tells us the most 
important thing about all of our bonding. To recognize so clearly that we, as the byproducts of our 
parents' relationships and all of the children that have ever been brought into the world, have been 
brought into the world ignorantly. We have been brought into the world based on these genetic 
imperatives that are much more powerful than we are. 

The very first step that we can take in lowering the chaos level in the world at the moment is to honor the 
first rule of the law of growth: don't be in such a hurry to create the growth. This law says: better that it is 
a fine tree than a lot of weeds. % it and see where the seed should be planted and when the seed should be 
planted and with whom before one goes out and decides that life is going to end up as a garden. This is 
very important because we do not listen when it comes to our emotions. Emotions make us deaf and 
blind. When it comes to intimacy it can make us deaf and blind and dumb. The first law is, "Wait a 
second. You are very nice. I would have married you yesterday but today I don't feel like it. I wait and 
check it out and I will see." This is the foundation of the house of intimacy.

recognizing whether they are the right relationship for you. If not, don't have anything to do with it

The whole thing is that, unlike the third line which is all about any kind of genetic material as long as it is

6.6 The Peacemaker 

When you get to the sixth line, you get to the top of the house. You get to the line of transition. This sixth

they say, "I am not going to have children because the world is awful," or "I am not going to have 
children because I can't be sure that it will be a better world." This has nothing to do with the nature of 
direct intimacy and in that sense it can be something that can appear to be deeply apathetic. 

This is the wave of sympathy and apathy. It is in resonance to the role of the One Night Stand. I remind

Remember, this is the defense circuit. This is where life is being generated. The law of growth for

Venus in detriment. The peacemaker whose actions are just but whose terms are unacceptable. I know

In the Book of Letters: The emotional power to end conflict tempered by feelings and sensitivity to

HEXAGRAM 7 THE ARMY 

This is one of the Sphinx gates and essentially, in many ways, the most influential. This is a gate that

up in the logic system with all kinds of committees and all kinds of discussions and research. 

Experimentation is the goal of the logical process and, unlike the 13th gate which is there to look 
backwards and to accumulate past experience for the advantage of society, the 7th gate looks out of the 
window of the car into the future. It is saying: this is a straight road. It seems that everything is going to 
be okay for the next couple of hundred kilometers. Above the lines it says: The point of convergence. 
This is the place where the future of humanity comes to a point. It is a very important one for us. 
Humanity needs the security of safe, reliable patterns. By design, the need for leadership to guide and 
order society. The most important thing is for humanity to realize that it is hierarchical. Society needs to 
be ordered and guided and there are those who guide and those who are guided, and those you order and 
those who are ordered. It is the nature of the logical way that the pattern is built on a hierarchical 
structure. 

Think about what the 7 does. It establishes a pattern and because of the pattern being for the future, if that 
pattern can be expressed, it can become influential. We are looking at a classic example at what happens 
with the collective process. At the end of the Second World War, most of Asia was deeply poor and the 
Americans, as they entered into Europe, invested in infrastructure in Japan. The Japanese started to make 
factories to produce goods that would be exported, not goods that would be for their own market. They 
became successful at that, as we all know. They became an enormously successful society creating large 
infrastructure projects to create large amounts of manufactured goods to export into the world in order to 
make a living. That became a pattern that, by its very success, became influential and that pattern was 
passed on to other Asian societies, so that we suddenly had an age of so-called Asian tigers. All of these 
Asian tigers together have been following this pattern for prosperity. They have been building all these 
factories in order to sell those goods overseas. 

Nobody paid attention to the fact that, if you follow that pattern long enough, you get to a point where 
there is nothing but factories and nobody to buy the goods. This year (1997) with Saturn in 21 now and 
before, because it has been in a retrograde process, we have an enormous financial crisis in the world. The 
logic system is there to provide us with secure patterns. Unfortunately, unless those patterns are properly 
tested and experimented with, we can always end up with difficulties and then society goes into a state of 
chaos because without the reliable pattern everything falls apart. The vast majority of the middle class in 
Asia has lost at least half of their life's savings in the last three months. Humanity has been shocked by a 
pattern that appeared to operate properly, but when it finally got out to full maximum experimentation, 
suddenly it turned out to be an enormous problem. This pattern cannot be repaired because it is a pattern. 

What will be required is mutation and that mutation does not exist in the world right now to be able to 
deal with that dilemma. It still has a long way to go before the cards are played out. The 7th gate is there 
to provide us with secure patterns for the future but, like my illustration, it does not mean that the pattern 
is necessarily going to work in the long run. This is what the individual role does. It knows that time is 
everything and that only time is truly the test, but the logic system is desperate to get things out into the 
world, desperate to get the energy to get their experiment out into the world. The moment that an 
experiment works, does not mean that we should jump on the band wagon. It has to be tested over and 

over again. The nature of the role of the self in interaction: what is the role of leadership for humanity?

7.1 The Authoritarian

Leadership whose authority must be absolute and is sanctioned by society in times of crisis. That is when

This is what is expected. This is what humanity sees as the greatest value of a leader, which is that the 
leader is there to guide us in times of crisis. This is when leaders are important to us. If you go back

trial or turmoil or war. So the general, this form of leadership, is called upon in times of crisis. In other

Moving down from the throat center, we move to the polarity gates, gates that point up to the throat from

8.1 Honesty 

First lines always speak of the essence of a hexagram and this first line is called Honesty. It says, The 
truthful acceptance of limitation and the recognition that it can only be transcended through sharing. This 
is so important: the individual is always limited because nothing in the individual process can actually 
flower unless it is being accepted either by the collective or the tribe. We have already seen that social 
pressures are going to be very important in the development of an individual life. This 8th gate is a deep 
recognition that the individual is there to guide the collective. After all, the 1st gate which is on the other 
side is one of the four gates of the Sphinx. This is a gate of direction and it is part of the central column 
that runs up and it is all about a mutative process. 

The 8th gate expresses the identity of the individual that says, "I will share with you my knowing for your 
benefit." That is the individual process. "I want to be able to contribute my knowing, my recognition, my 
capacity to explain to you what the direction is and I want to share that with you for your benefit so that 
you won't hurt me because I am different than you are." 

On one side you have Neptune exalted. The awareness that the whole is always greater than the sum of its 
parts. This is a deep recognition, the understanding that nothing, the knowing in that sense, is complete 
unless it involves the totality. This is the beginning of the process of the individual acting as an agent of 
change in the world because they recognize that they must penetrate into the collective. 

On the other side of this, the Mercury in detriment. Withdrawal. The fear of losing individuality in a 
group environment. This is the fundamental fear of all individuality. "I know that I can make a 
contribution to the collective but does that mean that then I have to be just like them, when I don't want 
to? I can contribute by directing them but I don't want to be like them because I can't. I can only be like 
me. " This fear is underneath. 

In the white book: Knowing that creative expression must be honestly communicated and shared. 
Understand that the 8/1 is the channel of the Creative Role Model. This is about being an example and not 
being a leader (that is logical), not being a witness (that is abstract). It is about being an example. An 
example does not dictate. An example acts out its example in the hope that that can be a contribution to 
the totality. 

The other side: The design to share creativity at the expense of individuality. "Yes, we love your 
contribution but from now on you have to make your contribution on Mondays, V*dnesdays and Fridays 
from 10 to 12." This is always the threat to the individual. There is a balancing point between maintaining 

one's individuality and reaching out to the collective. All of my definition is individual and I have gone 
through this process all of my life. I deal with you as a collective. I have found a medium for that because 
I happen to be an individual that can explain myself. In being able to explain myself, I can connect to the 
collective but believe me, I am different than you and I know that and nothing about you will change me. 
The joke is that I want to make a contribution for you. After all, the individual is doing that to protect 
itself. That is number one. 

The second thing is if it works, the individual feels very good about that. Connecting to the collective is 
important. There is no Human Design System without the collective. The individual becomes stronger in 
that, whether or not it is connected to the ego. If it becomes egotistical about it, that is another story but 
they do become stronger and they do contribute to protect themselves. 

Please understand: that is by design the only genetic path for mutation. After all, it is for others. In the 
end, this contribution is there to provide mutation. By the way, that mutation can be good or bad. You can 
bring disease into the world as an individual and you can kill half the population. You can bring a mental 
virus into the world that destroys the way people see the world or think. I mean, everything is possible in 
the nature of what mutation is. It is just about the process but in that sense it is always about offering. 
That is why the third line says it is a phony. When we get to the third line, we get to that story. 

8.2 Service 

When you get to the second line, you get to projection. You are dealing here with a gate that says, "I 
know that I can make a contribution or not." When you get to the second line, they are projecting 
outwards the fact that they are there to make a contribution. It is the great line of service. Remember the 
nature of making a contribution: they are making it without really recognizing what is being contributed 
as a direction. They do not really have the depth. They just project out that they can make a contribution. 

Service. The highest good, to serve selflessly. The Earth in detriment, where reward is a prerequisite of 
service. It is a very simple line. In the white book: The potential to be an example through unselfish 
expression; or The willingness to be an example for a price. One or the other. These are the kind of people 
that will guide you through the city. You pay them and they'll guide you. They will take you along and 
they will leave you off when they are finished with you. They can do a very good job, individually, taking 
the collective on a tour and you pay them and later they'll leave you. Or they will do it selflessly: the lost 
tourist in the city and somebody comes very nicely and takes them on a tour and shows them where 
everything is. It can be selfless. It can be for pay but they do not really know what they are contributing. 
Because of that, they are projecting out that they can make the contribution but maybe they can't. 

Second lines can be paper tigers. They can always be putting out this genetic signal that says, "I can make 
a contribution," and when they are asked to make the contribution, they may not be able to fulfill it and 
then they go through the crisis of all individuality: when it cannot fulfill its example then it is shunned. 
The collective will not pay any attention anymore. 

My favorite description for the 8th hexagram is the taxi driver. This is really what the 8th hexagram is all 
about. You get into their car and they'll drive you along. They will take you from place to place. This is 
their nature but they are not there to stay with you. They are there to go through this directive process and 
make their contribution. So many people that have the 8th gate are disturbed by the fact that they can 
make a valid contribution for others but those others soon forget. They go on to other things. 

This is about the selflessness of the individual that is necessary. The joy comes from being yourself. The 
contribution to society allows you to maintain your integrity as an individual because they will leave you 
alone if you can make a contribution. Everybody thought that I was crazy until I had a book published and 

then it was risky. Then they said, "Well, he made his contribution. We can leave him alone now. We don't 
have to worry about whether we should put him into a strait jacket." 

8.3 The Phony 

We get to the end of the lower trigram. Remember that lower trigrams are only concerned about the 
nature of the gate itself. This is the line of John Paul U. You can enjoy my analysis of that. 

The acceptance of the style and not the substance of communal actions. Again, all third lines are lines of 
adaptation. They are the basis of trial and error. They are based on this learning process. What is 
recognized in that learning process is that the individual cannot survive unless they find a way, a mode, a 
role, a mask, a style for being able to connect to the collective. What happens to people that have the 8.3 
is that they look for the right kind of style. Jean Paul II found his style. He has a tall hat, a stake and they 
all have their costumes. Through that style, even though he is very individual, something is expressed to 
the collective. The collective gets access to his guidance, to his example, because he is a master of that 
style. To be a phony is neither positive nor negative. It is simply the real description of what this is. The 
style is everything. 

The Moon exalted. The perfected and rarely detected superficial intimacy. This is classic of the 
individual: the style to create the intimacy and yet, at the same time, a deep protection that says, "Hey, I 
am still this individual." 

The other side has Saturn in detriment. A shallowness that underestimates others and overestimates its 
own ability to continue its deception without detection. Style is style. It is not substance. This is the 
individual playing out a role and, in playing out that role, they make mistakes and grow out of that 
process. 

In the white book: The example as an expression through style, not substance; or An over-reliance and 
unfounded confidence in style. These are people that when the collective is not interested in them and 
their style has not worked, they cannot figure out why. "Why didn't it work? I mean I look like a guru, I 
talk like a guru. Why didn't anybody come?" Style is not always the real thing but it helps individuals to 
have a mask. The individual pretends to be like the collective. 

8.4 Respect 

When you get to the upper trigram in this gate of contribution that is designed to connect to the collective, 
you get to transpersonal gates. So you get to the innate ability within the individual in this line: to be able 
to reach out to the community or the tribe. This line is called Respect. Remember that fourth lines are all 
about being fixed and onetracked but they are also deeply opportunistic, waiting for those opportunities. 

The gift of naturally recognizing the contributions of others and particularly, the acknowledgement of 
those who lead by example. Jupiter exalted. The uncompromising drive to assimilate. Remember 
something about the 8: it is looking to the other side, to the 1. The 1 is the yang force. This is the creative 
direction in life. This is the individual creative expression. You can imagine that the 1 is the artist and the 
8 is the gallery dealer. That is their relationship. 

The capacity in the 8.4 is to recognize the value of the creative potential on the other side and to see that 
that creative potential, through their contribution, is something that can affect the totality. It is the art 
dealer that sees the starving painter and looks at the paintings and thinks, "Oh, my god. This is 
wonderful." He puts it into his shop and all of a sudden, they become well-known because that 
contribution has been made. 

On the other side: Mercury in detriment. In a group where limitation is transcended, reason alone cannot 
predict individual worth. As an example, the acknowledged leader of an athletics team is not necessarily 
the most talented. The individual who is fixed on making a contribution can be the one that really 
becomes the leader and the example in that sense. This example of an athletic team: you may have an 
athlete on that team who is somebody whose very spirit is about making a selfless contribution to the 
nature of how that team operates. They are the ones that will ultimately get the attention of the team and 
be a de facto leader by the quality of their example. What is being very fixed here is the fixed 
communication, the fixed expression of direction that the 8.4 knows it must make. 

In the white book: The drive to contribute and be an example to and for others, and on the other side: A 
gift for contribution that is not conditioned by limitations. This is a very positive line. These people can 
be very one -tracked. What happens to them is that they are very positive for everybody else but they 
suffer a great deal themselves. These are people that are always making a contribution and they don't 
necessarily feel like they are recognized for the contribution they are making. Remember that there is an 
intrinsic honesty in the resonance to the first line here in the fourth line. There is an honesty about who 
can really lead and who can't, who can really be an example and who can't. When they make their 
contribution, there is a sense that nobody is paying attention to them. The 8th gate can often feel unloved 
for its contribution and, of course, the sphinx gates are not about love. They are about direction. 

This is one of those things for all 8th gates to deal with: they have a capacity to contribute to others and 
make that contribution without necessarily being rewarded. That does not mean that they do not get the 
reward but it does mean that it is much more difficult because they are individual. 

I want to make a comment on the end of this line where it says that they are not necessarily the most 
talented. One of the keys to individuality: individuals are not here to be best. The moment that an 
individual thinks that they have to be the best, it is over. The best is for the collective. That is a collective 
thing. That is mastery, experimentation, to get to the point where you are really the best. But the 
individual is here to be different. They don't have to be the most talented athlete to be the focus of 
attention and to be the example that guides others. They just have to be themselves. 

Whenever I deal with individuals, I always remind them of that: "Do not punish yourself in thinking that 
you have to be the best. You never ever have to be the best. You only have to be yourself. If you are 
yourself, you will be recognized and if you try to be the best, you will not." Understand the principle of 
that. The collective process is about comparing and the individual process is not. So, the moment you are 
trying to be best, it is all a comparison game and it has nothing to do with being individual. 

8.5 Dharma 

First lines always tell you the essence of what that hexagram is about and fifth lines are always about how 
it is seen from the outside. The way that this individual contribution is seen from the outside is as 
something that is rooted in separation. In other words, the way in which the outside sees the individual 
through this fifth line is: "Let us take advantage of their direction but leave them once we get there." This 
is great line of the taxi driver. This line is called Dharma. Holding together does not exclude eventual 
separation. Successful union, after a proper term, will encourage separation. The fledgling once mature is 
expected to leave the nest. This is right action that does not harm the integrity of the union. 

It is very important for these people to recognize that other people need their direction but once they have 
it, it does not mean that they must go away; it means that they must be allowed to go away. In other 
words, for the person that has the 8.5, they can always make the contribution of direction but who they 
make that contribution to isn't necessarily going to be consistent. 

We have two ways of looking at that. One way is the exalted side with Jupiter, The teacher. The other is 
the Sun in detriment. The parent that cannot let go of the child, understanding only that its authority is 
being challenged. "I know what is best for you," says the parent. 

In the white book: Contribution as part of a process of sharing that accepts and expects limitation, 
exemplified in teaching. The ultimate goal of the individual teacher is to have students that not only 
transcend them but leave them. "Here, you have the knowledge. Go away. I do not want to see you again. 
Take the knowledge and do your thing." This is the essence of that one side. It is okay that you are not 
going to be there for the rest of this person's life. 

On the other side, in the detriment, is this sense of loss in the capacity to make that contribution: 
somebody accepts that contribution and all of a sudden they are gone. They have this sense of loss that 
they cannot continue to live out this role of contributing. Contribution as an end in itself that neither 
accepts nor expects limitation, exemplified by the parent that cannot let go of the child. 

The ideal is that when you are the 8.5 taxi driver, when you get to where they have to go, you have to let 
them out. You cannot keep them in the back seat. They have to pay you and go. Otherwise, you have a 
real problem. This is the nature of the 8.5, this recognition. Remember that it is projected on them that 
they can make the selfless contribution. "This one will take me. This one will guide me." Every time that 
individual is being asked for their guidance (and they are always looking for that out of the 8th gate), in 
that moment, this is a very important energy for them to come into contact with. 

It is difficult when that energy is gone unless one accepts the nature of what this role is: to make that 
contribution and recognize that it is not about fixing something for life. Again, that is the protection of the 
individual, not to get caught up in who you contribute to and end up being conditioned by them, away 
from your true nature. "You were so good at driving me in a taxi. Now I let you drive my bus." 

Think about the dilemma of the 8. You have the 8 and you go into a department store and somebody 
comes up to you and says, "Can you tell me where the such-and-such department is?" The 8 is always 
going to be asked for their service, no matter where they are. They are always going to be mistaken for 
people that can take you where you have to go. They are under a lot of pressure because of that. 

8.6 Communion 

When you get to the sixth line, you get to the end of the process and you get to Communion. It says: The 
certainty which grows out of harmony. Venus exalted. The awareness of patterns that ensures correct 
timing. This is one of the things that come out of the individual process which is the recognition that, 
without the correct timing, because individuals are rooted in their moods, contribution may not be 
successful. We all know this in one way or another, where you offer to make a contribution to somebody, 
to offer them direction. If you offer it at the wrong time, nothing is going to work, even if you are very 
clear. If you offer it at the right time, even if you are not clear, they are more open to it. Everything about 
the contribution of the individual to society is rooted in a sense of timing. 

Pluto in detriment. Doubt which may engender regret even in the most ideal circumstances. The polarity 
in the white book: The gift of knowing when to contribute creatively; or Uncertainty in timing and regret 
despite circumstances. Sixth lines are not about to make a contribution. Like all sixth lines, there is a 
restrictive process within them. It is a process that says, "Yes, but will this contribution lead to mutation?" 
In other words, if I am a taxi driver, I will only take somebody from A to B if it is going to change the 
world and if it will not change the world, why should I bother and just be the conduit of that? Is it really 
of value? Deep in the individual process is this ongoing need to find a way to bring mutation into the 

world. The sixth line is saying, "All right, I will make that contribution, but it has to be mutative. It has to 
be something that really is going to be of value." 

The knowing when to contribute is the recognition of patterns. Individuals need to come to grips with 
that. They have to understand the collective and the tribe because if they don't understand the others, if 
they do not understand their patterns, it will be much more difficult for them to make a contribution at the 
right time that can be mutative. 

Think about how that works. Several years ago, Martin Grassinger was doing homoeopathic work with 
one of his patients. They had a problem and he had the right medicine which he gave them but it did not 
work. This was in the early years, when we first met and I said, "Well, take a look at the transits and see 
when that part of the body is connected." It had to do with the face. It was somebody who had an open 
ajna and an open throat center. So, there was a transit coming, a nodal transit to the 43/23 that would 
connect the open centers, so that this medicine which is designed for the pituitary gland could actually get 
to these glands. He told the person to come back again and that he had found something that really 
worked (the same medicine). He gave the patient this medicine during the nodal transit which lasted two 
months and the problem cleared up. 

The success of individual contribution is determined by timing. If you give the right medicine at the 
wrong time, it means nothing. What happens is that this individual gets caught up in this process of 
"Where is the right cosmic moment?" It is not just the mundane timing. It is the timing that unleashes this 
process, unleashes this possibility, so that this contribution can lead to mutation. 

HEXAGRAM 9 THE TAMING POWER OF THE SMALL 

We move to the logic process and take a look at rituals and patterns. Two of the 64 hexagrams use the 
word 'taming' and there are two that use the word 'small'. The small has to do with the nature of detail. 
The ability to tame is the ability to master the nature of the detail. The 9th gate is the gate of the mastery 
of the energy for detail. This is the format energy of the logical process. One of the most difficult things 
in the nature of what it is to be human, with the configuration that we have, is to establish logic in the 
world. How difficult it is to establish understanding in the world because understanding does not have the 
same access to energy as other processes. It does not have the same easy access to energy as the abstract, 
the experiential process has. In order for us to establish logic and understanding in the world, it is quite an 
ordeal to find the energy. 

With the 9th and the fifth hexagrams, two gates of the sacral, we look at essential energy to manifest logic 
and understanding in the world so that we can be properly organized and, in being properly organized, we 
can have a relative perspective into the future. Only three gates provide energy for logic, the 58, the 9 and 
the 52. They are a long way from having an opportunity to be able to manifest and most of the logic and 
understanding that gets into the world is generated rather than manifested. Generated logic is quite 
different because it is logic that can only come out of response: out of response to a need for the logic. 

Above the lines it says: Potential can be fulfilled through detailed attention to all pertinent aspects. Don't 
confuse this with a mental perspective. It is not mental. This is pure energy. This is the energy to fulfill 
the potential through attention. This channel is all about being focused and concentrated. This is a deep 
concentrating and focusing field. 

9.1 Sensibility 

When we were looking at the abstract process, we saw that the 42 has resources of energy. What we see 
in the 9th hexagram is that we have a resource for concentration, what we call attention. The attention is 
there. We don't know out of this what the attention span is. Just like the 42 has to go to the 29 to find its 
commitment, the 9 has to go to the 5 to find out what its pattern must be. To be focused and concentrated 
is never enough. This is the beginning of a process. It is a process that says, in the first line, Sensibility. A 
balanced and responsible approach to problem solving. Pluto exalted. The ability to avoid frustration 
through the creation of new forms. The reality is that the focus here is not simply on the given, which is, 
"I have the capacity for attention". What is more important is how do I maintain that capacity for 
attention? 

Mars in detriment. After a hasty and frustrating search, the urge to kick in the door when the key is in 
your pocket. This is not recognizing what the pattern is. This is all about simply having this energy for 
concentration but not knowing where to concentrate, on what to concentrate. You think that if you 
concentrate on remembering where the keys are, somehow that will work. When it doesn't, when you 
can't go in there and find them, you get very frustrated and kick in the door. 

In the white book we have: The power in focusing to create new forms; or The power to generate that will 
lose its focus. Please understand this: this is about attention. % all know from children that to maintain 
their attention, either you fix their pattern or you cannot hold their attention. Otherwise, they will just 
move from this thing to the next because they do not have an extended attention span. That is why we 
need, in the logical process, to have a codified system that develops our logic. Vita have to learn the 
patterns of logic. This is very important for us because if we don't have the pattern, we can have the 
energy for the logical process but not know what to do with it. These people become deeply restless. They 
can focus their attention but on what? and how? and when? This is what they don't know. 

By the way, Pluto is coming in the 9th gate by the end of 1997. Pluto will transit this gate for three years. 
When it says, A balanced and responsible approach to problem solving, it is not saying 'a balanced and 
responsible approach to solving problems.' It is the process that gets to eventually solving a problem. 

9.2 Misery loves company 

What happens when you get to the second line, Misery loves company, the projection that is coming out 
of the second line is: "I can solve the problem because I can focus." This is not how the problem is 
solved. It is one necessary aspect in order to solve a problem eventually, but this is the illusion that is 
caught up in the projection. So many students of mine over the years, the typical 9.2 students, study and 
focus all the time and they don't actually learn anything. They study books all day and study the same 
thing over and over again and nothing really comes out of that. That is the potential in this. To solve the 
problem is not the same as problem solving. This is a process that this line projects out. 

Misery loves company. Remember, we are in the collective here, so it is social. Collaboration with others 
to temper frustration. They are projecting out: "I can solve the problem. I can concentrate." With that, 
they get the energy around them that others say, "Okay, we will join in that process of concentration." 
Remember that the logic process is a collective process, like a laboratory full of scientists all working on 
the same thing in order to solve the problem. Science generally is a collective process. Logic works in the 
collective field. 

Jupiter in detriment. The overwhelming need for expansion can lead to errors in judgment, missed 
opportunities and depression. The child that says, "But I study, why didn't I pass? I stared at it all day. It 
got my full attention. I was focused on it." That is the whole thing about the second line: what is projected 
out does not necessarily have the depth behind it. It is not introspective. It is just projecting out, "I can 
solve the problems because I can focus." That is not solving the problem. That's the way to solving a 
problem. 

9.3 The Straw that breaks the camels back 

This third line is an archetype like the 42.3. It is The overlooked minor element that always predetermines 
failure. Whenever you see the word failure or mistake in a third line, it is okay because this is exactly 
where it is supposed to be. It does not mean that there is anything terrible about that at all. It just means 
that for certain in this third line, this process of bonds made and broken, of trial and error, of learning 
from mistakes, is going to be accentuated. 

Earth exalted. The use of force to temporarily overcome impediments. In other words, the moment that 
something is not working in the concentration, to put even more concentration on it. 

On the other side: Persistent force that saps vitality and turns molehills into mountains. These people will 
always miss something. There is always a moment in which their concentration breaks. There is a 
moment that the concentration just simply is not there and, in that moment, you can take the wrong turn 
and go for a long detour. In that moment, you can just miss, literally, what is there. What is missed can 
become an enormous thing. 

It is the logic process that makes the word 'mistake' ugly. The abstract people do not care about mistakes. 
Crisis is part of their way of life. But logical people get very upset with mistakes. "One and one is not two 
but three." "No, two." It is this whole process of, "That is a mistake; you have to correct that." It has to be 
right because the logic process has to be consistently provable for the collective. Making a mistake in the 
logic process can create a lot of deep anxiety in logical people because the very nature of logic is to 

eliminate the mistakes so that we can know for certain. "What is this formula: E=MC2? Let's make it 
certain. We'd better check that out. Otherwise, we scratch this thing away because we are not going to put 
that into the world and predict naturally into the future with that, unless we can be certain that this 
foundation is correct." 

What happens here in the third line is the miracle of what logic always needs. Logic always needs the 
illogic of a mistake because out of this can come so many wonders. That moment where there is 
something that is missed, that moment that everything breaks down and is a failure, that moment can turn 
into an enormous success. The classic example is of the scientist who, in the moment of losing their 
concentration, allows something to get too hot and explode. Out of that explosion comes something 
wonderful and, "Wow, that is amazing. How did that happen?" It is illogical and that makes them very 
uncomfortable. 

In the white book: The loss of power through the failure to focus. It is gone. You lose it in that moment. 
The power is gone and you can't focus and then something will be missed because the concentration was 
not there. 

On the other side of this: The power to turn a focus into an obsession. Mature 9.3 people have learned a 
lot, like so many people that carry the third line themes in their life. They get to learn a lot because they 
make what other people consider a lot of mistakes. Out of all their mistakes they learn many things that 
others don't get to learn. 

9.4 Dedication 

We come to our line of externalization, our line of being fixed. These people are fixed on the resonance of 
the first line. They are fixed on problem solving, on providing their energy for the logical process. This 
energy is basically the energy to be able to lead and to guide others through the experimentation with the 
logical process. This will eventually go all the way up to the leadership channel, the channel of being an 
alpha. So, it is about the process of gathering energy in order to guide humanity through understanding. 

This line is called Dedication. Regardless of the pressures or stress, the disciplined attention to detail. 
These people are fixed on being focused. These are people that must concentrate. 

Moon exalted. Right action that leads inevitably to actualization. Right action being the action to 
concentrate. This is what these people are there for: to live out clearly this fixed one way. Concentration 
is their way. Mars in detriment. The persistent urge to want to skip essential steps. In other words, I have 
concentrated enough. Now I want to act. This is not an awareness that can decide that. 

You have two sides of this in the white book: The power to act on the potential of the focus; or The drive 
for action that ignores the details. This need to generate: keep in mind that the logic process is under so 
much stress because it does not have easy access to energy. The people who carry the logical energy gates 
feel this enormous pressure on them to release their energy because the rest of the logical process wants it 
so that they can do their experiments and can actually lead and guide. There is a great deal of stress in that 
sense on the concentrating field from others. 

Remember, again: collective and social in this context. The key in that is that they have this power and 
they are externalizing this power. These are the people that help other people concentrate. If you have five 
kids studying together and one of them has the 9.4, the moment that one of them says, "Let's take a break 
and listen to some music," it will be the 9.4 that is saying, "No, we are here to focus and concentrate. 
We'd better get this done." Logic is collective. They have that power to keep everybody focused on that 
logical process. 

9.5 Faith 

This fifth line is so perverse. It is one of the most perverse lines in all of the I'Ching. It is very bizarre. We 
know that the fifth line is a line of universalization and we know that the fifth line, in the resonance to the 
second line, rather than projecting outwards is being projected upon. Look at the keynote of this line. It 
says, Faith. Faith has nothing to do with the logic process. This is a projection from the outside onto 
people who obviously have a concentrative skill. The projection from the outside is, "We have faith in 
them because they are concentrating. We have faith that the doctors will find a cure to... because they are 
concentrating on..." But, like the student that does not learn anything, they may not figure it out either. 
Nonetheless, this brings an element of the belief system into the logical process. It is, in that sense, that I 
call it perverse because this is very strange. 

As an overview: The trust that detailed adherence will lead to fulfillment. In other words, if you really 
concentrate, you will really get it. Well, maybe. This is after all the projection coming from the outside. 
The people who get that projection put on them are under all kinds of pressure to be able to fulfill that. 
Jupiter exalted. Loyalty to the letter of the law. That is, "You concentrate. You do not take off from that." 

Then this wonderful line in the black book: Earth in detriment. Like the mystery of God, doubt 
engendered through the perceived illogic of a process. "How can I have faith that I will find the solution 
when all I know to do is how to concentrate? There is something bizarre in all these people putting their 
faith and trust in me; just because I can stare all day does not mean that I will come up with a viable 
solution." In that, it brings an energy of doubt: "Is this all I have to do? Just concentrate?" Of course, it 
isn't. 

The power to focus and bring value to concentration; or Where the lack of power to concentrate leads to 
doubt. This strange abstract concept stuck in the middle of how we universalize the energy to be 
concentrated. If you have two kids and one of them studies and the other one never studies, and you ask 
their parents which one do they think is going to pass and do well, the parent that has the child that 
studies says, "I have faith that they will do all right. They are doing their work." The other parent says, 
"No, I do not have any faith because they are not concentrating." That does not mean that the one who 
does not concentrate fails and the concentrated one succeeds. This is the whole irony of this and this is 
why it brings doubt. It brings doubt because this is only an aspect in a very complex collective process of 
establishing logic in the world. 

9.6 Gratitude 

The sixth line is a very beautiful line because it carries with it a quality that you do not often see which is 
the quality of joy. There is joy that is clearly evident in the 9th and in the fifth hexagram as well. This is: 
The joy which comes with accepting small rewards for small victories. The real beauty of concentration is 
that it is there to provide power to solve something, to bring something ultimately into a fact. Each step 
along the way is really a value. As long as one is clear about what one is focused on, there can be 
enormous joy in that process, but we know the limitation of the sixth line, which is: there must be more to 
all of this. 

The greatest problem that sixth line logical people here have is that they are trying to look at the final 
solution, where everything has been worked out and the formulas have been established so they can say, 
"I will work for that. I will concentrate on that and get my joy out of getting there." But you cannot know 
in the logical process that you actually will get there. This line in the black book comes from an old 
Chinese saying, A journey of a thousand miles begins with the first step.' If you take the first step in 
agony, in anticipation of the rest of that journey, if you think that you will only take that first step, or that 

you cannot go to the end of that journey, you will never start on that road. This is the essence for the 
logical process. 

For the sixth line here, it is not about whether I can get to that final step or not; it is whether or not I can 
find joy in each step. They will not take that step and they will not concentrate unless each step is a joy. 
This is what it is all about for them. They have to have joy in this focus and concentration in their life. It 
has to make them feel good, not the solution but the process. After all, this is what it is all about. This is 
all about providing essential energy for a logical process and not for the solution. 

Pluto in detriment, No single step is of value until the journey is over. If there is no joy in each step, they 
will not get into it. They just won't and they learn that very quickly and then they start pulling back and 
they do not give their energy for the logical process. 

In the white book: Moon exalted. The power to enjoy the concentrating process. The Moon is bringing 
that quality out. The moment you see the Moon connected to a line, you know that this line is going to 
have a cycle. It is rising from a low to a peak and back to a low in its cycle and you know that you will go 
through all of these aspects. Somebody who has the Moon here exalted, at the beginning of their lunar 
cycle, that can be like the no-moon phase. They don't really enjoy it and the next day they enjoy it a little 
bit more and so on, until they reach a peak and then they start sliding down the other end. Logic is about 
repetition and it can get boring. 

The other side is: The energy for expression that cannot find joy in the process until it is complete. In the 
logic process, here is the ultimate joke: it is never complete. There will be people who will check out the 
Human Design System for as long as there are people who check out anything logically, whether or not 
generation after generation says that logic works. That is my old joke: when I was a student studying 
science, I had to do all these old formulas. Those formulas have been checked for hundreds of years, over 
and over again. The joke is, whenever I read in my favorite scientific journals that some old formula that 
everybody thought was cast in concrete and somebody found a mistake. The other day, they just 
discovered that they think that light actually has two different speeds, depending on where you are 
standing. According to Einstein, there is only one speed of light. Formulas never get trusted and, of 
course, that is the joke here. This is very deeply depressing. 

If you really think that the only way that you can commit yourself to a logical process is if you know that 
it will bring about the correct answer, you never know. You cannot know and when you have it in your 
hand. You still can't let go off the fact that it is always going to be open to what is natural in the logic 
process: criticism, the need to correct, the need to make sure that it is perfect, the need to lead with it. All 
this is necessary for working in the logic process. The faith of the fifth line comes in here. You have to 
trust every single step because it is never complete. It is part of that illogical process that lies here at the 
beginning of this. There is no guarantee of logic. There is nothing but this quality of faith which logical 
people, at their core, do not want to have to deal with. It is okay for a believer to say, "I believe that we 
will have a cure for AIDS." That is very nice, but that is not the same as a logical person's attitude 
towards the very same phenomenon because the logical person says that it is possible that a cure for AIDS 
can be found. But we have to do our research and we have to check it out and do our experiments. The 
perfect joke is: when you get to the sixth line here, the next hexagram is the fifth hexagram, first line, and 
that is exactly where the 9 goes in the circuitry. 

HEXAGRAM 10 TREADING 

We come to this place in which the Vessel gets poured out, the 10th gate. It is by far the most complex of 
all the Vessel gates. It is a gate that provides the identity to the integration process. By the nature of their 
mechanics, the integration gates are more complex. The 10th gate is preceded in the wheel by the 25.6. 
Whatever 

When we come to the 10th gate, we come to the gate of our nature. In that sense, we come to a gate of 
being in the world. The most powerful conditioning gate is the 10th gate. It conditions the behavior of the 
world through a very complex system, but the whole business of the 10th gate is the question that is 
raised in the 25.6 which is how does one live life as an expression? How does one express innocence in 
life? How does one express one's rhythm in life? How does one express the existential quality necessary 
for being in the experience of life? All that is focused on the 10th gate because it is out of this gate that 
the Vessel of Love is poured into each and every one of us, as an individual process. 

We are all conditioned by this individual process of the 10th. gate. The 10th gate represents the possibility 
to love oneself. In that possibility, the ground or the framework of loving oneself is to love being in the 
world because the 10th gate is about living in the world. It is about being part of the life process. 

Above the 10th gate in the black book, it says, The underlying code of behavior... Code here is a genetic 
catch phrase, if you will. We have a code of behavior that is imprinted in us at a very early moment, 
inside of us, in the structure of the form that we are going to be endowed with, something that we could 
see when we were looking at the first 88 degrees of the sun. ...which ensures successful interaction 
despite circumstances. Everything about behavior is what makes life easier. The moment that you are not 
being yourself, life is automatically going to be more difficult for you. The more you are being yourself 
the stronger your capacity for survival in this life, regardless of the circumstances. To be yourself is the 
great success and when the 10 is connected to the 20, to be yourself is the opportunity to be awake: to be 
awake in the now in the world. 

This whole business about a code of behavior is something very important when you do analysis. You 
have come to understand how the structure of a hexagram and the thematic or the keynotes associated 
with each of the lines work, so you know that first lines are introspective and so on. What is important is 
to recognize that every single line in its structure also has a code of behavior. In other words, each line 
has its code of behavior which can be seen in the 10th gate. If you want to understand the nature of fourth 
lines, look at the behavior of the 10.4, The Opportunist. Then you can see the opportunism built into all 
fourth lines. That is the correct behavior: to wait for that opportunity, to wait for that moment in which 
you are able to effectively externalize your influence. If you are a second line and everybody can look 
inside of you, it means to be a hermit, to be careful about those who can penetrate into you and take you 
away from your nature. In other words, in order to look at and to understand the nature of any given line, 
you can also see that, not only do you have a keynote for its structure, but more than that, you have a 
built-in reference in which you can see the code of behavior that bests suits that particular line. That code 
of behavior for the lines is very important to keep in mind when you are doing somebody's chart. 

Think of the nature of genetic continuity. In genetic continuity, we know that lines in similar positions in 
the structure have a deep relationship to each other. From the basic teachings of Human Design, we know 
that, as a global entity, we live inside of an emotional environment which is generated by all the solar 
plex combinations. We know that out of the solar plex will come the ultimate recognition of the spirit of 
humanity. Think about the nature of that Spirit in terms of how it functions in the world. The 22. 1 is 
called Second class ticket. This is one of the things that human beings deeply feel at the foundation of 
their nature, which is that somehow they are all given second class tickets; somehow they do not get the 

opportunity to belong or fit in to a place where they think they deserve to be. Think of that genetic 
continuity as it applies to the 10.1. 

10.1 Modesty 

The line is called Modesty. I have a nickname for this line. I call this line the line of the chameleon. Do 
not confuse it with Modesty in the 15, but understand that the nature of this line is that it asserts not an 
ego, but its selflessness. In doing so, what is there is the overview: An innate sense to know and accept 
one's place. Everything about being a human being is about being within a hierarchy. There are those 
above. There are those below. There are those more successful and those less. It is always the way that it 
is going to be. This is the nature of the world. The 10.1, the correct behavior, is simply to accept one's 
place. That is all, nothing more, nothing less. I have had a real privilege in my life. I have Jupiter in the 
10.1. I am comfortable and have been comfortable with princes and I am just as comfortable with freaks 
and I have lived in all kinds of environments. Inherent in the 10.1 is the acceptance of one's place, 
wherever that place happens to be. 

The Sun exalted. A valued sense of purpose, no matter what the position. In the acceptance of one's place 
is a sense of valued purpose. Everybody is looking for their purpose. The purpose lies in fulfilling your 
behavior, in being yourself. All the themes of love are pointed at the same thing over and over again: to 
be yourself, to accept what it is to be in the world and to accept that the world is both a hard and easy 
place. Only then is there a sense of purpose. 

The Moon in detriment. The affliction of over-sensitivity and hurt feelings. Everything about the self is 
under risk from the outside. The self is always under risk from the outside. The self by its nature is 
selfless. It is not ready to make any claims and yet, the moment that it is connected to the outside, the 
outside pressures and conditions it to take responsibility for its nature. 

Think about the 10.1 child. I have two of them so I know: the 10.1 is always acting correctly even if you 
do not like it. Always. The moment that you try to tell them that they are not acting correctly, you deeply 
offend them and they suffer from hurt feelings, of course, because inside of them, genetically, they know 
(this is all about knowing) that their behavior is correct. 

In the white book. The ability to know one's place and how to act despite circumstances. This is the 
answer to having a second class ticket. So what? Sit in second class, so what? I get on airplanes across the 
Atlantic Ocean and there are all those people in first class. I have a second class ticket. What to do? I will 
not complain and whine that I don't have a first class ticket. I have a second class ticket. Sit in second 
class. Accept your place. It is hard for human beings to just accept what the gods have dished out for 
them. It is the only way. This is the correct behavior and it is the foundation of all behavior. It is the 
foundation of the behavior that creates perfected form. It is the foundation of the behavior for the 
perfection of conviction. It is the foundation of the behavior to be awake. Accept your place. 

10.2 The Hermit 

Here in the 10th gate you have a theme of behavior, a code of behavior for all second lines which is being 
The Hermit. The overview says: The successful side-stepping of behavioral requirements... ('Behavioral 
requirements' is conditioning.) ...through isolation. We have seen in our work together that all second 
lines tend to suffer from the fact that they don't know that there is somebody who will burst in on them 
and see them and try to condition them because they can see into them. The hermit is the correct behavior: 
withdraw rather than accept conditioning away from what is your nature. 

Mercury exalted. Mental functions enrich aloneness. Mars in detriment. The angry exile. Whichever way 
that comes out, it is better to withdraw than to accept the conditioning. To be the hermit is so important. 
The other thing is: in the genetic continuity, as in the 12.2 Purification, The Hermit is somebody who has 
to rigorously withdraw from negative forces. That is the role of the behavior of the hermit: it is not simply 
to withdraw, but to withdraw from negative forces, not from all forces. Negative forces are those forces 
that apply conditioning and try to change the nature of the hermit, to bring the hermit out of his isolation. 

In the white book: Independent behavior through isolation, or Isolation to preserve independent behavior 
in the face of conditioning. That is the most important aspect of it because that is the real key to all second 
lines. The moment that somebody is trying to break in on your second line and condition you, withdraw. 
It is better for you to withdraw and be in your own process because this is what is healthy and it is the 
only way in which you are going to find love for yourself. 

Think about that. What happens is that when people recognize you for something and they pull on you, 
you tend to confuse that with love. It is not; nor should it be. That is, those people that can look into you 
and try to pull you, they try to pull you by getting you to recognize your nature and turn it into something 
motivated. They try to pump you up. This has nothing to do with the role of the hermit. The role of the 
hermit is to avoid such conditioning in order to have an opportunity to be awake. 

10.3 The Martyr 

We come to the story of the third line which is about martyrs. Think about the nature of what the third 
line is. It is always in a situation (lower trigram) in which it tries to get out of its process, only to be 
confronted by the outside. In the moment of being confronted by the outside, it is being forced to adapt 
because it was not prepared for what was there on the outside. In the nature of behavior, when you come 
to the third line, you come to trial and error in the process of behavior. Now, remember that third lines 
can lead to the sixth line of wisdom. That trial and error in behavior can be something that is of enormous 
value to humanity, but, at the same time, it is a trial and error process. What may be discovered by living
