out that trial and error is something else. It may turn out to be something that is of value. 

The Martyr overview line: The futile rejection of standards based on a just awareness. Futile rejection: it 
does not do any good to reject it. Here are human beings who, without choice, have a genetic code for 
behavior and that code of behavior, because it is trial and error, will often be in conflict with the behavior 
of those that surround it and meet it. No matter how much they live out their own nature, they are 
constantly going to meet resistance from those around them. Of course, it is not easy for them to give up 
that nature. It is, after all, what they are. 

The Earth exalted. The martyr as an enduring example whose behavior is ultimately enshrined. When a 
human being is living out their own nature, whether anybody likes it or not in the now, that has nothing to 
do with whether or not it is truly of value. The 10th gate is individual and deeply related in that sense to 
the first gate in the self, to its individuality. It speaks about this process of time, that as a creative process, 
to have different behavior than other people is not something that is recognized in your own time 
necessarily as a possible variation that others can follow. It simply may be seen as disruptive, anti-social, 
freakish and a threat, most of all. After all, behavior is the most important conditioning we get. It can be 
very threatening to have somebody whose behavior has impact on others and who becomes a role model 
(sixth line). 

The other thing is that, being individual, this is a behavior that can be mutative and can bring about 
change and most of all, individuals and individual aspects are always seeking attention. Therefore, the 
behavior of the 10 and the 10.3 is always getting attention: "You should not act like that, Johnny." "Stop 
picking your nose, Johnny." He may do it for the rest of his life until somebody slaps him in the face, 

until his behavior so violates the standards or the norms that somebody resists it. Remember, all of these 
gates of the self are always dependent on what they meet as beings on the other side. 

The Moon in detriment. The martyr complex. The active pursuit of martyrdom for personal 
aggrandizement. Here the ego is touched. These are people who make a living from their behavior. The 
way these people act in the world attracts attention and because of that, they maintain that behavior in 
order to continue to maintain that attention. 

In the white book: Behavior that is ultimately challenged by others. I tell all 10.3's when someone 
challenges them: "If it is your nature, martyr away because the more people resist you the better you 
know that you are living yourself." So many of these people have very thin skins and they are so easily 
upset by what other people say or comment on about the nature of their behavior. 

Often their reaction is going to the other side: Behavior as a way to attract attention. "If you don't like my 
behavior, watch me because I will not change it," and they use it to their advantage to attract attention. 
They can, they do, and they will. Then you see the impact on the self of having other forces come and 
impose on them and condition them. 

I taught you about the 10th gate being a conditioning factor for humanity and how important it is for 
humanity as a conditioning force, but that will give you a false impression. It is easier to generate the love 
of humanity than it is to generate the love of self. It is easier to generate the love of the body than it is to 
generate the love of self. It is easier to be one with universal love than it is to love oneself. The 46 always 
has to live with the conditioning of the 29 and its commitment. The 25 always has to deal with the 
conditioning of a willful ego. But the love of self, the behavior, gets conditioned in so many different 
ways. It gets conditioned by the sacral in terms of whether or not it even has the power to follow its 
convictions. It gets conditioned by the splenic system, an awareness that will condition the nature of the 
behavior. It gets conditioned by being able to deal with conditioning forces placed on it from all kinds of 
different directions. 

Obviously, when I speak in this language, I am not talking about the nature of one's finished design. 
Somebody like me who has the 10/20/57 but does not have the 34, the force that conditions my behavior 
is always going to come out of the 34. Somebody who only has the 10 will be open to all three of these 
conditioning forces. It is always dependent on the nature of somebody's design but understand the 
difficulty. The difficulty is to maintain one's nature. The little martyr that keeps sticking their finger in 
their nose, as disgusting as they may be to us, the more we try to beat that kid into not doing that, the 
more we try to tell them that it is bad for them, the more we try to stop them in the now, we are not 
benefiting them. What we are teaching them is to not let them be themselves. We are conditioning them to 
see that their behavior is repellent and that because their behavior is repellent, so are they. 

Now, it is not that I would like to have kids that stick their finger up their noses. I have been a teacher all 
my life and have been teaching kids. It is not something that I would like to look at but, then again, who 
am I to judge? All behavior, particularly in the first three lines, is under enormous pressure from society 
because this is society's way of counteracting the natural conditioning capability of the 10th gate. They 
condition it in return. To be oneself is the only way that you find self-love and there are so many forces 
that try to keep you away from that. 

When you have the 20 connected to the 10, you have a voice that says: "I am myself now." That voice is a 
joke because it is a voice that can say "I am myself now," but it does not mean that what they are doing is 
their self now or what they are processing is their self now. 

To be awake is simply about being yourself in the now and, regardless of what your behavior is, if you are 
a martyr, you have to be a martyr in the now and if you are a martyr in the now, you are awake. If that is 
your nature. If it is your nature to take the slings and arrows of everybody else's comments because they 
do not like your particular behavior, it is your nature and the moment that you succumb to that, you fail in 
this life. You will not love yourself. You will not be awake but asleep. 

One of the things about the nature of life is that life for a human being must involve a deep level of non- 
interference and recognition of the other. Everything about being awake is dependent on who is in your 
life. After all, most human beings are not manifestors of their behavior in the now. Most human beings 
are reliant on others in order to have that transpire. Most people who carry the 10th gate are not 
manifestors in the now. Most of them require other people in order for them to come about. It comes back 
to that very important standard that is established in the first line: to know and accept one's place means 
that you know the place not only for yourself but for others. 

You know who belongs in your place with you and you know whose place you belong in. This is about 
knowing the other. Everything about love is dependent on knowing the other. I have never known so 
much about myself. It is because I know so much about other human beings. It is out of this knowing that 
I have learned so much about the nature of who I am and, out of that, who belongs in my life and who 
does not. 

This is what it is all about for all of us, this deep recognition that we are not alone, that we are always in 
the aura of others and the auras of others are always conditioning us in one way or another. You have to 
be clear about your nature. You have to be clear about what is there so that you can be healthy, so that 
you can be of value to the totality and that you can enjoy being you in this life. So much of that is about 
understanding people. 

We are deeply misled in this life. That child with its behavior does not realize that it has a right to that 
behavior because everybody is opposed to it. It is not nurtured in that sense. To nurture that, all you do is 
that you do not interfere with it. You can educate. All anybody can do in this life is provide information, 
provide data to the other. 

I have learned as a teacher about the nature of what is called positive reinforcement. If you see something 
awful in somebody, wait until you can see something that is not. If you have a child that is always making 
mistakes, wait until they get it right. If you have a human being that is not themselves, don't take them 
into your life until they are. That is positive reinforcement and that is one of the things that we all need 
from each other and we can't get it until we get to a point where we understand each other. Understanding 
each other is what it is all about. 

With the information that you have in Human Design in terms of the nature of types, you have a way of 
encouraging people to live out their own nature. I do not pay much attention to generators when they 
initiate things with me. I expect manifestors to ask. My son is a generator so I make sure that I ask him to 
do things rather than telling him to do things so that he has an opportunity to respond because that is his 
nature. With the knowledge that you have and the people around you in your life, there are ways for you 
to deal with these people: encourage them to be themselves and then you don't become part of the 
problem by just mindlessly conditioning them even though you know better. This is very important. 

One of the main tasks that we have in our process is that, by recognizing and being aware of the other, we 
have to encourage them to be themselves. We have ways of doing that with the knowledge that we have. 
The more people we have that are living out their nature, that are encouraged to live out their own nature, 
the better and the healthier all of us are going to be and the better is the environment that all of us live in. 
One of the things to recognize about having the knowledge of the other is that you can encourage them to 

be themselves, not by telling them what to do and how to act but by the very recognition of their nature, 
by encouraging in the way you interact with them so that you don't become a conditioning force. You 
become a healing force. 

10.4 The Opportunist 

Dealing with the upper trigram, we have a different process at work because the fourth and fifth lines are 
rather gifted in the sense that they are going to recognize not only that there is one other source of 
conditioning, but that they are going to come to grips with all three other sources. In other words, the 
fourth and fifth lines of the 10th hexagram have deep transpersonal skills because they do have 
recognition of the impact of the other. 

The fourth line as a behavior is a code for all fourth lines for this one-tracked-ness, the fixedness. Its 
behavioral code is The Opportunist. The acceptance of norms until a successful transformation can be 
engendered. It is very important to understand that. The whole thing about the nature of the behavior in 
the fourth line is that it has to wait for its opportunity, which means that it cannot give up behavior until 
there is a place to go with that behavior. 

My analogy for this is: if you have a job and you are a 10.4 and you want a new job, you cannot quit your 
job until you have a new one. This is opportunism. You stay with the nature of your fixedness until there 
is an opportunity or you wait simply for that opportunity to externalize your fixedness. Again, there is 
always the possibility that the opportunist has enormous influence: to be able to wait for the right moment 
to act can often lead to a great deal of good fortune or success. 

We have this overview and so it takes time: the acceptance of norms until a successful transformation can 
be engendered. Accept the nature of your behavior until the behavior can really change. Somebody who 
has the 10.4 and is deeply conditioned and they come to Human Design. They are not going to be able to 
change their nature. They will not be able to change their nature until that opportunity is really there for 
them. That opportunity has to be there. For example, you are a generator and you are a 10.4. You cannot 
just suddenly become a generator. You have to wait for that opportunity when somebody says to you, 
"Excuse me, could you help me?" and you go, "Uh-huh." Then you can jump into that behavior: to wait 
for the opportunity. 

Uranus exalted. Transformation that is transcendence to a higher code. The whole thing about the 
opportunist is that you are looking for the opportunity to externalize your nature and that is the highest 
possible code. There is nothing higher. 

Mercury in detriment. Opportunism as a game and/or mental exercise. Most of that is because the 10th 
gate has no guarantee that it is going to have access to a motor in order to manifest. So often it is 
speculating on those moments of opportunity when they may not arrive, or they are the kind of people 
who think, "Here is a perfect opportunity to make a million dollars," but never do it because it is a game, 
and because they do not have within themselves, within the nature of their design, the real opportunity to 
live out that opportunism. 

In the white book: The maintaining of behavioral patterns until the right moment and opportunity for 
transformation. It is so important for 10.4's just to sit back and wait for that moment to live out their 
nature. The other side: Altering one's behavioral patterns in order to take advantage of opportunities. It is 
the same thing, just on the other side but it is also speculative. It is waiting for those opportunities and 
they may not be ready to do that at that moment. Remember, not everybody who has the 10.4 is going to 
be a manifestor or a generator. They may not have the opportunity to act it out and then it becomes 
something game4ike or speculative. 

One of the really clear genetic continuities is between the 28.4 and the 10.4. The 28.4, as any fourth line, 
is all about holding on. It is a holding on until the opportunity to take a risk: to hold on to what you have 
got until you really have that opportunity to go beyond that. 

It is so important to see that the 28.4 and the 10.4 are both deeply risk-oriented and the whole thing is that 
one cannot afford to take that risk until one waits for the right moment. Any premature action in that 
sense is going to lead to difficulties. So, the genetic continuity there is very important. This 28.4 is 
holding on and usually for the betterment. In other words, if you hold on and wait for that opportunity, it 
is always going to be more beneficial. If a 28.4 does not hold on, that does not mean that it fights for the 
wrong things; it fights for the right things at the wrong time. 

10.5 The Heretic 

The 10.5 has enormous impact on society. After all, the 10 is part of Integration and Integration is the 
backbone of being in the body, of being individuated. The 10.5 is where society projects onto behavior 
and onto how it wants to see behavior. Society sees the behavior at its most interesting as being heretical. 
It is society that sees if your behavior is unique and individual and it in fact may be dangerous to the 
whole. All fifth lines are at one time exciting and at another time a threat to society because it is the 
source of society's projections and, therefore, can be the source of society's disappointment if those 
projections fail. 

When you come to the fifth line, you come to The Heretic. As an overview line it says: Direct and overt 
challenge to norms. One of the things to realize about the 10.5 is the need of society for a heretic, for a 
behavior that will challenge the norms. It is society that creates The Heretic, that creates The General, that 
creates all of these roles: The Savior, The Saint, all of these figures. It is society that creates it out of its 
own needs and its owi4 projections. The heretic is created by society because they project onto the 
behavior of the 10.5 that it is either very exciting or very threatening. 

Jupiter exalted. The ability to succeed through the understanding and expression of higher principles. 
Mars in detriment. The burning 0~ie stake. What exactly is the difference? There is a profound difference. 
Remember that the fifth line is there to challenge the norms of society. In the white book: Principled 
behavior which directly challenges tradition. This is not a challenge to the way an individual acts in the 
world. This is not going up to somebody who has a rooster haircut and picking on them because they have 
a rooster haircut. This is not dealing with tradition. This is just dealing with unusual behavior. 
When you look at the other side, the Mars side: Behavior which directly challenges behavior and is 
eventually punished. If you go up to the punk and say, "This is ridiculous, nobody should walk around 
like this", don't be surprised if they rearrange your face. 

The fact of the matter is that the heretic is at its greatest when they attack the framework of behavior that 
has to be changed. Because the 10.5 is the vanguard of changing behavior, if they just attack the behavior 
on the surface they are the ones that suffer. They get burned at the stake because it becomes very 
personal. They are here to try to challenge the underlying tradition. If they do that, ultimately, they can be 
regarded as a very special force in the world. 

How they are going to react is again subject to the conditioning that they receive themselves. The 10.5 
that has no fuel and no access to awareness or no access to manifestation is always going to be 
conditioned by others. A 10.5 being conditioned by somebody else's awareness may end up attacking 
somebody's behavior and being punished for it simply because they were conditioned that way, rather 
than that being the most natural and healthy way for them. It is a very important line because, again, 

society has been calling for this. It is calling for a heretic that will challenge tradition and, in challenging 
tradition, provide mutation for behavior. 

Very interesting is the genetic continuity here, particularly because the genetic continuity as seen through 
the mystical process is the relationship between the 10.5 and the 49.5. The 49th gate is a gate of being the 
sacrificer and the sacrificed. It is the gate of emotional principles and the fifth line in its exalted form is 
about providing practical provisions for revolutionary times, in the same way that the heretic really brings 
something very practical when they deal with the tradition itself. That is what they are equipped to do: to 
look at the tradition and to see whether or not a tradition deserves to stand or whether or not it is time for 
mutation of behavior. 

Practical provisions: in the detriment of the 49.5 you have the same Mars in detriment, which is all about 
power. The moment that you make things personal is the moment that you get into a power trip with 
people. For example, you say to them, "Your behavior stinks," and they return, "Your behavior stinks." 
Nothing productive will come out of that. In order to change the behavior of society, what has to be dealt 
with and challenged is the underlying tradition out of which that behavior has risen. Practical provisions; 
otherwise expect to be sacrificed. 

10.6 The Role Model 

If you will look in this life for people that are the most self-conscious, you will find them in the 10.6. 
They are constantly under pressure, constantly self-concerned about the nature of their behavior. Built 
into them is the understanding that behavior can be hypocritical. They recognize that. The line is called 
The Role Model. 

A very powerful line: The perfect expression of the norms through action rather than words. They learn 
their self-consciousness well with their harmony to the 20.3, Self-awareness, or through the 57.3, 
Acuteness. They learn to recognize very quickly in their life that it is possible to say things but not 
necessarily possible to live them out. They see that very early. They recognize within themselves that 
their behavior is very important. But no matter how much they want to be able to behave perfectly, they 
always run into obstacles because they end up being conditioned by the people around them that they are 
dependent on. Even the words can only come out if there is a connection to the 20 and the awareness can 
only guide it if there is a 57 and the energy is only there if there is a 34. 

Remember that sixth lines look to the whole circuit, but the first thing a 10.6 looks at is Integration. It 
says, "How can I maintain the holiness of myself. How can I guarantee my survival in the world? How 
can I be me? How can I do what is right for me to do in the world?" All of that ends up being dependent 
on so many other beings. 

Pluto exalted. The constant example that refocuses the complacent on the basic integrity of set behavior. 
They know how important behavior is. If you have a 10.6 parent, you will discover that, while they are 
picking their nose, they tell you, "Don't pick yours: bad behavior." 10.6's recognize that correct behavior 
is very important. What is frustrating is that, because they know that better than anybody else and because 
so often they can't live it out, they would rather not be seen. They would rather sit on the roof and not be 
anybody's example because, even though they can be hypocritical, they suffer a great deal from their own 
hypocrisies. 

The other side of this is Saturn in detriment. The hypocrite. Do as I say, not as I do. We have seen this as 
a gift in all sixth lines: the 40.6 that sits on top of the house and looks to its family and says, "I see who is 
messing things up here," and can easily point it out. The 10.6 has this deep capacity to point out to you 
what is the correct behavior. By the way, I tell these people: go ahead. Tell other people how to behave. It 

is part of your gift and don't feel self-conscious because you yourself can't act the way you tell other 
people to act. Everybody has to accept their limitation, whatever it happens to be. This 10.6 leads to the 
20.6, to the line of wisdom. There is an enormous potential here to be awake to the beauty of self, but this 
is not an easy process. 

In the white book: The enduring value of expression of the Self through action rather than words. In the 
end it all comes down to the same thing. It comes down to how you live in the world. The only action that 
matters, whether it is action that you generate or manifest or whether it is action that is conditioned as 
manifestation or generation in your life, it that you cannot be taken away from your nature. As long as 
you are not taken away from your nature, you are an example for others. This is the great value of the 
10th gate and, as an example for others, you are a source of wisdom for them in their lives. 

Of all the sixth lines that we have looked at, none makes a more beautiful turn than the 10.6 because the 
10.6 goes to the 58.1. It goes to The Joyous and it goes to the most beautiful line of the 384: the line of 
Love of life. In the end, the 10.6 must find for itself love of life and the vitality that comes from loving 
life. It is not the vitality that creates the love of life. It is the love of life that creabs the vitality. Th., 10.6 
sits up there and knows the correct behavior but it also knows that that behavior is what brings about the 
love - life and out of that love of life comes the power to correct the collective, comes the power to 
establish new patterns, comes the power to release the example in the world. Good luck. 

It always brings me back to where I started 1 1 years ago. When we go through this process of looking at 
the G center, it brings me back to my own mantra: You are unique. You have no choice. Love yourself. 
There is nothing else. There really is nothing else. 

HEXAGRAM 11 PEACE 

Above the lines of the Rave I'Ching it says: A harmonic condition in the individual or society that permits 
assessment before renewed action. Ideas generate the possibility for examination. They are not 
necessarily something to act on. 

This is in the channel of the searcher, the seeker, and it goes back to the pressure of the 47, Oppression, 
which is all about trying to find a way to make sense out of what it is to be in the world. Here we have the 
gate of ideas and the possibility: awareness to visualize a realization or not. This is visual memory of the 
left eye. 

Think about how the left eye works: it does not see everything. It sees just what is there in the wave. If 
you are a left-eye person and you go on a vacation and you stay in a place with a beautiful view and you 
love it very much, then you get home and somebody says to you, "What was it like?" When you describe 
it, there will be many things left out. 

There is a place in your wave and the part of what you saw that you really like is the part you hold on to. 
Then somebody who knows the place says, "Wait a minute. Wasn't there a river that went through there?" 
and you answer, "Oh yes, there was a river. Now I remember." It is in a wave. It is the awareness to 
visualize a realization or not and the awareness possibility is visual memory, and this is the left eye. 

The most important thing for people who have this gate is to recognize that these ideas, no matter what 
the configuration is, are always for others. They are going to be most successful when they recognize that 
because the moment they try to actualize their own ideas, they will end up with a lot of frustration and 
crisis in their life. 

11.1 Attunement 

This line is the foundation. It is the line of introspection and it is called Attunement. This is a line that 
resonates deeply through the abstract process. The serendipity of being in the right place at the right time. 
This is a resonance to the 46th hexagram whose theme is to recognize that one is in the right place at the 
right time. To be in the right place at the right time means that whatever idea you have is of value in the 
moment that you have it. This is important for these people to understand. 

The idea process is a gift. It is simply there. The ideas can always be there. Any idea at any given moment 
has its value, but not for you. It has its value as another, idea, as another perspective on the process. 

Moon exalted. The nourishment derived from being with those who share the same goals and aspirations. 
One of the great concerns of all first lines is whether or not their nature is going to be accepted by the 
other. Idea people are very concerned about whether anybody is going to have anything to do with their 
ideas, which is why idea people can be so fervent. The beginning of a belief system lies here in this gate 
in this line. 

In the white book: The gift of finding those who will value your ideas. This is the whole thing about idea 
people. They need to have others who say, "That is a great idea," whether that is a belief in something or 
not. They are looking for others who will share the idea because they know that it is not a fact and they 
know that it is not necessarily a truth. What they know is it is an idea. "Who else wants to go along for the 
experience? Maybe there is a crisis, but misery likes company. Lets all do it together." 

When you get to the other side you have: The sense that no one will value your ideas. This is the 
foundation of what ideas are all about: an idea is only of value it you can share it with others. An idea is a 

painful thing when nobody values it. This is the whole thing about idea people. They are constantly 
searching, not simply for a new idea, but they are searching for others who will share the idea with them. 
When I discuss the mystical channels, I talk about the 40/37 which is a mystical bridge; it is not mystical 
in itself. It is all about the search. It is all about curiosity. In many ways, it mirrors this collective channel 
of the 1 1/56. The 1 1/56 is deeply social. The opiate of the masses. A belief system is intended to explode 
out of a social environment where other people are there sharing the idea and saying, "Yes." As we well 
know, ideas can be very dangerous in this way. 

The lower trigram always has difficulty in terms of the other side. The lower trigram is more involved in 
understanding the nature of its own process and yet, here in this channel, through this gate, there is this 
enormous pressure to socialize because the ideas are of no value unless they are shared with others. 

11.2 Rigor 

The second line is a line of projection. This is the great line of boredom. Boredom is inherent in the idea 
process and this line is a great line of boredom due to the fact that it is extremely difficult to get anybody 
to pay attention to your ideas. You are projecting ideas out without the value of introspection. That is the 
first thing. 

This line is called Rigor. The recognition that without vigilance and risk, peace can lead to stagnation and 
collapse. Neptune exalted. The imagination applied to ensuring the understanding of achieved values. It is 
very important for these people to recognize that their ideas are much better kept within themselves 
because then they can lead to the fruit that is very creative. 

This is a very creative line; it has an enormous potential in terms of creativity. These are the bored artists. 
They are even bored with their own art at times because it depends on who is there in their life to 
recognize it with them. When they have a nice idea, the moment they try to project that out to others, 
others are bored. "That is not my idea. Don't bore me with that." It is very difficult for them to project 
their ideas out to others who say, "This is boring". It is much better for them to work with their ideas 
within themselves as an imaginative process. 

Mars in detriment. The resorting to factionalism to satisfy the ego's need for action. It is like sitting with a 
group of friends and bringing out exactly the idea that will cause three of them to end up in a big 
argument with each other while you sit back after throwing out the idea. Instead of them being bored, you 
have to watch them getting all cranked up, so you end up being bored. 

A sense of boredom overcome through the imagination; or Provoking with ideas to escape boredom. By 
the way, the only time that they are not boring is when they are cranking other people up. 

11.3 The Realist 

Whenever you get to a third line of an abstract process, remember, it resonates deeply to the emotional 
side. You are dealing with bonds made and broken. You are dealing with an emotional wave in which 
contact is being made and broken and The Realist is about the nature of ideas itself. 

The acknowledgement that peace is transitory. This is the nature of the format energy that runs a circuit. It 
is called beginnings, middles and ends. Ideas are transitory. Pluto exalted. The internal renewal to 
maintain strength and alertness. Venus in detriment. The tendency to appreciate harmony to the point of 
delusion. The belief that beauty is eternal. Fiddling while Rome burns. What is so classic about third lines 
is not only that they make bonds and break them, but they can be very irresponsible in all that. This is the 
great irresponsible idea machine. 

The realization that ideas come and go. These are people where ideas are always coming and going and, 
due to that, there is a part of them that will never take any of them seriously. They may produce 
absolutely brilliant ideas. It is others that will take them seriously. They rarely take their own ideas 
seriously because ideas come and go. 

A pleasure in ideas that have no real application: Somebody who has an idea about flying to the alpha 
century to talk to the booboos. This kind of idea does not mean anything. "W uldn't it be a great idea to 
have a building that is 18 miles high?" These people love ideas that simply have no application 
whatsoever. It is just for the beauty of what an idea is. 

After all, we have an enormous privilege to have this kind of consciousness. The horror of this is when 
we take all that stuff seriously. The moment you take ideas seriously, there will be crisis. In this 
irresponsibility lies this enormous beauty of what the idea itself is. You do not have to do anything with 
it. You don't have to have anybody agree with you. It is just the beauty of what an idea can be. It can be 
infuriating to others, particularly when it is your parent. You have all these ideas and they say to you, 
"You must do something with it." One day you have the idea to be a plastic surgeon on Mars and then you 
end up being an agriculturist in Thailand because the idea changed. Ideas come and go. When you have a 
lover with this line who tells you, "let's go on vacation tomorrow," don't pack. 

11.4 The Teacher 

When you get to the fourth line and the upper trigram, something very special happens here. After all, this 
channel is intensely social and there is enormous frustration in the first three lines about not really being 
successful at crossing the line to get to the point of stimulation in the 56th gate in order to find the 
believers. In this line, we come to externalization and to this very fixed one-track process. Here it is very 
fixed on a single idea and very fixed on its ability to look across and know how to stimulate. 

There is a quality and a capacity here to stimulate. This line is called The Teacher. It is one of several 
lines that have more than two planets fixing it and so it is unusual in that nature itself. 

The ability to express the essential nature of peace. Remember that the tradition of the teacher has been 
based on teaching the ignorant. They have to believe first. When you are teaching a child and it has no 
real experience in the world, it cannot know or understand what you are teaching. It has to believe you 
first until it finds out for itself. Most of us come to a point in our lives where, through teachers, we always 
found disillusionment. 

What we were asked to believe from the teachers in our lives, our parents or our formal teachers, in many 
circumstances, we came to the point of disillusionment, that what we thought we were being taught was 
of value, instead turned out to be an illusion. The reality is that it is the tradition of the teacher is to first 
get them to believe. This is a very Piscean field and we are going through a process where this is 
changing. 

Moon exalted. The sage who in the extreme can teach harmony to the tone deaf. Venus is also exalted. 
The ability to reach out and touch the alienated. Finally, the Sun in detriment. The guru whose most 
valued wisdom is intentionally limited to a few. 

In the Book of Letters, it is very clear: Concepts which are clear and transferable. Ideas that can attract 
and inform the uneducated. These are great missionaries. All religious dogma is here. This is the gate of 
white magic and these are the great exponents of white magic: narrow minded, locked in their own track 
and, though they can be brilliant, they can also be very dangerous because they have the power to attract 

the other side. They have the power to get others to say, "I believe". This is one of most dogmatic of all 
gates and this is the nature of white magic. If everybody believes, Tinkerbell won't die. 

Ideas that can only be grasped by a few This is the nature of the guru in the sense that there are only some 
who are capable of understanding. The best example is Einstein because he wrote this theory of relativity 
in 1904 nearly a hundred years ago now and there are still maybe three of four thousand people on earth 
who understand anything of it. This is information intentionally limited to a few. There are only some 
people who are able to grasp it. 

This is also the most dangerous of the gurus. These are the people that really attract a fringe and only that 
fringe can understand that they are an reincarnation of Jesus Christ and the world is coming to an end and 
"Let's die tomorrow while we take poison." This can be a line that is devastating in its power because it is 
in this line that the capacity of the modern human mind awakened. 

I taught many of you that we had a throat chakra mutation that took place 80,000 to 90,000 years ago. 
That mutation took place in the 12.4. Exactly opposite that line in the zodiac is the 11.4. This opened up 
the whole possibility of the mind and the possibility to begin the process of articulating ideas. This has 
had enormous influence in the world ever since. Anybody who is born with either the Sun/Earth or the 
nodes in the 11.4 has the 12.4 on the other side and this is the line of the prophet. This is a very powerful 
opposition. It has caused as much pain as it has caused glory. That is its nature. "Believe in me and you 
shall be redeemed." 

11.5 The Philanthropist 

When you come to the fifth line you, always come to the complete expression of the hexagram. You come 
to a line of universalization. This gives you the best quality for the nature of this hexagram. It is called 
The Philanthropist. 

The motiveless nurturing of the disenfranchised to ensure harmony. Mercury in detriment. The 
withdrawing from direct contact, where giving is a form of defense. The philanthropist is about giving 
away your ideas. One side of this is philosophic and humanitarian ideas, ideas that may be of value to 
others because the most important ideas are those that enable us to share the human experience and to be 
a guide for others. 

On the other side of this are often people who end up being philosophical writers. This is classic for the 
philosopher: "Don't come near me personally but let me give you my ideas through a book or a movie." 
That way of doing it is away from the individual contact. Whenever I see anybody who has this line, I 
always give them a simple thing to think about: when somebody is bothering them, they can give them a 
good idea. "Why don't you go out and play, Johnny?" Give them an idea and send them away. That is 
what the defensive part is all about. 

By the time you get to the fifth line, you realize that the whole nature of having the 11th gate is that how 
the idea comes out is never up to you. It is always up to the other side because the 56 is manifesting it. 
There is this sense of, "I can be very philanthropic. I have a wonderful idea for you." That can be 
something that is very beneficial or it can be something that is very protective. 

11.6 Adaptability 

When you come to the sixth line, you come to the roof of the house. You come to transition and this line 
speaks of transition. It is called Adaptability. The inner balance to accept transition. 

Neptune exalted. The innate awareness that all forms are transitory. This is the resonance to the third line, 
The Realist. The Realist begins this process and recognizes that ideas come and go. This is more than 
that. It is the expression of ideas. After all, the sixth line goes far beyond what is there in the channel. It 
goes to the whole experience of the circuit. It is looking beyond that to the nature of life itself. What it is 
looking at is 'the innate awareness that all forms are transitory'. 

Jupiter in detriment. Adaptability in its most negative manifestation. The speculator who profits at the 
expense of others in times of peace or war. The greatest difficulty for idea people is to live out their own 
ideas. The sixth line people have a sense for what the whole process is about. They can see when the 
crisis is coming. They can see where the beginning of something is. They can be very lucky in the stock 
market. They can see when something is coming to an end and they can be very lucky in terms of getting 
in and out of things. 

Something lies within them that allows them to take the moment and capture it and to be able to profit 
from their idea in that moment. But their idea is not about manifesting in the throat. That idea is far 
beyond that. It is seeing how something operates throughout the whole collective process and being able 
to catch it and take advantage of it. They realize that any old idea won't do that. Ideas come and go and 
they are changeable. 

The realization that ideas lead to change and are changeable; or The realization of what idea is of value in 
any situation. It is the situation that these people look at, not the manifestation; it is the whole situation. 
They are tuning into that whole possibility. What is actually going on there and what idea can really work 
in that? Many people will take offense at these people, obviously. They always take advantage in certain 
situations with an idea, and ideas are not truths. Due to that, other people can see themselves as being 
taken advantage of. That is always the dichotomy that exists. 

The sixth line is going towards the 10.1, which is all about behavior. That is why what it is looking for 
over the roof is how everybody acts. Out of seeing the way in which the world behaves, they get their 
ideas of how they can take advantage of that behavior. 

I don't mean to make that negative. That is not moralistic. Please understand me. It is simply that they 
take advantage for their own benefit. All those ideas are supposed to be for others. In the detriment the 
idea is really for you. By the way, you ask these people, for example, "How did you know when to step 
out of the stock market. How did you get this idea?" They cannot really tell you. They tell you something 
that does not really sound related at all to the question. They simply tell you, "Well, women's' dresses are 
shorter this year." Whether you consider that answer as their real idea or as something that just flashes 
into their mind makes no difference. 

After all, we have no choice in what we say anyway. The speculator is born with this gift and has the 
experience. The people who have the gift end up in situations surrounded by people who do not have the 
gift. They follow their trends. The world is filled with people who try to figure out how Mr. Buffet made 
his 16 billion dollars. When you hear him talk about it, it is a joke. These people have the gift of 
comparison. They wouldn't tell their mother if they knew what stock to buy because they would be afraid 
that their mother would tell their friend and ruin the whole thing. 

HEXAGRAM 12 STANDSTILL 

The 12th gate is the only social channel for the individual process and, as such, the only way in which the 
individual mutation can go out into the world. This gate opens up to the solar plex center, so it is under 
the same pressure as the 35. It is under the pressure of the solar plex wave. Everything having to do with 
the 12th gate has to do with the nature of its voice which says, "I know I can try if I am in the mood." 
This is the whole key to the 12. 

Above the lines it says: The quality of restraint and the importance of meditation and inaction in 
confronting temptation. The 12 has to be restrained until it is in the mood. This gate is a stop. "I am not in 
a hurry here. I'll wait until I am in the mood." This is the key to everything that I will describe about the 
nature of the 12th gate and how it operates. 

12.1 The Monk 

The first line speaks for a hexagram and this first line is called The Monk. This gate is not called 
Standstill for nothing: this is about the monk. This is about being isolated. It is one of the three gates of 
aloneness and is about waiting and being contemplative. It is about restraint until one is in the mood, then 
it is the right time. 

Withdrawal that can only be maintained with communal support. Venus exalted. The beauty and harmony 
possible beyond the reach of temptation. The temptation lies in the solar plex center and in actually 
committing oneself to trying to explain oneself. Remember, the 12th gate is part of individuality. It is a 
knowing gate and every time that it makes a social contact, it has to be able to explain itself. If you are 
away from the social power of the solar plex center, you never have to explain yourself. That can be very 
peaceful. During that time, one can go through that process, allow the time for mutation to take place and 
wait for that moment of mood so that it can be externalized. 

In the detriment you have: Simon the Stylite,... These were people in the late Greco-Roman times in the 
Middle East whose religious practice was to climb up on these very tall pillars and sit up there by 
themselves. This is about ...total and often absurd withdrawal. 

In the white book: The expression of social withdrawal and its value when supported by others. In other 
words, if you are a 12 and somebody says, "Do you want to come and see me now? We have friends in 
the house," and you say, "I am not in the mood," they have to be able to accept that that is your nature so 
that at some further date, you'll be invited again. That is the need for communal support, in that sense. 

The other side: The absurd expression of social caution and extreme withdrawal from emotional contact. 
All of this is about bringing mutation. If you are not in the mood, you can't bring mutation. This is the 
intrinsic lesson of the 12. By the way, you will not be in the mood unless you have a mutation to bring. 
That is true as well. Mutation for an individual, at its simplest level, is the moment that you can explain 
an aspect of your knowing that has a mutative value. 

The moment that you can explain your knowing and you are in the mood, that is your opportunity to 
mutate others and bring them to a new knowing. That is part of how the process works. If somebody has 
the detriment of the 12.1 in an undefined throat, they may have extreme difficulty in being able to speak. 
This is a gate of articulation and the 12.1 people with the detriment in an undefined throat can even be 
mute, or they go through long periods in their life where they do not speak. 

12.2 Purification 

When you come to the second line, you come to projection. What is being projected out here is restraint 
that says, "leave me alone. I may not be in the mood, so why bother coming near me?" This line is called 
Purification. Rigorous withdrawal from negative influences. 'Negative' means from solar plex energy, 
before one is clear. "I know I can try, if I am in the mood." You can only get to the "I know I can try" 
when you can explain your knowing. That is the moment that the mutative capacity is there. 

Saturn exalted. The discipline to maintain a pure state. These are people who really are isolated human 
beings. They are always projecting out that they are not interested. They always project out that they do 
not want to have contact with the social aspect at the other end. Of course, they don't know that. This is 
about social mutation. It is a social channel. Remember, they are a second line so they do not really know 
what is underneath and how much they may get out of that moment of contact. 

Mercury in detriment. The boredom that arises out of lack of stimulation. Think about what these people 
are like. These people are restrained but they don't know why. Somebody says to them, "Why don't you 
come out tonight?" and they answer that they are not in the mood but they don't know if they are really 
not in the mood. They don't really know why they do not want to go out. They just say, "I am not in the 
mood." That is what they can put out all the time as a protective vibration. "I am not in the mood. I am not 
ready. I don't want to." But they do not really know why. They can get very confused by that. 

In the white book: The expression of disciplined social caution; or Caution that manifests boredom and 
the expressed desire for stimulus. These people constantly say, "No", but then they get very bored. We are 
dealing with a social channel here. There is a part of them that says, "Yes, but what am I going to do? I 
keep on going like this. There is nobody here." There is this sense of boredom that builds up underneath 
because they are not working on the mutative process. 

They are not coming up with their explanation for their knowing. That is the only moment that the 12 is 
free. It is a gate of articulation, literally, to be able to express the mutation. That means that you really 
have to be able to explain yourself, to bring it out into a social context. I am a classic 12.1. 1 have both my 
conscious and unconscious Uranus there. I did not go out into the world with the Human Design System 
until I was very clear about it. I lived like a monk, totally isolated, and the community supported it. These 
are classic patterns that go on all the time. 

12.3 Confession 

When we get to the third line of the 12th hexagram, we get to people who can be very deeply disturbed. 
Due to this bonds being made and broken, it is impossible for them to be always still. They are constantly 
stepping into the emotional energy of the solar plex center and, the moment that is connected, they go 
through this process of trial and error. This line generates hatred. These are people that hate or are hated 
and, mostly, the hatred in them is self-hatred. They end up hating themselves. This can be a very brutal 
line, a lot like The Martyr in the 10.3, which is part of the same individual process. These people can 
really be burned at the stake emotionally, which is another kind of scaring and burning. 

It is called Confession. The process of self-analysis. Neptune exalted. Whenever you see Neptune exalted, 
you know that you have quite a process to cut through all that murk, that it is not a clear process. The 
recognition of inadequacies and the purging of unjustified vanities. Every time this person makes contact, 
it is necessary for them to explain themselves. Remember that an individual has no business being social 
unless they can explain themselves. If they can't, they will get into a lot of trouble socially because, not 
only will they be rejected, but they will have to deal with the wave on the other side. What happens to 
these people is that they put that energy out and then they discover their inadequacies and they begin an 
adaptive process of learning. After all, if these people get through this process in a relatively healthy way, 

they have an enormous knowing within them about what really works and when they can bring out this 
quality of knowing within themselves. 

Mars in detriment. A perverse and often exaggerated self-hatred. I have met a lot of 12.3's who are so 
heavy on themselves. If you are a person like that, that is okay, but if you identify with being heavy on 
yourself, this is a tragedy. It takes years, 40 to 50 years, to go through all of this trial and error and to get 
to the point where you really can put across that explanation socially as a stranger and bring your 
mutation to others. 

In the white book: The expression of inadequacies in social interaction that leads to self-analysis and 
caution; or Inadequacies in social interaction that leads to the expression of self-hatred. You can't cure 
these people of their selfhated. It is not like you can say to them, "Now look, you have the 12.3 in 
detriment and it is a mechanic for your hating yourself, but do not take it seriously." That is very difficult 
to do. 

The thing for them to recognize about the nature of that is that there is a conditioning factor in this line in 
the black book: A perverse and often exaggerated self-hatred. This means not always. It does not say 
'always' which means that it is not fixed. This is the only thing that can work for them, to see out of that 
self -hatred that their failure of social interaction is not about them being inadequate. It is about them not 
having contact with the right forces. Again, it is a third line. It is not transpersonal. It really does not 
understand the emotional system on the other side and can only learn through experience, and usually 
painful experience. 

12.4 The Prophet 

When you get to the upper trigram, you get to the externalization of our mutative process. Here in the 
12.4, humanity had a mutation take place in the larynx 80 to 90,000 years ago that allowed us to begin to 
articulate in what we call language. The 12.4 is called The Prophet. The externalization is the ability to 
recognize (this is a transpersonal line) the emotional field on the other side, to be able to deal with the 
emotional field on the other side, in order to be able to get the mutation across. 

The ability to foresee and plan for the end of standstill. They are people that have the ability to foresee. 
They have been waiting all along and have the capacity inside of them to know exactly when the mood is 
right and to know exactly when they have the capacity to explain themselves. After all, what good are 
prophets when they cannot explain themselves? 

Earth exalted. The rousing of the stagnant for communal preparation. In the white book: The ability to 
foresee and express the need for social interaction and an end to caution. It is time to get the word out. It 
is time to get this mutation going because, without the emotional energy, it is not going to happen. 

On the other side, Mercury in detriment. The voice in the wilderness. In the 12.1, we have people that can 
have extreme difficulties in articulation and they can even be mute. In the fourth line, you have people 
with speech impediments. You have people who have difficulty in the way they articulate. 'The voice in 
the wilderness': it may be very hard for these people to speak. These are people that can stutter. These are 
people that can go through all kinds of difficulties in terms of articulation. 

The expressed need for social interaction that falls on deaf ears. It is very hard for these people to get their 
message across. Everything about the externalization process is about opportunity. Prophets show up 
exactly at the right time: when people are ready to hear their word. Otherwise, it does not work. This is 
about being totally fixed on that moment, waiting for that moment to be able to externalize one's 
explanation, one's mutation, and to try to bring about some kind of social transformation. 

12.5 The Pragmatist 

When you get to the fifth line, you have this wonderful word here: Pragmatist. This is the beauty of the 
fifth line. This is how the whole gate is projected on. It is projected on all 12th gate people that they are 
pragmatic, that they are cautious and that they are careful. This is what the outside sees. 

The success of restraint lies in not abandoning the lessons learnt when the phase ends. This immediately 
tells you something about this line: it is not like the second line. It really knows what is on the other, side 
and that the emotional energy comes and goes. It knows that each time that the energy is there, there is a 
period afterwards in which they are going to be alone and they stand still and they go through their 
process but they also know: that experience of the emotional system is coining again and they are ready 
for that. 

It is also projected onto these people that they are much more social than they are. Jiirgen is a classic 
example with the 12.5 and 22.5, a resonance in this channel. It is always projected on him that he is very 
social and accessible, but I know him very well. I know that when you hook into that, it will come out, 
but it is not necessarily the case. 

This is a projected field that people put onto others. What is so important about this fifth line is that, 
because they always get this social projection placed on them, they get a lot of experience. If they are 
clear each time about the nature of that experience, they finally are people who have very special social 
skills because they know when to be in the mood and how to interact when they are in the mood. 

Sun exalted. Light is always conscious of darkness. Mars in detriment. The tendency to remember only 
the most painful lessons learnt. This side of that energy can be, "Yes, I learned a lot about this social 
interaction but there is a lot in it that I don't really like." They get to see that the social mechanism of the 
individual is not always pleasant, even if you can explain yourself. There are forces that are not worth 
dealing with. 

In the white book: Caution as an expression of social experience; or Caution which is conditioned by the 
most painful social experiences. One of the things about fifth lines is that if you really get to them, they 
remember the most painful lesson. They remember that type of hook and then they are able to say no and 
be very cautious out of that experience because it was painful. It does not mean that it was harmful to 
them or bad. It is simply that they will always remember what did not work and they will not get involved 
with that again because they are by their very nature cautious, regardless of how social they are. 

12.6 Metamorphosis 

Here we have a very extraordinary sixth line. The next great mutation that will take place in humanity 
will take place in this stream that runs all the way down to the 39. The mutation will actually take place in 
the 55.6 and will eventually find its manifestation in the expression through the 12.6. This will be the 
mutation that opens up what the Voice referred to as our Spirit Consciousness. That is the consciousness 
that is possible underneath the emotional motor. This line is called Metamorphosis. Faith in, and energy 
applied towards change and emergence from standstill. 

Sun exalted. Creative transcendence that, when connected to the harmonic gate 22 through the channel of 
Openness, leads to successful mutation and the emergence of a new social form; or A retrograde 
metamorphosis that has evolved a perfected adaptation to standstill. This is typical of the sixth line. Here 
you have the potential for real mutation, the mutation of the social form itself. This mutation has not come 

yet. We have minor mutations of the social form, but the real major mutation has not come yet. This sixth 
line is always waiting for this mutation. 

Not only are they less likely to be social, they are less likely to be cautious. They don't care about either 
of those things. What they really care about is what is the mutation and what will it do? The next gate is 
the 15, which is the love of humanity and it is on the path to leadership. What can it do for humanity? Is 
this social mutation going to be of value to the totality? This is so important to all sixth lines. They have 
to see that something can really be It'. 

The capacity to mutate and express new social forms. This is always inherent in the 12.6. It means that if 
you have that kind of energy, it is always possible for you, through your explanation, to bring a real 
change in the way in which people deal with each other. In bringing out this mutative energy, this is what 
slowly begins to change everything. Without mutation, there is no real change. 

When you come to the other side: The perfected adaptation to caution that can accept social limitations. 
These are people that will just stand back forever and say, "That is the way it is and nothing is going to 
change that. Why should I get involved? Why should I go through all the pain of dealing with their 
emotional wave to try to get them to a point where they can really be clear about what I am explaining to 
them? It is just not worth it because they are too confused and we will never get this thing to work out." 

Whereas the exalted of the 12.6 recognizes deep inside that it has a genetic capacity to change the 
emotional system, this line will truly be a metamorphic line in the moment that the solar plex center starts 
its actual mutative change. All of that will be expressed through this stream. But, like all sixth lines, you 
have to recognize that the nature of that is to be an example for others. The deepest thing that lies within 
the individual is, "Whatever I am presenting as an explanation, it has to be a valid example for others or 
they are going to stone me, or they will see me as a hypocrite if they can't understand it. Then they will 
think that I am not telling them something that is valid or true." The 12.6 is deeply cautious but at the 
same time, there is magic in it because it can bring deep mutation to humanity. 

HEXAGRAM 13 THE FELLOWSHIP OF MAN 

We come to the collective process, to one of the role gates. It is different from the individual process, 
which is about the individual direction, about being the direction. The perspective that we have in the role 
of individuality is the perspective of being able to release the role in the now, of just being able to get the 
creative process out. 

When you come into the collective roles, you come to something different. The logical collective role will 
project into the future and the abstract collective role will always looks backwards into the past. It is here 
that the collective gets to establish where it has been and where it is going which gives it its sense of 
continuity and its sense of well-being. After all, everything about how we stabilize our existence is, in 
essence, about the collective field. 

We come to the 13th hexagram, The Fellowship of Man, which is of extreme importance to the nature of 
what it is to be human. That is, the abstract circuitry represents our experiential way which is literally the 
way of being human. This way begins with the 41st hexagram, the initiating codon, the beginning of 
experience, and gets completed in this channel 33/13 of the witness and The Prodigal. It is something to 
understand about the nature of any abstract process: nothing is really learned until the process is really 
over. 

It is one of the keys to being in the abstract (you will see that particularly in the Vessel of Love, in the 
46): to be in the experience because, unless one is totally absorbed within the experience, one does not 
accrue enough information for a proper reflection later. If you are not always looking in the rear view 
mirror, you are bound to miss certain things that you have passed. 

The 13 l gate is the gate of the listener, but more important than that, it is a gate of secrets because it 
collects the reflections of the past. This is one of the many gates within the rave system that is specifically 
associated with memory. Above the lines in the hexagram it says: Universal ideas and values in an 
ordered framework which inspires humanistic cooperation. 

'Universal ideas and values in an ordered framework..." This is the whole process of collecting the past. 
The time is the continuity or, in the case of the passenger driving in the car, the distance is the continuity. 
We do that with calendars. We have a big date coming up: 2000. It gives us this sense of continuity and 
we can all look back 1000 years and can say, "Well, we have completed this continuity." 

...which inspires humanistic cooperation. That is, it is this continuity and the collection of history that 
inspires humanity. It is true. It inspires humanity in the sense that, unlike our mammalian cousins, we 
don't have to start over every generation. Human beings have this capacity to be able to store memory and 
then to be able to exchange it, to share it within in the nature of the collective process. 

This sharing of history is indeed inspiring to humanity. It is a much faster process today, for example, 
than it was 100 years ago. Our collection system is faster, our dispersion system is faster and the faster we 
get, the more advanced each generation is from the one before it because it gets to learn essential 
information that has been learned by the previous generation. And it gets to learn it right away when it 
comes into the world. This is the advantage of the 13th gate: to store our experience in order to inspire 
humanity with it. 

13.1 Empathy 

"The ability to relate and commune with everyone with equanimity" is something that you learn in the 
lifetime and not something that you learn right away. All first lines give you a key. The key in this 

hexagram is about the empathic process. The line is called Empathy and it is an overview line, which 
means that The lower trigram does not know that there is anyone to listen to and everything they hear is 
sort of by accident. In other words, they really get secrets in a way. They hear things that they did not 
even realize they were supposed to hear or could hear and suddenly they have access to it. 

Venus exalted. "Harmony through affection. A role of openness in listening to others with affection. " 
The 13th gate is the role of the self in its openness for interaction with others, in its ability to be receptive 
to others and because this is a gate that collects history, it collects people's stories. It is by its very nature 
an empathic gate. It is always pulling people to it in that sense. 

In the white book, we have this Venusian Role of openness in listening to others with affection. This is 
one of the foundations of getting secrets out of people. For example, in crime movies where you have the 
good cops and the bad ones. The good one is so sweet that he always gets the story. This is empathic 
listening with affection. 

The Moon in detriment. The politician kissing babies. An openness that is never free of motives. " This is 
superficial affection, but at the same time, the politician that is ready to go out and to kiss the babies is 
empathic enough to hear the stories of the parents. 

In the white book: An openness that is never free of motives. It is very important to see that motive is 
going to be a part of the 13th gate process because the 13 is burdened by other people. The lower trigram 
always feels the burden the greatest. They say, "Why do people bother me? I have to listen to them." 
There is a genuine affection built into this gate where it does tend to listen for the sake of soothing the 
other rather than for what it thinks it is going to hear or for the value of what it is going to hear is. It is just 
collecting in that sense. 

13.2 Bigotry 

One of the things you must have noticed in your work with Human Design is that second lines have funny 
names and they are often deeply misunderstood, like the 58.2, Perversion, the 46.2, Prima donna, the 
18.2, Terminal disease, or Degeneracy in the 48.2. Second lines have strong names and people are always 
very concerned about them, mostly because they simply cannot understand how the line actually works. 

Realize what a second line is: that other people are seeing you as that aspect; they are looking inside of 
you and see you. Think about what happens to the 13.2. Everybody who steps into the aura of a 13.2 
assumes that they are going to listen to them empathetically. They just assume it. The 13.2 is minding its 
own business, not listening and not needing to hear anything in particular. All of a sudden, there is 
somebody stepping into its aura and telling it things and the 13.2 is quite surprised. What happens to the 
13.2 (think about lines as children) is that they end up listening to all kinds of different voices they have 
no control over and they end up being quite frankly disgusted by it. They hear that people have a lot of 
crap to say. 

Remember that the 13 is really here to distinguish the values and ideals that we have experienced in order 
to inspire humanity. Here is the 13.2 being forced to listen to all kinds of different people. Do not 
misunderstand that line of Bigotry. A 13.2 gets all these people in their life telling them things that they 
did not ask for in the first place. Yes, they end up being quite discriminatory. The risk, always present, 
that fellowship can only exist for a particular type, whether racial, religious, national or intellectual. 

Moon exalted. Tolerance as the least offensive manifestation of bigotry. In the white book: A role of 
openness through tolerance. This is not a dirty word. The fact of the matter is that the 13.2 that has the 
exalted still has to suffer many fools in their lives and they wonder, "Why am I listening to all this stuff?" 

In the detriment: The obsessive belief that the highest ideals cannot be embraced by the lowest forms. An 
extremely difficult position, where even the highest ideals provide rationalization for hatred. It is not 
difficult, given the experience of what it is to be human, to find things to dislike about human beings. We 
know that. We find things to dislike about the people that we love the most. After all, we are very good at 
finding things that we dislike about other human beings. It is quite a common thing. 

The detriment in the white book: A role of openness so narrow that there is practically no one worth 
listening to. They may in fact go deaf and will not listen to any of it because "They are all fools and they 
are just bothering me." That does not preclude that they will get to hear what they have to. Remember, 
this is deeply social. We are talking about the collective gate which is by its very nature social. This 
collection of history is a social phenomenon that we used to have as oral history when the shaman of the 
tribe tells the story of their fathers and grandfathers. Thus, a tradition of knowledge is built based on the 
communication of experience. 13.2's can end up being quite bitter about the nature of what humanity 
really is. Don't blame them for being the bigots. 

There is a risk that is referred to in the introduction line that refers to there being a risk for humanity if 
this would dominate in the world. It is part of what we have in the world a lot of prejudice. Prejudice can 
be positive or negative. You can have a 13.2 that has a relatively clean psyche and their prejudice is 
something that they learn to deal with because they learn to see that human beings just don't have always 
something worthwhile to contribute. On the other hand, you have all kinds of people that will take the 

13.2 and turn that into a reason to dislike the other. So it is a risk for humanity. 

There is this moment for a 13.2 where, all of sudden, people that you never expected to have something 
important to say, do so. Usually children do that to them. That awakens the possibility that you can 
actually hear something worthwhile from the unexpected. Kids can say something very profound and it 
just changes the 13.2. 

By the way, the answer for all second lines is rooted in the individual process in the 10.2, where it says, 
'Be a hermit,' and in the 12.2, where it says, 'Purify yourself from all negative forces.' You have to be very 
careful with any second line that you let into your aura because they can penetrate you so easily and see 
that aspect in your nature. 

13.3 Pessimism 

The third line, because it is an adaptive line and because it is trial and error, you will have trial and error 
in who you listen to. It is not the uncontrolled process that happens to the second line. This is a process of 
tuning in through trial and error who you listen to, who you take in to hear. You can see that in the line 
called Pessimism, which is an overview line, that it is a lifelong process. 

The belief that what is best can never be achieved. This is something that the third line learns as a curve in 
life. This is its learning process. What happens to it is that the moment that it is listening to a certain type, 
it gets what it does not want to hear. It gets to see in that human being what it does not want. It tries to 
listen to another type. It goes through quite a process of disappointment in life about the nature of what a 
human being is. 

The Earth exalted. A lack of trust that can only be transformed through concrete evidence. This is a 
possibility for mutation in the abstract process: to make sense out of the past. It helps to have evidence 
rather than just speculation. 13.3's become very suspicious of people. They become deeply mistrusting of 
them and they are the kind of people that know a kind of storyline being delivered to them. They are very 
good at hearing the propaganda, the lie. 

In the white book: Openness that is conditioned by suspicion and seeks evidence. In America, they have 
this wonderful expression: 'the Man from Missouri' who says, "Show me." It is always this hand out. 
"Show me. Put it here in my hand. Let me see exactly what it is." 

Venus in detriment. Pessimism exalted to an art form... The one thing about realizing that human beings 
don't live up to the ideal is that they are also humorous in the way that they do not live up to the ideal. 
One can call that black humor but it can become art. It can become satire. In other words, rather than 
trying to inspire humanity with history and facts, which can be quite brutal (who can read the historic 
record of the last century and not be astounded at how barbaric human beings can be?), this is satire. The 
satire can have the same effect. It can inspire humanity. 

My favorite 13.3 story is about the famous Irish writer, Jonathan Swift, a member of the English 
parliament, who was born the beginning of the 18th century. He is the author of 'Gulliver's Travels'. 
During that time, the English and the Irish had trouble with each other so he wrote a satire: 'Modest 
Proposal'. What he proposed, in order to make everybody happy, was that the Irish should sell their babies 
to the English for food. He talked about how wonderful that would be. There would not be so many Irish 
babies, so this would not be a problem. People would have enough to eat and babies are really delicious 
and he gave recipes for cooking them. He described how the English would love to eat these fresh babies 
and there would not be these supply problems. It was satire. It was meant to humiliate the English. The 
fact is that the satire was actually taken seriously by some people, which is really quite astonishing. The 
impact of pessimism as art is that it humiliates us to the point that we laugh at ourselves and, perhaps, that 
has some impact on our direction. 

Because the 13th gate is a gate of secrets, every time the lower trigram gets access to the throat, what 
pops out is something that the 13th gate is unprepared for because it is not consciously holding onto what 
it is listening to in that gate. The 13th is a gate where memory is stored. How that memory pops out is 
dependent on the 33 that steps into its aura, or on whatever way it gets that information out. Often that 
satire can be cruel and bitter and, sometimes, 13.3s can say things to people that are just devastating, 
which is actually their form of satire but can be taken as something that is bitterly cruel. 

13.4 Fatigue 

With the fourth line we come to the recognition that there is an opportunity as a possibility for expression 
out of the throat. Because of that, the fourth and fifth lines, in particular, have a different process that they 
have to deal with. Third lines are inherently weak. It is a weakness simply in the sense that third lines 
always have to adapt, always have to go through trial and error and mistakes. In that sense, it is an 
inherent weakness. But when you come to the abstract process, you will find that the real weakness in this 
process is in the fourth line and not in the third. You can smell the weakness of the abstract process in the 
30.4, Burnout. Here, we have a very similar fourth line to the 30.4. This line is called Fatigue. 

Think about what happens: the 13th gate is there to listen. The lower trigram only listens when it is 
broken in on because it does not look for it. It does not know that the possibility is out there that someone 
will tell it something. But the fourth line knows that and it goes out there to listen. It is ready to listen and 
because of that, it does not get to do the most important thing, which is that after listening comes the 
reflection. It just keeps on listening. This is somebody who decides that they will write a great book about 
the experiences of people in Sarajevo during the civil war. What they end up doing is recording people 
endlessly. They never write their book. They are totally burned out by the process of just going through 
listening. Fatigue. 

Overview line: The point of exhaustion eventually reached when one is too tired to fight. This will have a 
deep significance, depending on the nature of the design and type. If you have an energy type, they will 

listen longer than those who are not. The energy and the non-energy type, though both will still reach the 
same point of exhaustion, they will reach it at different times in their lives. 

Pluto exalted. This is the only line in the 13 that is Pluto-related and this is a generation that was born in 
the 1940's or 1950's. The renaissance that comes with truce and its eventual reinvigoration. In other 
words, this is the moment where you stop the listening. They finally learn to stop listening. They have 
heard enough. They do not need to hear anymore. 

Openness which leads to exhaustion and the need for silence. You can interpret the silence as a need for 
reflection afterwards. There must be this space; otherwise, it does not work. 

On the other side of this fourth line, we have Venus in detriment. Emotional exhaustion. Appeasement 
and withdrawal. Regarding the emotional context that is given here, the abstract process is deeply related 
to the solar plex system. Our human experience is conditioned by the solar plex. The desire in life, the 
desire to be alive, the desire for life, is all rooted in the emotional system. Those people who are 13's end 
up taking in an enormous amount of emotional energy in their life. Somebody goes down in their 
emotional wave, seeks out the 13 to unburden themselves and the 13 ends up taking it all in. You find that 
13's with undefined emotional systems end up being very sick, whereas 13's with a defined emotional 
system can survive it because they generate their own wave. 

The detriment in the white book: A role where openness is a vulnerability. Think about the irony here. 
Fourth lines are normally very influential because they are one-tracked and focused and because they do 
have the gift of externalizing. But here, it is detriment. Here, the fact that one can externalize the listening 
also means that, in their fixedness, they don't know how to stop listening. Only when they get to the point 
of exhaustion do they stop. These are people that end up working as social therapists of some kind and 
they build their schedule so that they have people talk to them all day long, every day. After three or four 
months they collapse; they get very sick, take three weeks off to recuperate because they are very ill, and 
then they go back into exactly the same program because they do not know how to stop listening unless 
they are exhausted. 

One of my favorite stories about the 13's in my life. I have the 33.6. I originally had a publisher who 
wanted to bring out the Human Design system in English and German. He told me he knew a very good 
translator and that he would get in touch with him. I was living in Bavaria at that time and the publisher 
told me that the translator was nearby. The first time I was given Jiirgen's name, I asked for his data
