opinion attached to it; otherwise, you could not have that name in your vocabulary because it comes out 
of opinion. So we have loads of opinions. The 17.1 is full of all of these opinions. 

The other side is: The possibility to limit opinions to what is pleasing. These people have opinions about 
what they like to have opinions about. Things that they are not interested in, they don't have opinions 
about or they do not tell you about them. In other words, their opinions are about things they like to have 
opinions about. These people, for example, have opinions about art. That is what they love to have 
opinions about. They have no opinion about politics. They are very much locked into that because that is 
what pleases them. They want to have a critical capacity only when it comes to art. The 17 is opposite the 
1 8th gate. It is full of challenging authority. It is full of criticism. These are the opinions that are attached 
to every name. The 17th gate entails a built-in experimentation that is taking place within about the value 
that any name has. 

17.2 Discrimination 

We come to projection here. This line is called Discrimination. The benefit of associations based on 
highest values. This line (and the whole hexagram) is always about two things: is one serving, or is one 
trying to rule? Is one serving one opinion, which means that somebody asks you, or the situation asks 
you, are you trying to rule and to impose your opinion? Are you trying to rule with your understanding? 
This is always the dynamic tension that exists within this hexagram, between serving and ruling. Here 
you have the classic in the projection and, as you will see, by the time we get to the fifth line, it becomes 
something quite special. It becomes No human is an island. It becomes something very important to 
understand in our nature. In the second line we have the beginning of this process. 

Sun exalted. The successful achievement of purpose through proper alignment. 'Proper alignment,' in this 
case is: The possibility to develop opinions through relationships. Somebody says to you, "What do you 
think?" Then you can project. If nobody asks you what you think, you can't project. 

When you come to the other side of this, you have the Moon in detriment. An overactive discrimination 
that leaves one virtually alone. The possibility of being opinionated at the expense of relationships. This 
is trying to rule. This is the other side, the side that cannot wait to be asked. They have to project it 
outwards. In the moment of projection, they are trying to rule with their understanding. Please, recognize 

something about that. They may be right. It is always true in all of these gates. Do not bring any moral 
judgment to the fact that they operate through their polarity. Both sides can be right or wrong. But the 
nature of the way in which it works is that they are always trying to rule with their understanding. 

This is a collective circuit. It is about sharing. One can only rule when they serve, which means that you 
have to be asked first. This is the tension that exists in the 17th hexagram. It is much easier for people 
who have the 17 without the 62. The 17 without the 62, by the very circumstance of not having the whole 
channel, has to wait for that opportunity to be asked, or the opportunity that the situation asks them 
because, suddenly, it is activated. It is very different when you are dealing with the 17/62. Like the 43/23, 
it can become an automatic loose canon. It just blurts out and the understanding is imposed on somebody 
else. They may not like that. It may be right or wrong. 

17.3 Understanding 

When you get to the top of the lower trigram, you get to the line of adaptation, the line of bonds made and 
broken, of irresponsibility. It is called Understanding. The awareness that the best road is not necessarily 
the most interesting. The best road for any opinion is towards detail. That is what is meant here. The only 
thing that makes an opinion worthwhile is if it is substantiated by appropriate detail. 

Pluto exalted. The following of the best road provides the experience necessary to meet the challenge of 
the road's end. In the Book of Letters: The understanding that the best opinions are grounded in detail. 
Opinions need to be substantiated; otherwise, experimentation will never take place. Remember the 
difficulty of the logic process to find energy. Only the best opinion has a chance to get and attract that 
energy. If there are any loopholes, they will always come up in the experimentation. 

The Earth in detriment. The taking of short-cuts. One may get to the end quicker, but essential experience 
will be missing. The possibility of skipping details and limiting the value of the opinion. The fact is that 
every time an opinion does not have enough detail, there is always going to be somebody out there (I call 
them the money lenders) that says, "Well, you'd better go back to the committee room because we are not 
ready to invest yet in that experiment because we noticed that you did not have form ZW 21926 done and 
you have to get that form done before we can even consider it." You have to have all of the details. 

17.4 The Personnel manager 

We come to the upper trigram and this line of externalization. It is a one -tracked process, but it is the 
mirror image of The Teacher on the abstract side that we looked at. I mentioned at the beginning that 
what we are looking at is the Aquarian potential to the Piscean teacher on the abstract side. Here it is 
called The Personnel manager. 

Pluto exalted, a lovely place for Pluto. The ability to probe and discover the underlying motivation and 
resources of those who wish to follow. Here we find the gift to be able to really understand others. One 
cannot rule until one understands others. It is essential because to rule means that you must serve the 
other. That is the nature of ruling. That is why the Chinese had this tradition of the superior man as a 
ruler. This superior man served as a ruler. He served the interest of the people above and beyond his own 
interest. This is the nature of true service: as a ruler being the one who serves. 

Jupiter in detriment. The overgenerous and often misguided acceptance of would-be -followers, often with 
disastrous results. The Personnel manager has the gift of being able to say, "Here is the pattern and here is 
where you fit in because I understand what you need." Given the nature of ignorance in the world, this 
can be a very frightening thing in the way in which it actually gets applied and there are an enormous 
number of people that get manipulated this way. 

In the Book of Letters: The possibility of opinions based on the understanding of others. "I understand 
how this works and I understand how it works for you, and in that I can serve you." 

The other side is Jupiter in detriment. The possibility of opinions attracting others. This is really a 
capacity to attract others and bring them to this order. This is all about order. This is the design of an 
organizational being. 

Everything about the mental logic process is figuring out how to get everybody to fit into a cubbyhole, 
something everybody hates. One of the ironies for me is that the ability to see where everybody fits in, 
which is the capacity that lies within this knowledge, would be in many ways deeply offensive to a great 
number of humanity in the sense that it would appear to be manipulation, which it is not. It can only come 
at a time when people really understand from a very early point. 

This is a strong manipulative field: bringing people to understanding through the ability to externalize 
that. But it is a very fixed understanding. This is not universal understanding. This is just externalization. 
It is trying to get your opinion across and it is a gift of attracting people to your opinion. It is very 
common to see that in politics, for example when you have a one-opinion candidate like Le Pen in France. 
He is a one-opinion politician. "I understand that this is bad," and then he works attracting everybody to 
that one opinion. They get very fixed in that. 

17.5 No man is an island 

The fifth line has a special significance. One of the things to recognize about the nature of this line is its 
resonance to the 18.5, which is its opposition. The 18.5 is the line of Therapy; on one side, the capacity to 
both seek and provide guidance, and on the other side, chronic instability and the mental patient. Here, 
you find the mirror of this. This is an important mirror because what the fifth line in the 18 talks about is 
the inability to do it alone. Here, we have the line of No human is an island. The recognition, however 
understood, that there is no end to hierarchies. 

Uranus exalted. Please understand the significance of that. We will have Uranus transiting this gate in 
about 14 years. This will be an enormous event. Uranus exalted: The ultimate creative expression of 
interdependency, whether as god's will or global synthesis. What you see here is Opinions that can 
express the value of being organized, whether mundane or spiritual. 

The greatest service of the logical process is to finally be able to allow everyone to have exactly their 
place in resonance. If everybody is in their place in resonance, everybody has a complete process and the 
totality has a process far beyond that. This is an Aquarian process. That is why you have Uranus here that 
is establishing the exalted. We will have a very important transit of this which will have an enormous 
impact, not in terms of when it happens. The most important thing to see about transits is that every time 
you look at a date in the ephemeris, remember that millions of babies are being born. 

The transit of Uranus through that gate (it stayed there for a year and eight months, and it stayed two or 
three months in that line), will have an enormous impact because all those children will carry it as their 
genetic material. We will have a whole new generation that, from the very beginning, is open to this 
global synthesis, and they will be born all over the world. It will not be limited to any particular place on 
the planet. 

Mars in detriment. The arrogance, despite all the evidence to claim, that the buck stops here. We see this 
in the world today with what fundamentalism is: the last gasp against the globalization that homogenizes 
everything, the world where everything simply gets homogenized and brought together. There is a deep 

resistance to that. On the other side of the Uranian power is the old, primitive resistance to being 
organized and it is the vanity to assume that where you belong in this life is up to you, not God's will, not 
global synthesis. 

The possibility of opinions that refuse to see the value of being organized. It is not about whether these 
people are good guys or bad ones. It is simply about recognizing that there is always going to be a tension 
because we have not reached the point yet where we are socially organized. I can't remember the details 
exactly but they have a scaling system of how to list the social possibilities of species. 

At the highest level of that, it is based on a number of criteria. It is based on three generations living 
together, the ability to communally interact and to support each other in times of stress. It ends up with a 
fourth step which is about the fact that the species is reproduced selectively. So, the highest members of 
this social organization business are ants, termites and wasps. We are going there. These insects are very 
organized. Humanity is very different. We have this enormous self-consciousness at work but where we 
are going towards is this highest level of organization which will really be fulfilled when we have spirit 
awareness and we can create our consciousness outside of our forms. 

But there always will be this resistance. What is coming is a genetic transformation. It is not about what 
you want it to be. We have a genetic transformation at work. There will always be recessive genes. These 
will be the recessives. They will say "I refuse to be organized." They will fight being organized and 
ultimately, some time deep into the next century, we will have this dilemma between those who are ready 
to be organized and those who refuse to be organized. That is going to be the political fault line of the 
future. In order to universalize out of this fifth line, obviously, the pattern really has to work, whatever it 
will be. 

I have a great Mc Donald's story. Mc Donald's opens a new outlet every three hours and in Nov. '96, they 
entered their one hundredth country. The thing that is so fascinating about that is that in the 100 countries 
that now have Mc Donald's, there has never been a war between them. 

17.6 The Bodhisattva 

In the 18.6 we have Buddhahood, the spoilt one. Here, The Bodhisattva is the spoiled one. If other people 
are not there waiting for their pronouncement, they get very upset. They understand what is good for 
everybody and they expect everybody to be there. By the way, they just might. That is the other side of it. 

The Bodhisattva is quite a role. The capacity is truly there, but again, like all sixth lines which are 
transition lines, two things are always there in the transition. One is this sense of not giving what you are, 
not giving understanding because it is not worthwhile. You want something much greater than that. You 
want to see everything organized. It is not enough just to understand; you want to see it immediately 
implemented so you can see all of that organized. That is what is interesting for this sixth line. Most of 
the time, the understanding does not necessarily come out because there is this immediate recognition (no 
energy) that it is not going to be able to get organized. 

Perfected following, one with and the same as perfected leading. Moon exalted. The great nurturer. The 
nature of this position is always positive, (including the detriment). Jupiter in detriment. The tendency on 
the perfected path that it is a straight line that ends, rather than a circle. 

In the white book: The possibility in understanding the nature of interdependence to express opinions of 
value to others. 

But the fact that it is a possibility does not mean that you will do it. This is the kind of being that is not 
going to share their opinion with you if they don't think that you will not do anything about it. The 
moment that you are saying to them, "Give me your opinion and tell me what to do," these people love to 
have people come to them and say, "Oh, Master. What do I do?" The Master sits there and says, "Don't..." 

The role is to organize, if somebody comes to them and says, "Oh, please tell me what I should do?" They 
are ready because the organization can take place. "Let me organize you." But if they can't organize them, 
then they don't do it. One of the things about these people is that they are often deeply attractive because 
they don't offer you the understanding unless you ask them, unless you go to them, unless you express a 
need for that. 

The detriment: Where understanding is achieved, the possibility of having the opinion that there is 
nothing else to learn. These can be very arrogant people. I have met this many, many times with people 
who have the 17.6 and they are astrologers, chakra workers, or whatever esoteric field. They always have 
the same response, "I don't need to understand anything else. I have this." There is always that aspect to 
them as well. 'The tendency on the perfected path' and you think that this is it. 

The whole thing to recognize about the inherent danger in both collective processes is that both of them 
are at the mercy of mutation. The organization of humanity is not going to take place until a mutation 
takes place. This mutation will change the way in which we will reproduce. It will make it very difficult 
for our species to reproduce. It forces us to be organized. This will come out of mutation. 

I was growing up in Montreal in a very nice neighborhood and it got more and more busy as more and 
more people bought automobiles. There were a lot of children in that neighborhood. The adults were 
always saying, "We should really ask the city to put up a traffic light." You know when they put up the 
traffic light? When the first child was killed, that moment, the traffic light went up. So the reality is that 
the way in which that operates is to wait until the mutation takes place in order for that process to change. 

The collective is at the mercy of mutation because everything they thought they understood or every 
experience they thought they had made sense of, all of a sudden, there is something new. In the moment 
that something new is there, that whole process on both sides has to go through a transformation in order 
to try to come to grips with what the new is. The resonance here is in the fifth line because this line is 
going to be ready. The Uranian generation will be ready to cooperate in order to keep the species alive. 

HEXAGRAM 18 WORK ON WHAT HAS BEEN SPOILT 

We move to the third potential in the splenic center which is the 18' gate, the gate of correction, where 
we work on what has been spoilt. It is part of the channel of insatiability. The keyword here is the 
awareness of what is vital or not. If the correction is not going to bring you a sense of value, if it is not 
vital, leave it alone. The awareness potential is to perfect via concentration. This is the place of salt in the 
body. It is where we store all of this possibility for correction. 

The 18 th hexagram is a related to the Oedipus and Electra complex because of its fear, the fear of 
authority. The first authorities we all meet are our parents. This is a natural place for this struggle for 
authority: the conflict between the male and the female and the conflict between same sexes in the family 
structure, this challenge of authority, this generation gap that is here in the 18th gate. 

The heading above the lines in the Rave I'Ching: The vigilance and determination to uphold and defend 
basic and fundamental human rights. It is my standard joke about people having the 18th gate who 
come up to me and say, "Ra, you should not smoke." I answer, "You mean that is true for everybody on 
earth?" and they say, "Yes". This is a collective experience. This is collective correction. 

One of the things to recognize about any kind of collective gate: don't take it personally. So many people 
with the 18 th gate, when you say to them, "You did a wonderful job," they say, "No. I could have done 
this. I could have done that." It is not personal. It is a process. 

18.1 Conservatism 

When you start here with the first line, it sounds like the other lines. The 32.1 is Conservation, the 28.1 
was Preparation, and here we have Conservatism. You can see the basic nature. Remember, every time 
that you look at a line you can see its framework. You know that all first lines will carry with it the need 
to establish the foundation for the whole hexagram. The foundation of the 18th gate is: The adherence to 
traditional patterns despite changing circumstances. 

Earth exalted. Gradual modification to avoid eventual upheaval. Jupiter in detriment. The patriarch 
whose rigidity guarantees deterioration. In the original I'Ching, the 1 8th gate is called 'Work on what has 
been spoilt by the Father'. I am deeply impressed with the mathematics of the I'Ching but not Confucius' 
interpretation of sexes. The fact is that, even in the original, there are several lines that were attributed 
directly to the Mother. In terms of the way that we look at the world and they way in which this works, it 
does not really matter, in that sense. Within the 18 th gate, we will always have that challenge to authority, 
whether it is male or female. 

The potential to correct through gradual modifications of judgments. It is like the way you feel about a 
parent when you are growing up with them and what you feel about them when you become a parent 
yourself. This is the nature of the first line, a totally different process. This is the gradual modification of 
judgments but, basically, very conservative. In the Confucius sense of the word, that conservative 
authority was always the father figure. This is what you get on the other side. You have to recognize 
about this line that, in a woman, it operates through what is yang in her. In other words, it is not really 
about the father and the mother but it is the male and the female. Le., it is the yang in the mother that can 
be operating here. 

The potential to refuse to correct. "My mother was always right," or "My father is always right." It can be 
deeply conservative in that sense. It is trying to set the basis. The basis is that if the authority does not 
have to be corrected, then you have a pattern you can trust. That is what the logic is looking for. It is 

looking for a perfect pattern. A perfect pattern does not need any correction and, therefore, we can safely 
project into the future out of that pattern. 

The person on the detriment side says, "My father's father was right, so I am right." This movement is 
going through there and, because of that, you can say, "You listen to me because he was right with me 
and I am right with you," to establish that authority. 

The potential to correct gradually. "Maybe my father was not always right." What happens in the first line 
is that, because it is setting the foundation, if it is deeply disturbed in the first line, the whole thing falls 
apart. This is all about correcting and challenging authority. First line people are very introspective and 
look into the nature of that and say, "Basically, they were right," or "We have to bring about some slow 
gradual change in that." 

18.2 Terminal disease 

With the second line, we come to projection and we have already seen that there is no sense of the nature 
of the gate itself. There is simply the need to project, the need for correction outwards. That is why it is 
the classic line of the bitch. The moment we have projection without any detail, we get all kinds of 
confrontations and problems that come out of that. 

Terminal disease. The recognition that what has been spoilt is irreversible. There is no way to correct it. 

Pluto exalted: Acceptance and strength derived from a faith in spiritual regeneration. In other 
words, leave all that business about correcting it and see if you can find your own inner quality. Forget 
about the authority that you are so annoyed with. 

In the white book: The acceptance that there is no potential for correction. Not everything needs to be 
corrected and, by the way, that does not have to be bad. In other words, you can just see there is no way to 
correct it, so all right. This thing cannot be corrected, so you deal with other things that can be corrected. 

The other side of this, the Moon in detriment: The futile raging against the wind. "This father and 
mother of mine are horrible and I want to change them. They have to change but they do not listen to me. 
I keep on telling them that they have to change." It does not work. It is just this endless projecting 
outwards. That becomes an illness in and of itself; we are dealing with the splenic system, after all. The 
raging against the wind builds up all kinds of tensions within the body. 

On the other side, in the detriment we have: The refusal to accept that there is no potential of correction. 
They are the people that can drive you crazy because they will not let go of it. They just keep on 
projecting because all second lines are limited in their ability to understand the other side. They do not 
know what it takes to deal with the other side and what the circumstances of the other side are. 

If somebody walks strangely due to a deformity and you want to correct that in them, he/she may have no 
way of changing that. You can scream at them all the time but this will not do any good. There is a point 
in which this can become enormously painful for anybody who has to deal with it and these people will 
turn it on themselves. The 18th gate is notorious for taking itself seriously and getting very personal about 
the nature of what their correction is supposed to be. They can become obsessed: "I refuse. It has to be 
corrected. He has to fix it. The whole world must stop smoking." 

18.3 The Zealot 

We know that the third line has the quality of having the introspective background in it and that it has the 
gift to project that outwards. It recognizes that there is something on the other side of the channel and it 
figures out a way to deal with or to adapt to that. The third line is in the emotional wave of bonds made 
and broken, and when you bring the two elements together, it can be irresponsible; it can get involved in a 
correction and then suddenly quit. That is also a part of it. 

In the third line we have The Zealot. The energetic obsession to clean house. These are very good house 
cleaners. 

Neptune exalted. The dissolution of old forms at an acceptable price. The third gate wants to correct. 
It is equipped. It has its detail, its introspection and its projecting capability. It wants to correct. It is 
obsessed with correction. After all, this is what the gate is all about. If I cannot correct anything else, I 
will sweep the floor and make sure that everything is nice and clean. The willingness is there, no matter 
what the correction is about. 

In the white book: An obsession with correction and its critical potential. Please recognize that, no matter 
how difficult it sounds, our collective would be lost without this because it would have no basis for our 
talents. There is no logic talent without this critical capacity, the perfecting capacity, this need to correct, 
this need to challenge the authority. Everybody would still write music in its original form. Everybody 
would dance the way we first danced. Nothing would have grown without this correcting capacity. 
Nobody would have said, "I judge that to be lousy. Let me show you what is good." 

Jupiter in detriment: Rigid jugdmentation that creates as many problems as it solves. "I know that 
this has to be corrected, whether you like it or not." The 'you' on the other end has to provide the energy 
for correction. If you are the 18 and you do not have the vital energy of the 58, all you can do is complain. 
You don't have the capacity to do anything about it because you are not being energized. 

An obsession with correction that does not bring satisfaction. What happens to the people at the detriment 
level is that they have all this correcting energy and they may get a chance to correct something, but it 
does not take away this "whatever" inside of them that two seconds later says, "Yes, and...? The thing we 
just corrected needs further corrections. Let's correct it more." Adolf Hitler had the detriment of this line. 

18.4 The Incompetent 

When we get to the fourth line, we get to the beginning of the upper trigram. This line is called "The 
Incompetent". The nature of fourth lines is to externalize, which means that these lines are very fixed on 
a specific aspect. In some way, this is very reminiscent of the way in which the second line works. 
Difficulties as a result of inadequacies that cannot be resolved because of inadequacies. What this 
generally means for these people is that they will have a specific thing they want to correct. There are all 
kinds of other things they are able to correct in their life, but the one thing that they really want to correct, 
they can't because they are inadequate to do that. By the way, the moment that they meet somebody that 
has the 48 and they get into contact with The Well, this can relieve inadequacy. The fear of inadequacy is 
in the 48th gate, which is the next step in this stream. 

Remember that we are looking at gates that are potentials in a four gate stream. Here we have the 
potential of this awareness. The thing to recognize is that the awareness alone, this one thing that they 
cannot correct because of inadequacy, can come into contact with the necessary depth. That is always 
possible. All lines can ultimately be the exact mirrors of what they say. 

Earth exalted: Given this negative position, survival through suffering. The inability to correct and 
its potential for suffering. These are people that say, "I just cannot make it better," and they really suffer. 

"I can't fix it. I can't correct it. I can't come up with a solution to this problem. I can't do anything about 
it." 

Mercury in detriment. Indecision and anxiety and no escape from misfortune. The demands of 
correction and its potential to generate anxiety. This constant anxiety comes from having this one thing 
that you can't correct. When you see this line, be very careful about that. Don't see that as meaning that 
they are incompetent with everything. That is not true. So often, when people see this line, they think that 
it is saying that they are incompetent to correct their general process. This is not true. Everything about 
the fourth line is about being fixed. You have to ask these people, "What is this one thing that you want to 
fix, that you can't?" and see that isolated from the rest which you can work with. 

The inability to correct and its potential for suffering; or The demands of correction and its potential to 
generate anxiety. One can become very anxious if there is this one thing that one cannot fix. This is the 
difficulty of the fourth line. 

The fourth line can recognize incompetence everywhere because they know what it is like for them. This 
is true for every line that you read and think, "Oh, my god, these poor people." The lines have their 
positive and negative and every line is a duality. These are processes that we go through. And whatever 
line you have, it is yours. Enjoy it. 

18.5 Therapy 

The fifth line is called Therapy. It is a very important line. After all, we have a collective process here and 
the fifth line is the universalization line. Thus we have a universalized collective process here. It is the 
ultimate of what this hexagram is all about. The interesting thing about this is that when you look at what 
this line says, you realize that what correction represents is that it can be of enormous value or it can 
make you very ill. That is what it is saying. 

The strength to recognize a problem and to accept that it is beyond one 's power to solve it alone. This is 
a collective sharing process. This is the only place where the word 'therapy' exists. So, this has a lot to do 
with what we call therapeutic sciences or work that is done in our society. 

Saturn exalted. The wisdom to both seek and provide guidance. The potential for correction and 
judgment through relationships. This is the universalization of correction. It is about correcting the other. 
The fifth line knows that, apart from the gate, there is a stream and a circuit and it wants to correct others 
and needs correction as well. That is part of its process. That correction is rooted in relationships. 

The Uranian side: The mental patient. Chronic instability and potential madness. Where would the 
therapist be without their crazy patient? And they both have the same line. Think about that, folks. That is 
very funny. The therapist and the crazy patient are the same. I have seldom met a therapist who was saner 
than their patients. It simply does not work. They are simply, subjectively, relatively nuts in different 
ways. They are exactly the same and mirrors of each other, and that mirror is here in Therapy. 

Where relationships cannot assist in correcting the potential of mental instability. The need on one side to 
correct the unstable and the need of the unstable to be corrected by the other: this is all built within this 
fifth line. 

The nature of this hexagram, in the end, is all about the protection of fundamental human rights: to find a 
common ground in which it is possible for us to have a secure pattern which we can live in the future so 
that we can evolve safely. This is all about finding the solution. Here you have somebody who is always 

ready to correct the other. They are not ready to correct themselves. In the detriment, you have the other 
that is waiting for them to come and correct them. They all belong in the same bag. 

18.6 Buddhahood 

When you get to the sixth line, you get to the top of the house. You get to the roof. This line is called 
Buddhahood. It says: The perfected form. These people assume that everything is correct, whether it is or 
not. 

Mars exalted. The Buddha state of the eternal child and the energy to find new horizons to avoid stasis. 
"Everything is correct. Everything is great. What else is going to happen in this life? Where are we going? 
What is in the future for us?" 

Moon in detriment. The mundane application of the above. The ability to tap public opinion and share 
methodology. "Let me tell you why my life is perfect." That is the nature of Buddhahood. 

The potential of the perfected form through correction. Nothing needs to be corrected. Everything is okay. 
The other side of this is: The potential to share the values of the correction with others. "Let me tell you 
why." 

By the way, if you have this in your design, whether you are male or female, you need somebody who is 
much more mature than you, who is older than you as a lover. This is really about the child in its 
relationship to authority. It is very much, in a sense, the young child's way of looking at life. Everything is 
correct and okay. If you ask them why they feel so good, they will tell you that the grass grows green. 
They will share their methodology with you. They are not interested in this corrective process. What they 
really want is to be spoilt. This is not work on what has been spoilt. This is: please spoil me. Buy me nice 
presents. Take me out to dinner. Treat me like a child. Give me my bath. They get what they want out of 
everybody. If you look at the fuel at the other side, it is called Getting carried away. It can be very nice 
except that you have to serve them all the time. 

HEXAGRAM 19 APPROACH 

The 19th gate is a gate of wanting and needing. As you have seen, the fuel in the 41 fuels our 
evolutionary process in sequences and the fuel in the 39 provides essential energy for the mutative stages 
of that evolution. The 19th gate is about making sure it fuels having the resources necessary to maintain 
all of that. 

Those resources (we are dealing with a mystical channel here, the 19/49) are about mundane concerns 
(how many sheep are in the fields, how much corn is growing), but is also spiritual. It is the beginning of 
our religious process. It is the gate of animism. It is the gate where we worship the spirit in animals. 
Because of their sacrifice, we can benefit from their energy by eating them. The 19th gate is a fuel that is 
the energy to need or not. 

Recognize that this is the pressure to have resources because it is in a pressure center. Anybody that ever 
has been in a tribal environment, anybody that has ever been married, or anybody that has ever been 
involved in co-support with somebody, understands the pressure of having the necessary resources. All 
tribal relationships are rooted (no pun intended, but it is there) in the pressure to have the resources that 
are necessary. It is important to see the power that lies in that gate: what resources does the tribe need? 

Above the lines it says: That all things are interrelated is apparent and manifested through the action of 
approach. The tribe recognizes the tribal bond. It is apparent. It is obvious that you have to support each 
other. Otherwise, things do not work. In other words, everything is interrelated as long as there are 
enough resources and the moment that there is a lack of resources, everything falls apart. 

I know that so well. For example: the North of Spain. I love Basque country. It is very beautiful and there 
are some extraordinary villages to the west of Bilbao. These villages are locked away in picturesque 
mountains. Magnificent, ancient stone houses, huge houses that were meant for families with 10 or 12 
children, dotted all over the landscape. They are all empty. The village, its culture and its life is gone. It is 
gone because the resources were no longer available. 

Remember that the resources in the 19 are not just the obvious, that we have to have enough to eat. Where 
are the other things we need? The resources are things like education. As soon as Spain entered into the 
modern European circle, the value of education for the young became something universalized and 
something that was accentuated. These children, growing up in these tiny little villages, started to move 
out into local colleges and universities. They saw different horizons that were not available for them in 
their villages and suddenly, it was over. Thus, we have all the empty houses in this beautiful landscape. 

Understand how important it is that everything is interrelated if there are enough resources. That tells you 
about the nature of the world. It is easy to say that we are all brothers and sisters, united as one. 
Everything is obviously interrelated as long as there are enough resources. If everybody has enough to eat 
and has shelter, if everybody has opportunities relative to their skills and potentials, then you have an 
interrelated, peaceful world. 

It is very important to understand that the resources have to be there. This is the pressure to make sure 
that the resources are there because, without them, everything is no longer interrelated in operation, even 
though it is in fact. If there are not enough resources, the tribe will disband and the group will fall apart. 

19.1 Interdependence 

The first line is the foundation and it always gives you the essential truth of a hexagram. Here, the first 
line is called Interdependence. 

The Sun exalted. The successful approach that does not lose its individual character in acceptance. At the 
other end of the channel, you have the 49, the gate of Revolution, of principles and of rejection. It is an 
emotional gate. When resources seem to be available one moment, they may not be there the next 
moment. 

In the white book: The pressure of wanting without losing one's identity when being accepted by others. 
Others are always involved here because this is all about support. But the reality is that simply because 
one needs to have resources does not mean that one gives up one's nature in order to get those resources. 
This is very important. In other words, the tribe is not meant to be homogeneous. The tribe allows for 
individuality, for difference, as long as everybody is contributing to the resources, which can then be 
available for all. 

When you get to the other side of this energy, we have the Moon in detriment. The tendency, once an 
approach is accepted, to get stuck in continued reflection at the expense of continued development. It is 
not just about wanting to be needed. It is not just about resource of food, spirit, religion. It is also the 
resource of having a partner. Remember that this is the channel of the bride and groom. This is all about 
creating the initial bargain that creates the foundation of how any kind of tribal relationship is going to 
work. 

In the white book it says: The pressure for acceptance which fears eventual rejection. The 19th gate flirts 
because it is looking for the possible resources at the other end. The moment that those resources are 
offered, it may not be the real thing. It may be momentary. The resources may be there and, later, they are 
not because the 49th gate is moving in a wave. 

The recognition about the first line is that, yes, there is interdependence, but there is no dependency. If 
you go into any man/woman relationship anywhere on this planet, you will come to this place: are we 
interdependent, or is one of us dependent on the other? This does more damage to relationships than 
anything else. It is fundamental in establishing the nature of the tribe. Are we interdependent? Are we 
allowed to be our own selves within our support for each other or is that support based on one being 
dependent on the other, as we well know? The vast majority of relationships have been based on 
dependency instead of interdependency. 

Here you have the fundamental theme for marriage, for the bonding of people in a life work together. This 
is the fundamental dilemma. Is it going to be interdependent, or is it a dependency? You can see very 
clearly that, the moment there is dependency, there is a loss of identity. In the moment of dependency, 
one has to go against one's own principles because one is dependent. Thus, they no longer have the power 
that exists in interdependency. 

19.2 Service 

The second line is all about projection. You can see that this second line is the one that has a highly 
valued title. It is called Service. If you wonder how they chose the priestesses for temples, the little boys 
and girls that were the reincarnated Lama: these are the children that were usually pulled out. These are 
the ones that get automatically recognized by those who are sensitive as being ready to serve at some 
level, if you go down a "road lined with begging kids, it will be the child that has the 19.2 that you 
address with, "You come. I'll feed you and you'll do some things for me." That is the one that is projecting 
out, whether it is true or not, that they will be of service in return. Never forget the bargain. They are of 
service in return for the resources. The resources have to be there but they are ready and willing to serve. 
The dedication of personal resources as a result of external contact. Personal resources are: "You use your 
body and I will feed you. You will work in my fields." 

Jupiter exalted. Dedication and service to the highest values. Mercury in detriment. Protracted indecision, 
but given the nature of this position, eventual compliance. First we have the resistance to being of service, 
to being a servant in order to get access to the resources. In our age, we do not have this so much, but in 
the past, there were always indentured people, people who worked for other people, who were not given 
salary but food, and lived as part of that community in return for their labors. This form of service is very 
ancient. It is indentured labor in that sense. It can also be at the highest level. 

The energy to want to be of service. That is projected out. That is why these people are chosen when they 
are very young, so that they can be conditioned to that for the rest of their lives. They project out, "I will 
be of service." Thus, they end up being of service. They end up being servants. They end up being of 
service, but not necessarily for the highest values. 

On the Mercurial side we have, The need to be wanted that will eventually turn its energy to service. In 
other words, the only way for these people, no matter how much they resist, is that they finally have to be 
of service in order to get the resources. Otherwise, they do not get in on the bargain and they are left out 
of the tribe. If you are left out, you have no life anymore. This was the tribe's greatest weapon. There is 
nowhere you can go if the tribe leaves you out: this 49 who says, "This one? No. Send them away." 

We are dealing with a Mystical channel here, so we can never discount the fact that what is of mundane 
service ("I will be of service if you will really reward me; I will give you the best service, if you can give 
me the best reward.") can also be spiritual. It can also be the priestess that says, "I will serve my goddess 
but I really want to be rewarded for that." The reward, in the spiritual sense, is that they will touch me, 
that they will contact me, that they will fill me with their power. That is also part of it. 

This is the beginning of our whole religious experience, which is also in this service. Somebody who 
naturally was projected on that they would be of service, "Okay, you service this temple to this goddess," 
will spend their life at it. They develop this higher principle service. It is built into these people that they 
are the ones that are selected in life to be of service. 

It can be quite frustrating. If somebody comes and projects on them, "You can be of service," afterwards, 
it turns out that they are not really. They are just pulled into that situation. If they do not really work 
because they may not be right for that kind of service, then it falls apart. Then they have great difficulties. 
Indentured labor is not slavery. There are always possibilities that at some point they can buy themselves 
out, though it is a very difficult process. 

This is where tribal prostitution is. Tribal prostitution is different from collective prostitution. Temple 
prostitution or prostituting oneself for the benefit of the tribe. The nature of this is being brought into 
service and made dependent. You can end up having to do things for the benefit of the tribe to get your 
resources. That is not a comfortable thing to be involved in. 

19.3 Dedication 

We come to the theme of trial and error and bonds made and broken. Here we are dealing with this theme 
within the context of support and the need for resources. This line is called Dedication. It is about being 
dedicated to needing those resources. No matter where you go with a 19, you are not going to escape this 
deep need for the resources, whatever the resources happen to be. 

Receptivity to approach can only be maintained through vigilance, being on guard. It is one of the things 
to understand about the nature of being dedicated, that it is not simply a matter to need to have the 
resources but, in order to get them, you have to stay with it. You have to be vigilant. You have to guard 

and protect it. If you figure out how to condition animals (that is part of this stream), how to get sheep to 
live in your backyard, it is not enough that you have them there and you know that you can eat them. You 
have to guard against them being taken away as well. In other words, you have to remain vigilant. This is 
not a one shot abstract experience where you grab the money and run. It means that you are stuck, that 
you are hooked up. It means that you are locked into a tribal obligation. Thus, vigilance is necessary. 
Otherwise, the resources can never be maintained or held on to. 

Venus exalted. The natural ease with which communion is maintained. Think about this: the natural ease 
with which communion is maintained, but not the resources. These people are so dedicated to needing the 
resources that they have no problem with other people in the tribe. It is surprisingly easy for them to make 
the relationships, but they do not really work out. They are a third line and make mistakes because it is 
not about the relationship. It is about whether or not the relationship can manifest, can bring about the 
resources. It does not matter who your associates are, but if you want to feed yourself and you want to 
live, you will have to have associates that will bring you to that. It requires vigilance, not simply just 
skills of being ready to support others or be supported. 

Moon in detriment. A tendency to moodiness... In this sense, it is all about sensitivity, the emotional field 
of this stream. ...that may lead to carelessness. 

In the white book: Sensitivity and ease fueled by acceptance by others. It is all very easy if somebody 
accepts me. I can be there with them, but the resources, that is where the vigilance is. It is not about how 
many friends you have. It is about how productive your relationships are in that sense. It is not about how 
many people are in the tribe. If 99 % of them are on the dole, the tribe is starving. It is not just about 
having the numbers in terms of people. This is the trial and error. 

The other side is, The need to be wanted hampered by oversensitivity. This oversensitivity is an enormous 
theme in this stream. It always has to do with resources. These people only become oversensitive when 
there are not enough resources for them. This is the other side of this line. It does not matter how many 
people are around. One becomes very sensitive, oversensitive as a potential, when the resources are not 
adequate for the need being offered. "Here I am. I am offering my support. Where are the resources? I 
give my support to you and you all have access to it." Then they get oversensitive: "What about me? You 
left me out? Am I in this bargain? Don't I get my cut?" This is the third line. It has to learn that it is not 
about numbers. 

The tribe is always stuck in numbers, this mundane aspect of being able to make more money for your 
work. It is not about how many people are there. It is the value inherent in the relationship. Is everybody 
in the tribe productive? Is the tribe truly interdependent or do we have a tribe that is based on 
dependency? Two people work and one person takes a ride. What kind of a tribe is that? The third line is 
saying, "Heyl You have to learn to see that not everybody is going to pull their weight." That is why there 
is so much flirting in the 19, trying to see who really does pull their weight, who really can carry through 
the vigilance and bring it to fulfillment. 

19.4 The Team Player 

When you come to the fourth line in the upper trigram, you really get to clearly see the resonance from 
the first line. The first line was about interdependency, or dependency. When you come to the resonance 
in the fourth line, you come to the power of single-mindedness, this fixed externalization in the fourth 
line. It is about The Team Player. Individual approach which attracts and accepts cooperation. 

Mars exalted and at its best; there is no other place in the Rave I'Ching that has such a comment on a 
planet. The power and energy for outward activity, and the ability to accept others as long as they can 

keep up. A driving force that can benefit the whole group. In the white book: The energy to seek out and 
exalt in the company of others. These are driving forces. "Where will we get those resources$ Come on. 
Let's do it." They are the ones that can bring this enormous energy to work as an interdependent energy. 
They bring their own, as long as everybody can keep up. 

When you come to the other side, you get to see what happens because it is Venus in detriment. Attractive 
and cooperative, but a tendency to dissatisfaction with the contribution of others. "They are dependent on 
me." Not the first line that says, "I am dependent on them." This is the other way around. "They are 
dependent on me and I don't want them to be dependent on me." That is when they become sensitive. 

A sensitivity energized by the limitation of others. "Why should I do all the work? I don't mind working 
and doing my share, but are you doing yours?" These people are very fixed. If you go to school with this 
kind of person and you get a summer job with them, the last thing you want to do is to work with them. 
They work hard all the time. They put in eight hours of hard work and the other person is wondering 
whether they are all right. "Don't work so fast. I want to have a cigarette. I want to have a rest to 
meditate." So, what happens is that they feel like everybody is being dependent on them and they have to 
carry everybody's weight. 

19.5 Sacrifice 

The fifth line, the line of universalization, is how everybody else sees the hexagram, or how they project 
onto the hexagram. This is the line of the dead. Think about what that is like: You are a commander in the 
fields and you have to take some hill away from the enemy. There are only two members of your troop 
that are going to stand out to you automatically: the 19.2 and the 19.5. The 19.2 will be of service because 
they are projecting out, "I will go and do it." But you also know about the 19.2 that there is a limit to what 
they will do because they are expecting a resource in return. Therefore, they will do only so much and go 
no further. The 19.5 is a bargain for a commander because a 19.5 is quite ready not only to be of service, 
but to sacrifice themselves in that service. And in the larger context of the movie, they do not get any 
resources for it other than a medal that is placed on their grave. In other words, they are quite willing to 
sacrifice themselves without any need for resource in return, and remember, that is not their true nature. 
That is what is projected on them. 

The projected field wants to see the 19th hexagram, this need, as a readiness to sacrifice. "Why should I 
pay you? Do it for the benefit of the tribe. Why do you need resources? Make a sacrifice. Take a day off a 
week and work for the state for nothing." You have countries in our century that have done that. Everyone 
has to take a day off. At least it is not three days a week to build the pyramids but nonetheless, the 
sacrifice is inherent here. When you see somebody with a 19.5, there is a Christ complex at work in there. 
This sacrifice for the higher good is projected on them. "This one will make the sacrifice. This one will 
bleed for the cause. This one will die." This is projected on them. Given the right principle, they will. 

The need to limit personal potential in order to achieve a larger goal. "I will die so that others may live. 
I'll die on this cross, so all of you can be redeemed for your sins." This is the basic theme. It goes back to 
the sacrifice of children. When they were going to sacrifice children for the fertility festival in the 
springtime, the 19.5's were sacrificed, and all spotted by the 49.5. I am a 49.5. I know them when I see 
them. "This one over there can be sacrificed," and the 19.5 will come forward and say "yes." 

The Mayan culture had ritual sacrifices. Most of the time, those sacrificed were criminals and border 
tribes but they had certain numbers to be sacrificed because mathematics was very important. There were 
times when there were not enough numbers to fill the list of those that had to be sacrificed, and there were 
people who would come forward and agree to be sacrificed. "I have to make a sacrifice for the greater 
good because, if I don't die, the tribe will have a problem and the magic of the tribe will die." 

The Earth exalted. The self-restraint fundamental to such a nature. If you will sacrifice, you have to be 
very clear about what kind of sacrifice you want to make. Fifth lines have great opportunities in life 
because they are projected on. They are recognized for an inherent trait within them. In this case, these 
people can make enormous sacrifices for the societies around them and get almost no return on that. They 
are part of what keeps the tribe alive and, in our time, this energy is very important. We expect sacrifice. 
Think about how millions and millions of people in this century walked off and sacrificed their lives in 
wars. "I will fight communism. I will sacrifice my life." 

Jupiter in detriment. A tendency in sacrifice to condescend. "I have to do it for them because they cannot 
do it themselves. After all, they can never hang on the cross long enough." 

Sacrifice can fuel a lack of sensitivity. Those who are constantly asked to sacrifice, because that is the 
projection, become desensitized after a while due to the role that they have to play. One of the most 
important things for anybody who carries the energy of the 19.5 is to recognize that this sacrifice is 
always going to be essential but only for the correct principle. This is a dilemma because the principle is 
an emotional principle that moves in a wave. This is not an easy thing. We are ready to sacrifice one 
moment to spare ourselves from Catholics, or the Nazis, and the next moment, they are suddenly 
acceptable. One has to be careful about the principles one is ready to sacrifice for. That is a key here. 

There is no choice. You can only care in the sense of being aware of what it is. All mammals have the 
19th gate. They will make those sacrifices and die. They do that quite regularly; it is built in. It is built 
into us, too. We exalt it and take it to another level because we take it to a higher principle. We bring in 
the emotional field and the potential for Spirit. 

There will be a time in which this sacrifice will be very different, like all things. The moment that the 
nature of the emotional system changes, we will change the nature of sacrifice because who decides about 
who gets sacrificed or not is the 49th gate which operates in an emotional wave and is not aware. 
Therefore, those sacrifices are unusually cruel and meaningless. Stalin says, "Kill all the Gulags." So you 
go into the Ukraine and kill millions of people and you take all of the crop for four years in a row and sell 
it on the foreign market. Thus, they starve to death. For what? This is when the principles of the 49 go 
haywire because they are being ruled by an emotional wave and there is no awareness and no spirit 
consciousness. 

Sacrifice in our times is still something that can be very sad. It can also be beautiful because we glorify it. 
Our tribes are built on our martyrs. Wherever you go, there is somebody who has done something for the 
state, the last offender of the wall. We consider these people heroes at the highest level because they were 
ready to sacrifice for the benefit of others. That is what we expect from them. What they are is either 
interdependent, or dependent. 

19.6 The Recluse 

One of the extraordinary incarnation crosses in the wheel is called the Cross of the Four Ways. The Cross 
of the Four Ways is comprised of the four hexagrams that are especially about a way, and they form a 
perfect cross in the zodiac. The 19th hexagram, Approach, is directly opposite the 33rd hexagram, which 
is called Retreat and, exactly at a quarter angle from that, you get the 24th hexagram in Taurus, which is 
the gate of Return. Exactly opposite that, you have the 44th hexagram, Coming to Meet. These are the 
four ways of the world: Approach, Retreat, Coming to Meet and Return. So when you are dealing with 
the 19th gate, you are dealing with something very deep inside of you because it is one of the ways. This 
way is a deep recognition for the need for resources and there are all kinds of resources. 

When we get to the sixth line, we get to the transition. We know that all our religious experience begins in 
the 19th gate. It is the gate of animism and animal sacrifice. It is the gate of child sacrifice. It is where 
ideals are built. This is the whole beginning of that process and its culmination is The Recluse. 

This sixth line of the Recluse is trying to see the whole process. It does not want to engage unless it has 
that kind of assurance that the whole process is possible. The whole process of the tribe is that the 
resources have to be enough to allow the tribe to flourish and grow and to develop a civilization, a 
successful thriving community, where everybody has the resources that are necessary and it all gets to 
manifest out of the throat. This is not an easy business that starts in the 19th gate. 

The overview line: The avoidance of contact in general but not exclusively. "1 don't want to be 
interdependent with you. I don't want to be dependent on you. I don't want you to be dependent on me 
because I don't think that any of this will be worthwhile. Why should I give up all this energy when I do 
not get the resources that I know are necessary?" Someone says, "Why don't we establish an ashram?" 
The recluse says, "Excuse me. I am going away because I don't think that it will be possible that you'll 
really bring in the resources to maintain this, to build a culture." 

Jupiter exalted. The fool on the hill. The sage that, if you can find him, will talk to you. These were the 
main spiritual figures in the world. These were the crazy ones, the ones that separated themselves and, at 
the same time, the tribe found them fascinating because the tribe also needs that resource. 

Please understand that the recluse is not quite the same as a hermit. A hermit is somebody where people 
really know where they are. The recluse or the sulking child can be anywhere; you have to look for them. 
It is part of their way to have proven that they are really needed. "I hear that there is a Master in the 
mountain somewhere, but I don't know where. " That is their way of knowing that you really need them, if 
you go looking for them. The sulking child does not simply just go to its room. It goes out and hides 
somewhere outside and you really have to find them to prove that you need them. 

In the white book: The energy which generally fuels avoidance. "Well, I don't want to support that. I don't 
want to get involved in that because I don't think that it will ever get to where it must." What happens is 
that these recluses, these sages, eventually get sought out. The tribe wants access to what they have. The 
tribe is interested in their resources. The tribe wants them to make a commitment. 

The other side of this: Oversensitivity to rejection that fuels avoidance. This is Mars in detriment. The 
sulking child. The self-imposed exile that will only end when it attracts appropriate and soothing reaction. 
Of all the lines of the 19, this is the only line in which the 19 is totally in control. The 19 needs to be 
wanted but the 19.6 will not flirt, though the 1 through 5 will. The 19.6 generally has a fuel which says: 
"Avoid all that. Don't get their attention." When somebody comes to the fool on the hill, to the sage or to 
the sulking child in its room, they are convinced that they are actually needed. "You climbed all the way 
up this mountain up to see me?V 'Yes, Master." "You finally come into my room to see what I mean, to 
see why I am so upset?" 

There is a great deal of power in this 19.6 by not bringing the classic 19 energy and offering it. Remember 
that the projected field is sacrifice. You are supposed to be there to sacrifice. The 19.6 does not care. 
"Come and find me, if you really need me. And if you show me that you really need me, maybe, if you 
are lucky and it is a nice day, I will offer you my energy and support." 

To so many people who climb that mountain and get to the Master and ask him what they should do, he 
answers, "You can go back down now." If you finally go into the room of the sulking child, it says: "Get 
out." It is not enough to be needed. Again, the sixth line is always asking for something much more. So 
the Master on the hill will wait for the right question, that not only is it really going to be needed, but that 

need is legitimate, and if it can hear the legitimacy of that, it can support that. The sulking child has to 
feel the real need, not simply the tribe trying to discipline the child so that it does not miss for aid. That it 
is not forced to come back out. It has to be a real need to resolve whatever it is. 

It is very important to see that in the whole 19th gate lie so many things that have dominated our lives. It 
is a core fuel: this need for food, the need for how we can share the food and be interdependent in our 
process. All the fundamental rules for whether we will support each other or not, the amount of service 
and sacrifice that is demanded by any tribal relationship, all of that in the 19 carries a great deal of weight 
in the world. We are going through a process of having this energy vitalized. We have a considerable 
transit movement through the gates we are talking about, to see how important it is that the resources are 
there. 

The one thing that is clear to me about the nature of the world is that, unless you satisfy the 19 as a 
universal theme that is everywhere, there will never be peace. The 19 must be satisfied. The resources 
must be there and it must be fair. It must be clean and interdependent. That will take a long time for the 
emotional system to change so that we can break through the motor, and then we can begin to see that the 
nature of community lies in its spirit. The spirit is the whole thing. 

There are different kinds of sages: there is the sage who tells you, "You can go down the mountain but if 
you want, you can come back." Each time you come up the mountain, he tells you to go back down. 
Eventually, they have a satori climbing the mountain one day. They never get to the top and they never 
have to. 

One last spiritual note on that. What the recluse says when you find them is, "I don't need you." The 
whole thing about this need for resources is that none of these people can have a life unless they have the 
resources. There are always those who say, "I don't need to have you in my life in order to have a life. I 
don't need to support the tribe in order to get the resources. The resources are everywhere." This is 
something very important because without this force, the whole thing that drives the tribe will only be 
limited to the material plane, only to that materialism that ultimately finds its expression in the 45/21. 
What lies here is something deeper that says, "Wait a minute. Is it really all about need? Is it only about 
need? There must be something else." There is something else: individual awakening in the 25/51. This is 
the natural way for this sixth line. The sixth line knows that there is something else other than the material 
plane. 

HEXAGRAM 20 CONTEMPLATION 

In many ways, we have here the most complex hexagram in the throat process because the 20th hexagram 
is not simply looking to the potential of a harmonic gate. It is part of the Integration network. It is looking 
at three different gates. It represents the expression of the individual capacity to survive. 

It is the voice that says, "I know I am," or "I know I am now," and all the configurations that come with 
the various connections in Integration. This 20th gate is the only so-called existential gate. Existential 
means that it operates in the present. 

Above the lines it says: Recognition and awareness in the now which transforms understanding into right 
action. This is awareness in the now, so there is a great deal of confusion about this statement, 
'recognition and awareness'. This is not an awareness gate, so do not get carried away by that. This is a 
mechanical gate that brings you into the now. It is a mechanical gate that has direct access to awareness, 
to the 57th gate in the splenic system and the potential for awareness, in that sense. What is important 
about this is that this represents a peripheral mechanic in which the present is recognized. This is not a 
force like the collective force that is either projecting into the future or looking at the past. This is 
something that is occupied entirely in the present. 

20.1 Superficiality 

The first line gives you the foundation. It is called Superficiality. Many people have problems with this 
first line. A reliance on shallowness. If you own a cat, it is easy to understand. The cat is sitting there in 
the now and is really lbakimg disinterested in everything.. It seems to be totally disinterested but it is not. 
It is being very superficial on the surface. It looks very shallow at what it is; doing but all of its antennae 
are ready and alert- for anything,, at any moment. This is not about being in the now and walking around, 
trying to swallow everything. This is the recognition that you are always in the now and you can go, about 
the business of your life because there is this force inside of you that will make contact with the 
periphery. 

Venus exalted. The raising of superficiality to an art form. The sloganeer. In terms of the white, book: 
Superficial expression as an art form. These people are very aware of what is happening one the. 
mundane plane! around them. That is their superficiality. They are very dear about what is going on in the 
world around them because the primary nature of this is to keep them alive. So they are aware of what is 
going on around them but if you have a conversation with them,, iit will be very superficial.. It is like "Do 
you notice the change in the!weather$'iust a little while ago, there was ai change in the pressure." They 
talk about the kinds of things that they are! aware of in the present, and they-will seem very superficial. 
They are not. Don't confuse the way in which these peoplb project out their " 1 know" as. of they are really 
only on the surface. They are not.. There is; a great deal going on underneath. 

The Moon in detriment. The superficial expression of the personality. In the white book: The expression 
of the superficial personality. These people look like only beings on the surface and anybody who knows 
these people all say the same thing: "They are very superficial." I want to tell you something. You put 
these people in a situation of life and death and they are anything but superficial. They are aware in the 
now. They have this mechanical capacity in the now to respond to what is there in the now. But on the 
surface, they are on the surface almost all of the time other than in those moments of threat. That is the 
nature of being in the now. There is nothing to do except in the moment of threat. To respond and to be 
able to protect yourself in order to survive is the capacity in this gate. 

20.2 The Dogmatist 

Page 1 C 

We get to the line of projection. These people are projecting out their existential potential. They are 
projecting out that they know who they are. "I know I am," or "I know I am now," is the voice. This line 
is called The Dogmatist. Restrictive and intentionally limited understanding. These are people in the now 
but what they are projecting out in the now is a narrow field. They see certain things in the now but they 
do not see everything in the now because they do not have this entire periphery. Due to that, they can be 
very dogmatic about that now and that view that they have. 'Restrictive and intentionally limited 
understanding' is limited perspective in that sense. 

Venus exalted. The limitation, if personal and exclusive, is less negative through ascetic withdrawal. In 
the white book: A restrictive awareness in the now. What happens to these people is that they are going to 
bang into a lot of difficulty because they are individual, after all. Individuals always attract attention and
