trust the law? Can I trust awareness? Can I trust what I am taking in?" 

In the white book: The power and strength to be realistic in one's capacities to care and nurture. That 
realism can be very intense. It can be so intense that it is saying, "All right, I am looking at that but if I 
care for you, what will that do to the quality of life for all of this?" So often the only thing that people 
with the 27.6 can care about are very broad, almost idealistic things, where they see that there is really 
something worthwhile in caring about that. You cannot go to these people and say, "We have all these 
starving babies in Africa, could you give me ten bucks." If you try to get ten dollars from the 27.6, that is 
not so easy. "Well, yes. I know. But if I give you this money, out of those ten dollars, seven will go to 
administration, two dollars go to taxes and three cents will go to the baby that is dying in Gabon. No, 
thank you. I won't do that. I don't trust you and I don't trust that this caring will manifest in the world. I 
don't think that it is of any value." 

The whole thing about the sixth line is that it is looking for the awareness to confirm for it, to establish in 
law, that if we do care, it is going to be productive. It is like all of these agencies over the last few years 

that are involved in humanitarian causes. The first thing they realized is that by the time that they get their 
stuff on the ground somewhere, there are people stealing it. There are people making money from it. 
There are all kinds of stuff going on. 

The sixth line looking at the law on the other side says, "Okay, when I can care and I know that my caring 
is actually going to enhance the quality of life, then I'll care. If you say to me that I can give those ten 
dollars directly to that child, I will do that. But I will not give it three cents so that you can make your 
living off it and I don't trust you. You do not really care. You only care for yourself." 

The sixth line is always going beyond and it sets a standard here because this is the energy for the basic 
process of our awareness. It says, "Is there anything to trust?" and only in the moment that you begin to 
recognize that there are things that you can trust can you begin to care. 

I know this so intimately in my work. I deal with people who do not know themselves, and in the nature 
of our work, in the nature of doing an analysis, I bring them to what is reliable in them, what is consistent, 
what is in that sense trustworthy. The moment that they can see what is reliable and trustworthy, they can 
begin to care for themselves again because the disease of the world is self-hatred and self-suspicion. 
There is sickness in all the lines of the 27. The deepest sickness here, in the 27.6, is the thing that says, "I 
don't trust anything and because of that I can't really care about anything. " 

I lived my life with the 20.6 which is the line of Wisdom. I never trusted any of my knowing. Knowing 
was never enough for me. I was very smart. I knew a lot of things but I did not trust any of it because I 
knew that if I can say this, I can also say that. There was nothing to trust. When I went through my 
mystical experience and I was given an absolute in the sense of the Maya and I could see that this 
absolute was consistent, it gave me something to really care about. It gave me something to care about 
that I'd never cared about in my life: you, people, other human beings, that they can be informed. I was 
never interested in doing that other than from the moment that I could see that it was worth caring about. 
All sixth lines are like that. I am very lucky. I get to do that in my lifetime: to live out the value of the 
sixth line. Not everybody gets to that point and it is very important to understand that. The moment that 
you get to a sixth line, no matter where it is, this question comes up: "Shall I really commit myself? Is it 
really worthwhile? Can I trust this process? Will it take me where I want to go?" This is always the case. 
So whenever you see sixth lines, do not jump to any conclusion about that line coming out. It may never 
come out until there is really something that one can trust in, worth caring about as a value. 

HEXAGRAM 28 PREPONDERANCE OF THE GREAT 

Here, we move to the individual process and we stay with awareness as potential. Rather than taking you 
through the natural stream of all of these potential gates, that is, rather than going from the 32 to the 44, 
which I leave to you in your own process, I want to show you the harmonies that exist, not simply line for 
line throughout but to recognize that all three of these potentials (the 32, the 28 and the 1 8) are doing the 
same job. They are just doing it differently. We have looked at the instinctive potential in the 32. Now we 
come to the channel 28/38, to the channel of Struggle, to a design of Stubbornness. 

Wte come to the 28th gate, The Preponderance of the Great, the gate of the game Player. The potential is 
the awareness to struggle, or not. Individuality is acoustic, so it is literally the ability to respond 
acoustically and, in that response, we have the awareness whether to struggle or not. Not the awareness to 
transform or not. Because this is spontaneous, it is taking place existentially, in the now. The awareness 
potential is the stubbornness to listen, to make sure that one listens so that one can take the best possible 
risks. 

This is all about risk taking. The 28th gate represents a primal fear in us: the fear of death. That fear is to 
be understood as a fear of whether or not life is of value. Just as the 32 is afraid that their work in this life 
will be a failure, the 28 is afraid that their way in this life will be a failure, that is, that they themselves, 
their lives and what they live for is not really worthwhile. This is one of the deepest themes of 
individuality: to see whether life is really of value or not, and this is rooted here in the 28th gate. 

In the heading of the 32nd gate we find that the only thing which endures is change. When we come to the 
heading of the 28th hexagram, it says: The transitoriness of power and influence. It is the same thing. It is 
all about change and evolution. It is an ongoing process. The transitoriness of power and influence is what 
the Preponderance of the Great is all about. 

28.1 Preparation 

We know that the nature of the first line is introspective. It is looking inward and the first line in the 28 is 
called Preparation. The desire to be effective manifested in the application of energy to detail. If you look 
at the 32.1, it says: A life sustaining respect and attention to all aspects of a process. We are talking about 
the same process; the only thing is that this is individual. The change that has to be endured in the 32 is 
tribal. It is all about support. It is all about the tribe. 

This is an individual process where we have Venus in detriment. The aesthetic appreciation of planning 
that may have no real application. In other words, wonderful detail but nowhere to go. The intuition to 
potentially apply energy to detail; or An intuition for detail without the potential for application. It is all 
about being prepared. 

This is the gate of game player and the risk taker. The first line has to set the foundation for that. What 
kind of risk do you want to take? You'd better have your detail. What often happens is that what looks 
like a detriment isn't one at all. What that means is that you go through all the detail and then you don't 
take the risk due to what you see. It was just interesting to go through all the detail. This is all about 
preparation. Make sure that you have the detail before you take the risk. That is what the Preponderance 
of the Great is all about. The foundation is: you better have the detail. Which means, as you move 
through, the detail is always there. Risk taking is not a blind thing. 

28.2 Shaking hands with the Devil 

The first line is trying to figure out the odds in introspection. The second line only wants to win and does 
not care what the odds are. Shaking hands with the devil: you are only interested in winning. When you 
look at initiation which is part of the individual process, this deep competitiveness that lies within the 
individual nature is mirrored in this second line: the projection that "I have to win. If I do not win and if I 
can't take a risk and gamble, life is not worthwhile." This can lead to depression. This line is about 
Distasteful alliance. 

Sun exalted. A means, however unsavory, that is justified by is end. Jupiter in detriment. The anxiety 
engendered by sacrificing higher principles when there is no guarantee of success. In the white book: 
When the game turns to a struggle, the intuitive acceptance of any alliance in order to win. The other side: 
The risk in sacrificing principles when there is no guarantee of victory. 

The whole nature of struggle is all about winning and losing. There are people that are either very good 
winners or very bad losers, or the other way around. All of that can lead them to be very uncomfortable 
with themselves. Remember, the deep fear which lies underneath, this fear of whether life is really of 
value or not. These people will risk anything to get what they think is the projected victory. Realize the 
illusion of that. They are projecting, "If I win this, life will be great." Then they discover that they have 
sold their soul to the devil. By the way, for them it is okay. You have to see that. If you have the second 
line, that is what it is about for you. 

Anybody with this second line has to recognize that they do not have all the details. Therefore, the 
winning and losing is important to them for their learning process. This is the child that has to learn, "You 
have to be a good loser. Do not get angry just because you have lost." This is a process that they have to 
go through because the detail is not there and they are just projecting it out. 

28.3 Adventurism 

We reach the end of the lower trigram process and find the capacity to adapt. Details are available: the 
details are always necessary for the risk taker to know what to struggle about because not everything is 
worth winning. This is what the second line does not know. The third line knows that not everything is 
worth winning and not everything can be won, but it is Adventurism. This is the first attempt to really be 
able to fulfill the whole struggle to go across the channel. 

Unfounded risk taking. Saturn exalted. A basic conservatism that even in its adventurous acts is 
necessarily prudent. In other words, there is a carefulness built into the third line. It is not so quick to just 
project outwards. It is not just waiting and adding up all the odds and ends and the detail. 

The Jupiterian side: Here a perverse manriestation of Jupiter's expansiveness, where risk.taking is 
rationalized and failure ensurred. Without prudence, without relpedting the detail side (the projecting 
capacity is there), there is always going to be failure. Failure in this context means that even if you win, it 
won't make life seem more worthwhile. That is the failure here. 

In the white book: An intuitive caution in risk-taking in times of struggle, or Intuitive rationalizing of risk 
taking in times of struggle. One cannot just simply jump in because you ado not know what you will get, 
and you do not (know whether iit is worthwhile for you. This is the lesson that the three has to learn from 
the two. 

The whole thing for the 28th agate is that the moment-they see that what'they are: struggling for is 
worthvvlhiie,, this is their whole story. If it is really -worthwhile for them, it its a wonderful process no 
matter how hard tie struggle is to get there (because it is justified in the end. They get a sweet victory, inot 
-the sour victory of taking -a risk because What -you are trying to win in this game is not the prime. It is 
the sense of accomplishment, that to be individual in this (life is really worthwJhile. "It is great to The 

alive. It its nice to be a human being. I enjoy my life." That is the real victory that is being sought out 
here. 

28.4 Holding on 

With the fourth line we reach the upper trigram. The 28.4 is a very unusual line as it is part of the cross of 
The Unexpected, and therefore, very unexpected things come out of this line. All fourth lines, due to their 
nature of externalization and due to their one-trackedness, are very focused on one aspect. 

Here it is called: Holding on. The ability through whatever means to keep one's grip. These people hold 
on to their struggle and nothing can pull them from that. They are very one-track in their struggle. No 
matter what the struggle is, no matter what they have to go through in their drive to externalize, they can 
really hold it together. 

Jupiter exalted. The application of knowledge to exploit opportunities, and usually for the greater good. 
The Mercurial side: The application of intelligence to hold on, exclusively out of self-interest. That is 
being individual in the first place. That is hardly a detriment in the normal sense of the word because that 
is the individual process. 

A depth of intuition at its best in struggle and often of value to others. If I want somebody who will help 
me in a struggle with someone or about something, I will look for a 28.4. They are very good at that. This 
is their nature. They can really be in there and get into that energy. 

A depth of intuition that is stubbornly selfish in its capacity to hold on. They will not work with me. They 
are in their own thing. They have to deal with their struggle. The people with the 28.4 can be infuriating if 
you do not understand their nature because they get fixed and obsessed with their particular struggle. It 
has to do with a certain thing for them. Everything about the 28, in the end, is about winning, like 
everything about the 32 has to do with succeeding ("Do not fail."). 

Here you have to win, but the winning is about winning for yourself in the sense that your life is 
worthwhile. It is hard to kill these people. There is a deep focus here on holding on in the struggle until 
their very last breath in order to figure out, "Yes, it was worthwhile." Then they get the joke and die. The 
joke is that the game is fixed. 

28.5 Treachery 

The universalization line of the 28 is called Treachery. It has a wicked name but it is not wicked at all. 
Their job is to universalize struggle. Their job is to get everybody to struggle for the value of life. At the 
highest level, if you look at the highest principles, that is what these people do. They get other people to 
struggle in order to find out for themselves that life is worthwhile. They provoke them in that sense. 

The abuse of trust. The manipulation of the collective that, while pitting one faction against the other, 
does not directly support or reject either. This is not about winning or losing. This is about making sure 
that everybody is in the game. Please understand that. That is very important. This is a universalizing 
element about dealing with the fear of death. They deal with this fear by getting everybody in the game to 
struggle about whether life is worthwhile. Somebody with the 28.5 probes somebody else with, "Is your 
life really worthwhile? Are you really doing what you want to do?" They get them all cranked up. They, 
themselves, do not care. They just want everybody to play the game. They want everybody to be in the 
same struggle. They are hoping at least if they get it, maybe I'll get it too. 

The other side is classic: Sun in detriment. The breaking of alliances with trusted forces to align with 
more powerful forces, and the attendant destabilization of the whole. This is what they are best at. For 
example, they go to Osho and come back and say, "Oh, my Master is full of light." Then somebody tells 
them about another master and they will join that one. They stop being a sannyasin. They keep on 
changing their masters. Every time that they leave, the people they leave are saying, "Treachery. These 
are bad people who can't be trusted." This is not true. For this line, the struggle is endless. If you have 
struggle in life, you will have it until you die. 

These people recognize that it is an ongoing process. They surrender to it in that sense. They have one 
teacher and they think that he is wonderful and when somebody tells them that there is a better teacher, 
that is where they go because they are trying to get to the point where they find something that really 
shows them that life is worthwhile, and they will continue to take that risk. They leave behind a lot of 
struggle. The person that they leave behind who was depending on them says, "Why did they go?" They 
have the struggle now. "Is life really worthwhile because they are gone?" This is what they do. They are 
great disturbers. They just move this out into the world. Everybody struggles together. 

28.6 Blaze of Glory 

We come to the roof of the house and we come to Blaze of Glory. Again, the thing to recognize about this 
sixth line is that is does not want to have anything to do with struggle. Nothing. It wants to get to the 44th 
hexagram, to the first line which is called: The establishment of frameworks as a result of interaction. It 
wants to establish a mastery over the collective. It wants to go to something else. It wants to go far 
beyond the struggle. It can only go there if life is worthwhile. 

Sacrifice rather than capitulation to the law of deterioration. No matter what it takes, I will not keep on 
sliding down in the hopelessness of not finding that life is worthwhile. I will start taking any kind of risk. 
I will make any kind of sacrifice. I will stop eating until I die, just to see if it is worthwhile. 

Pluto exalted. Regeneration and renewal no matter what the price. Neptune in detriment. Self-destruction. 
That is something that had a deep impact on a whole generation of people. So many people were born 
with this configuration with either Pluto or Neptune. (1958-1960). 

In the white book: The deep intuitive drive to win, no matter what the cost. The other side: The deep 
intuitive fear of defeat and a potentially profound hopelessness in times of struggle. Remember that the 
victory and the loss have to do 

with whether life is worthwhile. These people work too much, live too fast, drive too fast. They take a 
little too many drugs. They are always pushing it to see whether or not life can really be worthwhile. 
Many of them are pushed to the point of destruction. Literally, these people make themselves sick over a 
lifetime. They just slowly burn themselves out because they cannot find this sense that "It is okay, life is 
worthwhile." 

The 28 is only potential. V% have not looked at the possibility of awareness that comes out of that 
potential. The potential to find out whether life is worthwhile takes the 57th and the 20th gate to bring the 
awareness to the throat and manifest it in the now so that the 28.6 can see, "Being here in the now, life IS. 
It just is. I do not have to be afraid of it because it is there." If the 28.6 is hanging there by itself, it can be 
very uncomfortable because one does not want to struggle. One simply wants to know that life is 
worthwhile. These are people who, instead of struggling, just hurt themselves. 

HEXAGRAM 29 THE ABYSMAL 

The 29th hexagram is something very strange, because it says either yes or no to life. It is making the 
commitment to be alive as a human. It is built into it at its deepest level to say yes. My joke with this is: 
"Can I borrow your life?" "Yes." "Can I waste your time?" "Yes." "Can I take all your money?" "Yes." 
"Can I fuck you up?" "Yes." 

It is built into our sacral center to be alive. The 29th gate is constantly reaffirming our commitment to life. 
It is the deep within the deep. It is our commitment to life but at the same time, it is the thing that is going 
to turn off the switch when we die. It is the thing that is going to say, "Enough. I have had enough now. I 
will say no now." I am always telling people who have the 29th gate don't say "Yes," say "Wait". Make 
people wait. The reality is that the yes is built in, but the no can always be there. 

Above the lines: The deep within the deep. Persistence despite difficulties has its inevitable rewards. This 
is a very funny language: Persistence despite difficulties... If you say yes to life, you are saying yes to 
difficulties. This is one of the jokes about being human.. ..has its inevitable rewards. When? 'Inevitable' 
simply means that at some point they come, but when they come? You can go through difficulty after 
difficulty after difficulty and you are constantly saying yes to life and all the difficulties are there. 

What are hidden in this 29 can be the deepest scars in humans. There is no line in here that talks about 
self-destruction or killing oneself but everything within the 29 has the potential for suicide. It has the 
potential to say no to the life process. It has the potential to say no to healing, no to being cured, no to 
being helped, no to being wanted. All of those things are always possible underneath, and it depends on 
whether or not they have in the earliest part of their life accepted for themselves the difficuly of what life 
is. 

29.1 The Draftee 

The first lime says: The Draftee. The foundation of this hexagram is:: The ability to adapt to. struggle 
when necessary but not as a permanent state, hother words, make your commitment but don't make 
thatcommitmemt for life. Make your cornmitmemi o the experience, just to the experience. It is; the! 
experience that gives us the ultimate growth andlvalue in the. process. That is why' when people are really 
doown, if they find something that they really like th do, that-they can commit themselves to, suddenly 
they begin to blossom, gut without that, without being drafted into the experience they simply continue to 
go through their process saying, "Can I really continue to say yes to this commitment to life?" 

Mars exalted. The innate nature to apply energy in times of war and peace. Bless young Mars. Mars says, 
"Yes, I don't care how difficult it is. I have the energy and the power and I will do it." That is Mars at its 
best. "I am here to be alive. I am here to grow up," says the child Mars. "Give me a chance to grow up." 

The whole thing about the 29 is to understand that the experiential way, like any way, takes time. 
Everything takes time. To be well in this life, to be at peace in this life, to come to grips with what it is to 
be you in this life, it all takes time. That is what I tell people when they come to Design. You have to 
work with this awareness and knowledge for seven years before it really is going to be a part of you. Just 
so it can get down to the cells. Just so you can continue that process. 

Neptune in detriment. The great mask of Neptune is dropping in here. A deep impressionability whose 
mark from times of struggle may make a return to normal conditions extremely difficult. When you have 
a child that has the 29.1, it will either go one way or the other. They are either going to have this 
wonderful depth of energy to say, "Yes, it is difficult but life is life. Yes, the experience is hard but I'll go 
through it," or the other side in which the experience comes and they are shattered in it. In that moment of 

shattering in the experience, it becomes more and more difficult for them to commit themselves again to a 
new experience. The child falls into a pool, unable to swim, and it is a 29.1. The deep within the deep. If 
the child pulls itself up and it can, that child is always going to be able to fall into a pool of water. But for 
the child that has to be grabbed by somebody else and dragged out of that pool gasping, it is going to take 
a lifetime for that being to go back into the water. 

This is the nature of commitment. Commitment is not just about saying yes. It is about recognizing that 
whatever you say yes to is going to present all those difficulties and the moment you get stuck on the 
difficulties is the moment that you loose this magical Martian love and lust for life. That is the beauty that 
can lie here, but this is also the pain that can be on the other side. 

In the white book: The power to persevere when necessary but not generally; and the detriment: 
Hesitation in making commitments based on past experience. "No, I don't want to try that. I can't do that. 
"Come on, you can." "No." 

29.2 Assessment 

The first line has the capacity for introspection and recognizes that it can say yes and make a 
commitment. '. have seen that this commitment can lead to a continuing process of growth; after all, this 
is the channel of Discovery, a channel of succeeding where other people fail, or failing where other 
people succeed. This is one of those things to keep in mind about the nature of that commitment. 

When you come to the second line and you are coming to the projection, these people are projecting out 
that they are always ready to say yes. "Come and ask me. I am ready to say yes." Persistence tempered by 
caution. The caution is that we are dealing with the lack of introspection because it is projection; so, 
although the capacity is there to project out that they are ready to be persistent and that they have the 
power to be persistent, they do not really know whether that power is there. The caution is not a mental 
caution. It is not an awareness caution that says, "Aha, I have to be careful about where I put my energy." 
This is just power. 

The Sun exalted. The power of sustainment as a guiding light. In the white book: Saying yes and the 
power to persevere. This power is really there. These people project out that they are ready to persevere 
but they don't know whether they can or not. It may not work for them. They may be found out. They 
may not have the necessary resources to persist in that particular experience, whatever it may be. 

Venus in detriment. A tendency to over-cautiousness when persistence is perceived as adding to rather 
than ending disharmony. Here comes Venus again, stepping in with this additional interactive social 
quality and making the process more difficult by being there. Somebody comes up to the 29.2 and says, 
"Do you want to try roller-blading?" and they say, "Yes." They are always ready to say yes. They will 
always project out their yes and then somebody who is close to them says, "Yeah, but that costs a lot of 
money and people get broken legs and it does not really work and I do not really want you to do that 
around here." 

If that is somebody who is important for them that they want to have as their friend, or somebody with 
whom they want to have a harmonious relationship, they are likely to be much more cautious and 
restrained in that. In other words, they get found out because they discover in the moment that somebody 
makes a comment about it and they do not really know if they have the resources. They can suddenly 
become cautious about that. 

Always built into all of the lines of the 29 is this holding back from making the commitment, but usually 
it is the product of having had a difficult experience in life that does it, rather than commonsense or rather 

than awareness that says, "Yes, I have to be careful about how I use my energy and what I commit it to." 
The caution in people who say yes comes from people who got burnt. 

Water does not like fire. These people can always get burnt from the experience. They can always suffer 
from the experience and say, "I can't do that anymore. I can't take those kinds of chances anymore. I can't 
commit myself to those kinds of things anymore." They become more cautious, but not because they are 
aware. The difficulty of the experience is something that becomes a burden for them because they don't 
know whether they have the resources for it. 

29.3 Evaluation 

When you come to Evaluation, the third line: In this context, properly assessed inaction. By the way, 
properly assessed inaction does not mean that that is how they start their life. They have to learn that from 
experience. They are going to be less likely to jump in and say yes but nonetheless, they will. They have 
to learn from experience so that genetic attribute of them can be triggered properly. 

Despite the urge and cost of inaction, the knowledge that it is sometimes better to fight another day. You 
have to learn that sometimes it is better to fight another day, but not necessarily. These people will make 
their mistakes. They have to go through that process. 

The power to wait. You see Mars there. You have to wait until Mars is about 40 years old. Mars has to 
grow up in order to wait. I am an Arian. I know that. 

On the other side of this in the black book is Jupiter in detriment. A preference for withdrawal in principle 
with little regard for effect. When the mistakes have really been heavy, there is this "Wait a minute now. 
Shall I do this?" For so long I taught you to really just see this mechanism of saying yes, because that is 
how it operates at the mundane level. At the mundane level, people will always go through this process 
because the fact is that you have to go through that process if you have this gate. But you will always 
meet the difficulties of life and in meeting them, there are only two ways to go. 

This is the deep within the deep. What is at the other end? The other end is the love of the body, the 46th 
gate. The magic of this_channel, the 46/29, is to discover the magic of what it is to be in form, what it is 
to be in a body in this life and what it means for this body to move through this life. This channel can be 
deeply profound because of that and because this is the love of being alive in the body and that is what all 
this commitment is about: to be committed to the life process. But you don't know because on the other 
end, the 46, Pushing Upward, is in the kingdom of heaven. In the old I'Ching, you have to come from The 
deep within the deep and you have to go through all this stuff until you finally get up to the kingdom of 
heaven and you discover, "Wow. This machine is really great." 

Not everybody gets to that place and it is not because of this line or anything else. It is about the nature of 
what it is to be human, and to be unaware. If you are human and unaware, you do not like yourself and 
you dislike the wrong person because it is not you that you do not like but your conditioning and what 
you have become. You do not get a chance to see the magnificence of that. Everybody who stands in front 
of a mirror has a complaint about the nature of their form. We do not accept the magnificence of what that 
is. We complain about it. We would like to get out of it. I have so many people who come up to me and 
say, "I astral-project. I live here in my body in this life." 

This is the magic of the 29th gate. Until you can accept the beauty of what it is to be in form, there is no 
experience in life that is worth having because otherwise it is just pain and difficulty and a struggle. It is 
the work of life, this tough, heavy world. We are lucky people. We are privileged to live in a society 
where there is wealth and relative freedom. The world is filled with horrors. Yet at the same time, we still 

have this "Well, I need to fix this. I have to make this or that better. I don't like what I see." This is loving 
what it is to be in these bodies. They are beautiful. For me, Buddha was crazy. All he wanted to do was to 
get rid of the body and get out of it. This is where we belong. This is what the 29 has to come to 
recognize: "Aha, it is supposed to be like this." This is the glory of what it is to be human. 

Jupiter in detriment in the white book: The inability to make commitments. The power of caution. That 
power of caution means that these are people that are not ready to commit themselves to experience and 
because of that, they can become very weak. Their bodies can become weak. On the mundane level, their 
bodies do not get the necessary exercise, the necessary process of getting involved in the experience, to 
do the things to keep it going. 

It all comes down to this whole business about whether we can accept that these are our vehicles and that 
they are perfect. Everybody gets exactly the model that belongs to them. So much of that deep philosophy 
is what is rooted here in the 29th hexagram. That is why it is both the commitment to life and the 
commitment to death. "I don't like this model. I will not fix it. I'll just let it die. I will let it fall apart." That 
is the other side of the 29: "I don't love this body." This gate is not aware. It is just energy. 

Everybody thinks that the discovery of succeeding where others fail is about what they do but it is about 
how you live in the experience of yourself. It is about the acceptance of form and this is the only mystical 
possibility for abstract people. The only mystical potential for anyone who is abstract is here in this 
channel. It is the acceptance that one is in the right place at the right time, and that begins with your body. 

29.4 Directness 

When you come to the fourth line, you come to the upper trigram and you have the recognition now that 
heaven is there. The first to the third line do not know that. All they know is the deep within the deep, the 
pressure of all that water and the weight of what it is to live in the world, alas, carrying the world around. 
In the first three lines, you meet the most serious people in the world. 29.1, 2 and 3 can be so damn 
serious that it is frightening. There is no laughter in all of that. There is the deep recognition that this body 
has to deal with all kinds of difficulties in moving through the world, and it ain't necessarily a nice trip. 
When you get to the fourth line, it is like, "Oh, there is a sky above." The ability to look across the 
channel is quite different. 

It says, Directness. The shortest distance between two points is a straight line. "That is where I am going: 
straight up. I am getting out of this water. I am getting out of this way. I am going ta-triumph in this 
process." 

Saturn exalted. The wisdom to use the simplest and most direct approach to solve difficulties. "Ah, now 
we have the theme of difficulties which is at the top of the lines. Now, for the first time, we have a 
confrontation with the difficulties. Here is the ability to be fixed in your persistence and go right through 
the difficulties. You go through the difficulties with Saturn which means that you have to be disciplined. 
There has to be a great deal of restraint within you to be able to go through those difficulties, but it is 
there as a potential. 

In the white book: The power to commit oneself to the simplest and most direct process. This is a 
wonderful energy, very fixed. "I have to persist. I said yes and I will go through it. I will get to the place 
that is on the other side." 

On the other side of the directness, the Mercurial side: Simplicity and directness all too often seen as 
inharmonic and aesthetically crude. In the white book: The power of directness often offends others. "Get 
out of my way. I am going this way. This is my experience and I am fixed on it. I am not fixed on your 

experience. I don't want to share it with you. Don't take me away from my process now. I will go through 
my experience." Collective people who do not share are always considered rude. This is just one of the 
jokes of being a collective person because you are expected to share. 

29.5 Overreach 

The first line tells you the essence, that struggle is there for us, step by step, along the way and we are 
here to deal with each struggle and go through the difficulties of it in order to achieve our success in this 
life. When you get to the fifth line, how it is projected upon by the world, the world sees this 29th gate as 
simply being about overreach or overambition. This is how the world sees the energy to say yes all the 
time. 

The Overreach is: The tendency to bite of more than one can chew. It is projected onto these beings that 
they have the capacity not only to be persistent, but in their activity, in what they do experientially, to 
universalize the process. In other words, they can be very valuable contributors and because they have 
that capacity inside of them to universalize the value of an experience, the projection on them that they 
have this capacity brings them into making all kinds of commitments that are not necessarily of value for 
them. Biting off more than one can chew. Here we have a Sun/Earth axis in a line. 

Sun exalted. Where the drive is in the design and not ambition-driven. So, there is this genuine power of 
saying yes: The uncontrollable drive to say yes. It is a deep power inside to say yes, to commit oneself. 

The Earth in detriment. Failed ambition. In terms of the white book: Saying yes, overextending one's 
resources and failing to persevere. That can be devastating. Failing to persevere at its highest level is 
failing to persevere in life, in this ordeal of coming to accept the perfection of what one is, the beauty of 
one's form, the process that one is going through. It is not just about saying yes to too many things and 
having the obvious mundane failures come. So many people with the 29.5 say yes to this and that and, at 
some point, they cannot provide the resources for all of that. They can't. They begin to break promises. 
They begin to disappoint people because what they said they would commit their energy to, they can't 
commit their energy to anymore. 

When you turn that over and you get to the failed ambition on the other side, this can have the same kind 
of devastating impact as the experience of falling into the water and having to be saved and having to go 
through the trauma of that experience. This fifth line, in that sense, raises to another level what it means to 
make a commitment to this life in this form. 

Every time that I deal with abstract people, I always try to remind them that this is what their life is about. 
They are our teachers about the path of experience in life and they are designed for experience in life. 
They do not have to chase after everything simply because it is projected on them. The 3.5 spoke of 
Victimization. The people with the 29.5 can be victimized for their capacity to provide resources, 
victimized by a projecting public that says, "This is the one." 

The young worker that goes into an office and they carry the 29.5, everybody in that office is burdening 
them with something. "You do the paper work over here. By the way, I have a job for you over here." The 
manager behind is saying, "This one has the energy to do anything." Everybody is coming and giving 
them something to work on and the 29.5 says yes until they collapse because it is projected on them and 
they can become a victim of their own power. 

Again, part of that is: if you do not love your form, you are ready to say yes to anything in order to find it, 
to see what it is. So much about what it is to fail in life is that the deepest failure is to not love what it is to 
be you. There is nothing else. In my work, this is the great disease that I see in the world: deep self- 

hatred. I am a mechanic and, as such, I provide information. I know damn well that even though I am 
providing information that is amoralistic, that really tells you the truth about what it is to be in these 
forms, that you are still there thinking, "Yeah, yeah. Maybe I can change this. Maybe I can work on this. 
Maybe I can fix this. Maybe I can be better at this." 

You have to accept what it is that you are, and not what you think that you can become. There is no 
becoming. There is what you are. The real failed ambition here is not accepting your form. The moment 
you accept what you are, you know your own limitations. You know what is there to say yes to and what 
is there not to say yes to. Then this power of universalization becomes something very beautiful. 

By the way, biting off more than you can chew, you can talk to Adam and Eve about that. That is the line 
of Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden. This is what the Garden is all about. If you want to look for the 
deepest spirituality about the descent of man into this quality of life, you look at this fifth line which is 
called Overreach. "Yes, give me that apple. Yes, let me take a bite from the tree of knowledge." But it is 
not enough because if you only have a bite, you don't know and if you don't know truly what it is to be 
you, you are going to be tormented. Your life will fail inside, the spirit inside. 

I know so many 29.5 people who have suffered so deeply in their lives by being abused by others because 
they have this enormous quality to commit themselves to them. They are deeply beneficial human beings 
to guide us into experience. I have a deep connection to fifth lines, through resonance; I really understand 
the pressure that they are under. As long as they do not accept the nature of what it is to be them, they 
cannot universalize the wonder of what it is to be in form. 

As an individual, I can only give you that as an example of the vibration that I put out to you about what 
it is for me to be inside my body. But I am not a universalizer of that mystical principle because the 
universalizer of that is the 29.5. They can universalize the magnificence of what it is to be in this form, 
instead of being the victims from other people taking this energy away from them. 

29.6 Confusion 

The sixth line is all about transition. The transition here is that the whole concept of commitment becomes 
something totally different. If you are looking at the circuit and if you are trying to see what the whole 
circuitry is (the nature of the circuitry finishes after this channel), you get to the 13/33, to the channel of 
The Witness, and you get to the essence to what the abstract process is about. It is about the nature of 
reflecting on the experience that you have been through so that that experience, after you have reflected 
about it, can then be added to the human library of what experience is. 

When you get to the sixth line, because of the nature of sixth lines, it is saying, "Will this experience 
actually be valuable in the library? Will anybody know about it? Do I really want to know about this? Is it 
really worthwhile?" All of these standard sixth line perspectives. 

The line is called Confusion. The state that exists when momentum outstrips awareness. Because the 
whole circuit is available, there is the sense of "I am an energy" for the 29th gate. "I don't know what is 
going on. I have all this energy to say yes. I have all this energy to go through this process but I really 
don't know what is going on. I am confused about what all this is for." These are the people that will 
always say to you "Why do we have to live this kind of life? Why is being a human like this? Why do we 
have to go through these things? Why must we have this kind of experience in order to live out the human 
process?" There is this great big question that is there. Why? 

Mars exalted. Driving blind and given Mars' energy and determination, often blind luck. Jupiter in 
detriment. A tendency in confusion to withdraw rather than accept the condition and continue to 

persevere. These are people that can really step out. They can step out to the point that they can literally 
give up life. These are the kind of people that start dying just before they really die. It does not matter 
whether they die by an accident or they get sick, but you know before the time of death that they are 
already dying and you can feel the essence of that. These are people that can withdraw in the deepest 
sense of the word. After all, sixth lines are about the mutative process because it is a transition process. 

Mutation can be positive and negative. You can get to the most negative level of the sixth line, like Blaze 
of glory in the 28.6, and you go burning yourself out into a flaming end. Please understand: it has 
everything to do with the nature of somebody's individual design and not just the fact that this line may 
appear in their chart. If you have somebody who, in their design, has other compensations for that 
possibility, there are ways in which they can go through that and they will be all right. But it is so 
important to understand that that is there in this level of confusion. 

The power to persevere that makes no sense. It does not seem to make any sense unless I can see what its 
value is going to be, though not to me. This is the ultimate impersonal line. My experience has to be of 
value not for me; it has to be of value for everyone else. These are the kind of people that do not want to 
do anything unless they can tell you about it afterwards. These are people that go on a vacation and they 
take 8,000 photographs and you have to go through the whole thing. Now they have videos. They tell 
you, "This was my experience. Isn't it great? This is for you. I want to share this with you." Unless it 
really appears to be of value, then comes the hesitancy of all sixth lines. 

The power in confusion to caution rather than saying yes. Please remember that that yes can go to many 
different levels, ultimately to the point of saying (or not saying) yes to life. It is always there. One of the 
things that I know but do not teach is the nature of how the 29th gate controls death in our lives. It is so 
important to recognize that if you have people in your life you are working with, or children in your life 
who carry this 29th gate energy, that one of the most important things for them to understand it that life is 
a bitch. It is okay. What to do? It will be difficult. 

The moment that they really know that, they do not have any false expectations about the heaven at the 
other end, as long as they understand. These are human beings; these are children that have to be clearly 
told: "Life can be hard. You will find that out. But it is okay. You stay with it. You will grow. You will 
mature. You will get to the other end. By the way, you are perfectly equipped for it." 

People who are abstract in their design are equipped for the abstract plane. The thing for them to 
recognize is that everything that is abstract brings crisis, change and instability and all kinds of problems. 
Belief systems that break down. All kinds of things are part of our human experience. These people need 
to understand that life is difficult but that does not mean that life is bad. It does not mean that being who 
you are is not capable of dealing with the difficulties that life offers. The joke of course is: when you go 
from the 29.6, you go to the 59.1 and it says, "You are confused? You don't know whether your body is 
worth anything? Go make love to somebody, you fool, and find out how incredible it is to have a body." 

HEXAGRAM 30 THE CLINGING FIRE 

Everything about the abstract process is about its experiential nature. Because the abstract process will 
never experience awareness, by the time that the rest of the circuitry that is going out of the emotional 
system has gained the capacity for spiritual awareness, by the time the change comes, this is a process that 
will be eliminated. 

The abstract process is a purely human process. It is our evolutionary process, our experiential process, 
and the 30th hexagram in that case represents something unusual. It represents the potential to feel and to 
long for an experience. Without this potential, we would not have our history. We would not have had all 
the crisis and change that this whole stream of energy has brought. So the 30th hexagram is the beginning 
of Aquarius. The 30th hexagram is something special to us. This is a direction that we are moving 
towards. 

When the spring equinox is in Aquarius, it will be in the sixth line of the 30th hexagram and it will be the 
beginning of this process of the Aquarian age. So the 30th hexagram has a lot of value to us. The Clinging 
Fire is the gate of feeling. Its potential is the awareness to recognize a feeling, or not. It is the energy to 
generate a feeling, or not. Don't be misled by this awareness terminology. It is an energy to feel or not, 
and its potential is hunger/thirst recognition. Everything about the experiential stream is about hunger in 
the beginning (the 41st hexagram, the initiator codon) and being full at the end (the 35th hexagram, 
Progress). The 30th hexagram is the capacity to recognize the feeling to eat or drink. 

We talked about the need for humanity to be able to satisfy the demand of hunger and you see that the 
primary human experience is the recognition of hunger and the energy to go and pursue that hunger until 
one has found food and one can eat. Just as food is a fundamental drive for that stream, sexuality is a 
fundamental drive of this stream. They are all locked up together in this process. 

The best description I know of the Aquarian Age and the nature of this gate is above the lines: Freedom 
recognized as an illusion and limitation accepted as fate. This is the nature of what we are moving 
towards: the illusion of freedom. Freedom does not exist. This is the recognition that we all fit into a 
pattern and in that, we all have our place, and in that, limitation is a grace. It is not a punishment. This is 
the nature of what we are moving toward. The emotional quality of this gate is driving us towards this. It 
is an extraordinary thing to recognize that the deepest force in the emotional motor in this stream, what it 
is really looking for, is to get out of the experiential business and to be satisfied with the pattern that gives 
value to the nature of what it is to be. 

30.1 Composure 

It begins with the foundation in the first line which is Composure. Hardly what you would imagine. The 
nature of feeling is to go into the process, delve into the process; this is the nature of introspection in the 
first line. 

Balance in the face of disorder. Sun exalted. The maximization of limitation in all cases. Jupiter in 
detriment. The ability to maintain composure but at the expense of progress. This gate burns with 
feelings. This is a gate of yearning and longing. In that feeling comes an intensity. This is where desire is. 
It is driven by desire. The key to that is the composure. Most people think of this gate as being the 
burning gate. One of the keys is the recognition of composure: the rising of the intensity of the feeling and 
waiting for the opportunity to be able to actualize. 

Stability through feelings, no matter what the situation. When you move from the 30th to the 36th gate, 
you are going to the gate of inexperience that demands the experience. But the 30th gate is living out the 

feeling in the wave, up and down in that wave of feelings. These are people that carry what we call 
feelings. 

Balanced through feelings but unable to let go of them. This is one of the keys to understanding the nature 
of the 30th hexagram: this is obsession. It is all about obsession. Even if one can be composed, the 
obsession is there and the longer the intensity develops in the 30th gate without the capacity to fulfill that, 
the deeper the obsession becomes. This is a deep hunger that lies inside of the human being. That hunger 
longs to be fulfilled. The nature of this gate is to have composure in spite of obsession. The experience 
can be in the feeling itself without any consummation. 

30.2 Pragmatism 

When we get to this second line of projection and consider the mirror at the other side in the 18.2 where 
you have Terminal Disease, here the feelings are projected outwards in the almost desperate need not to 
simply feel it, but do it. This is one of the keys in this line. 

The balance between extremes. Sun exalted. The productive application of energy without wastage. These 
people are not going to release their feelings when there is nothing they can do with them. They release 
them the moment they can do something. Everything they do suddenly gets imbued with this power of 
feeling. No wastage means they do not get lost in all kinds of feelings. 

Mars in detriment. Over-aggressiveness that chafes against limitations. The moment that they cannot get 
their feelings out, they become aggressive because it is very frustrating for them that they can't get it out. 

The Book of Letters says: Not wasting energy on feelings. They don't waste energy on feelings. They are 
pragmatic. They want to waste the energy on the experience, not on the feeling. The feeling for them is, 
"Yes, Yes, but what is the experience?" Their feelings are always waiting for the opportunity of 
experience. 

Feelings which demand energy. They are demanding the opportunity to release the feelings and if they 
can't, they build up a lot of tension. This line in relationships can be very explosive, particularly if they 
are with somebody who suddenly turns on their emotional system: the 30.2 in an undefined emotional 
system and someone comes along and pumps up their emotional system; this can be a powerful thing. 
There is a great deal of emotional energy that is locked up in here waiting for the opportunity to burst out, 
with predictable results in terms of what happens with other people. It often is simply a feeling-overload. 

I knew someone like that who dropped by my house every time I made some music. He immediately 
made me so emotional that I had to stop. The moment that he had an outlet for this emotional feeling, he 
was just pouring them out. It would not matter if it was a dead dog, he could have his opportunity to 
release his energy crying, laughing, and if you are open to that, you take that in. This is uncomfortable 
because it carries this feeling intensity. These people are great for sannyasin therapies. 

30.3 Resignation 

When you come to the third line, you come to a deeply spiritual line. It is an extraordinary line. I am 
always amazed that it is there in this gate. The nature of this line and what this line will represent later in 
our process, in our development, will become more significant. 

The line is called Resignation. It says: The acceptance of what is. Pluto exalted. The awareness and 
manifestation of the law of regeneration. The laws of Karma, reincarnation and resurrection. Jupiter in 
detriment. The tendency by its very knowledge to encourage or avoid despair. 

Think about the nature of this line. This is an adaptation line. It is the end of the trigram. It can be 
inherently irresponsible. We know it is about bonds made and broken. We know that the wave here is 
allegiance and rejection. What is in that wave and what happens to these people over time is that, out of a 
recognition (after all, this is the channel of Recognition) comes an acceptance of the nature of the wave, 
the acceptance of what it is to be emotional. It does not happen right away. It takes them time; after all 
there is no awareness here until they do recognize that what is, is. "I am up, I am up. I am down, I am 
down. I feel that the world is beautiful. I feel that the world is shit." This is just what is, and out of that 
recognition comes the acceptance of what it is to be emotional. 

These people grasp the nature of the emotions and can be in despair about that because out of that 
recognition does not come awareness. Out of this recognition can come emotional clarity. The highest 
level that this stream can attain is emotional clarity, to recognize that what is, is. It is an irresponsibility to 
the process of the feeling. If the feeling cannot result in change or progress, it is not about becoming 
obsessed with the feeling. It is about surrendering to 'this is what is'. At the high end of the wave, it will 
be acceptable and at the low end of the wave, it is full of pain but nonetheless, this is the nature of the! 
motor. 

Ih the, Book of Letters: The feeling to accept what is. Not-the awareness; the feeling to accept what is. 
This comes only from experience. This is one of the-deepest things that we recognize about the nature of 
the emotional environment, all know this. People in our lives and people that we love,, we!watch them as 
they-grow older and as emotional people grow older,, generally they mellow.. They mellow with 
experience. They have made a fool out of themselves so. many times, they have been hurt so many times, 
they watched others get hurt so many times that slowly they begin to recognize the nature of what the 
wave is. The greatest gift that can come to anyone with a defined emotional system is the, recognition that 
the wave is there and there is nothing one can do about it,, other than just let it be what it is This is the 
beauty that lies in this line. 

The positive or negative feelings that come with acceptance. You don't have to like it. This business about 
having to like, your life: you don't have to like it. You have to accept it.. It is not about liking. You can 
love people that you don't Ike. We all know that. You can like people you don't love. You don't have to 
like your life; you can love it and not like it but you will never lb we it unless you can, accept it.. 

Everybody thinks that they are here to improve their lives. They are not. Your life does not need any 
improving. It is exactly what it is supposed to be, and nothing else. For the emotional being to accept the 
nature of the wave is to survive life; otherwise they can't. Otherwise they are always in pain, always full 
of hope and projecting that onto others. 

This is a very beautiful hexagram. People who have this are very interested in reincarnation. They have 
this as a theme. This line is very mystical. Once you accept it, then you see the whole pattern, you see the 
wheel, you see the spiral. 

30.4 Burnout 

The fourth line: the beginning of the upper trigram and the process of externalization. These people make 
other people sick. They make others emotionally unstable. They are less likely to show evidence of this 
themselves, but they can have deep impact on the people around them. The line is called Burnout. An 
unrealistic pace that begs misfortune. These are experience junkies. These are people who must have 
experience. They can only develop their feelings through experience and they must share their feelings 
with someone else. 

Pluto exalted. A compulsive and hyperactive nature that carries all the earmarks of burnout but doesn't 
necessarily arrive at it. A positive outcome is often assisted through analysis. This is a classic situation. 
You have a parent that has the 30.4 and they have a child with an undefined emotional system. The child 
becomes hyperactive and it gets sent into analysis. The 30.4 really impacts on other human beings much 
more that on themselves. 

Jupiter in detriment. Uncontrollable expansion with the inevitable bursting of the bubble. In this 
hexagram, you have three different situations in which Jupiter is in the detriment. This emotional field is 
enormously expansive. 

Highly energized feelings that may lead to emotional collapse. I have the 41.3, so my resonance is not to 
the fourth line. A friend of mine has the fourth line. Whenever that person visits me, it is so 
uncomfortable for me because I notice that, after they have been there for ten or fifteen minutes, I get up 
and go to work. I start doing something-an experience. I suddenly have the feeling that I have to do this. 

These people can be really obsessive about living out their feeling in that sense, but it is what they do to 
others that is so powerful. Remember that by the time you get to the fourth line, you get to a line that by 
its very nature is there to externalize a single track. And it is a collective circuit and it is about sharing, 
and the very next step is to penetrate somebody. When you see this, particularly in couples or parent-child 
relationships, this is something to talk about with them because this can always lead to a great deal of 
problems and misunderstanding about the nature of it. The person with the undefined system who takes 
that in becomes deeply vulnerable to that because they become twice as explosive. 

30.5 Irony 

When you get to fifth line, you get to the universalization. The line is called Irony. It says: Recognition 
and dedication to transitory goals. Jupiter exalted. The strength derived from knowledge and experience 
that two steps forward and one step back is still one step forward. 

Understand what happens to these people. This is all about sex, food and experience. They have an 
interesting love affair and they leave their lover because they find something more interesting. They are a 
30th gate. They have a yearning and a desire and they see a new lover and they go ahead and have a new 
love affair. It turns out to be terrific. 

Six months later, they go shopping and go into a cafe and there is their old lover. There is a feeling inside 
of them that says, "Maybe we should try it again and see if that was really what I thought it was when I 
left." What happens to them is that the whole experiential process is about gaining experience and not 
repeating it because it is not worthwhile, but there are many situations in which you cannot know that 
until you have had the experience a few times. They will go through that process where they will take 
their step ahead and will have their new experience but there is always a holding on to the feeling from 
before. That can pull them back to that feeling. They can often feel very funny in a situation where 
suddenly they thought that they were through with something and then they have to come all the way 
back and deal with it again. The whole thing about that line is that everything is the same, except how you 
handle it. 

Pluto in detriment. The anger engendered by the irony, frustration with its limitations and a desire to 
eliminate the entire process. "I will get rid of both of them because something is wrong. Why should I go 
back? Shouldn't I be satisfied with where I am?" They have to learn that this is the only way in which 
they will come to grips with the experiential pathway. They are double-checkers with their feelings. They 
go back and check it out one more time and then they walk away and say, "Yes, I was right. I got that on 
my way, but now I'll get rid of that feeling and now I can go on to the next experience." 

In the Book of Letters: Each new feeling brings back an old feeling before progress can take place. That 
new feeling brings back an old feeling which lingers in there and you think, "I don't know if I am doing 
the right thing." 

Frustration and anger with the old feelings brought into the emotional awareness with each new 
experience. "Why is it still there with me? Does that mean that I am not in the right experience for me 
now?" This can be a real torment. These people get torn in their feelings. They have the new experience 
that they are participating in and the old feeling that is still lingering there, and the two of them fight with 
each other in the emotional system. Depending on their wave, that struggle can either be full of hope or 
full of pain. Eventually, they get rid of that old feeling because the new one is okay. In the low end of the 
wave: "Oh, my god. This new feeling must have been a trick. I'd better check out the old feeling again." 
These are, by the way, the most seductive of these people because they simply do have the experience. 

30.6 Enforcement 

We come to the roof of the house, the line of transition. Remember the mirrors in Design because they are 
very funny. The 18.6 is Buddhahood. The 30.6 is not Work on what has been spoilt but it is 'the spoilt 
one.' In the 30.6 we find the emotionally spoilt one. They only want the best experiences. They only want 
to have the thrill of the emotional life. This is what is so important to them. 

It is called Enforcement. The discipline to maintain right action. Mars exalted. The assertiveness to purge 
the inferior while accepting to lead the weak. The strength to eliminate negative feelings. They don't want 
to have negative feelings. They are looking for the feel-good in life. They hope that somebody will bring 
it to them. Because of that, these are some of the cleverest people in knowing exactly who to yearn for. 
They are very good at this. They are good at looking exactly for that energy that is going to give them that 
kind of life. The same is true for the 18.6, finding someone who will spoil them. This is one of their gifts. 
The 30.6 is somebody who needs to be spoilt emotionally. 

Moon in detriment. An inherent peacefulness that all too often will abide the presence of inferior forces. 
Now, think about this: both of these lines in the Rave I'Ching are talking about dealing with inferior 
forces and remember that every hexagram, when you get to the roof, is looking to the next hexagram, in 
this case the 55.1, which is all about finding the spirit through cooperation with superior forces. 

The whole thing about the experiential path is that it seems like it can be full of all kinds of inferior 
forces. That is what you learn along the experiential path. What works? What does mot work?'Who can 
do' it and who can't? Where the (progress is and where' it is not. The deepest thing the 30.6 is looking for 
is the real superior force, lit is interested im (people and this is very unusual. This is a collective circuit 
and iit is not personal: it -tends to be the kind of relationship that is simply for the experience itself and 
yet the sixth line says, "I know all that. I want more. I want the superior experience. 1 wont a superior 
person in my life because II know that I have 'to shore it with somreone." 

HEXAGRAM 31 INFLUENCE 

The channel 31/7, the channel of theAlpha, for good or bad, a design of leadership. There are no more 
connotations in this. This is the mechanic to be influential. This is the mechanic to lead. It says above the 
lines: The law of friction, whether active or passive, that engenders transference and thus influence. It is 
transference that influence is all about. That is, what has to be transferred needs to be transferred to those 
who have the power to act on it. Remember, we have a primary gate of identity and we have a logical 
process that suffers a deep restriction of energy. 

The 31 represents what we call in our process a democratic leader, what we call democracy. It is 
somebody that has to be elected or selected. When somebody is a political leader, no matter how they got 
to that position, they are going to have to transfer their leadership quality to others. They have to transfer 
a pattern to others; otherwise, nothing gets led. It is as simple as that. In other words, the leader is always 
going to be dependent on their quality of transference. If the quality of transference is of value, then their 
leadership can be of value. If what they transfer is not of value, then the opposite occurs. 

31.1 Manifestation 

Here the first line is called Manifestation. We are dealing with the throat, which is the great center of 
manifestation. This is the only line that is called Manifestation. This is a key. This is fundamental. 

Remember the relationship that exists between the logical process and all other forms of life. Whether 
you are looking at plants, at animals, at insects or at a single cell, you are dealing with forms that have 
something in common. What they have in common is logic. It is very important for us. Without secure 
patterns upon which we can project into the future, it puts an enormous strain on our ability to survive. 
That is why logic is so important to us: to understand how things actually operate, in fact, and out of that, 
to recognize how we can move into the future. There is no guarantee about the future but it gives us a 
secure footing. That is why we look for logical leadership and are disturbed by illogical leadership. 

Influence cannot exist in a vacuum. This is the foundation of all leadership. Every leader knows that they 
are only as strong as those who follow. This is the core of all leadership. There is no leader out of the 31/7 
that can be of any value unless they have those who are willingly serving and following. This is not the 
45; this is not the tribal leader. This is a collective leader who is dependent on the energy of the collective 
to maintain it. If we do not like our politicians, we vote them out, in that sense. Without the collective 
support, they cannot maintain their leadership. 

Here you have an example of a line that has the Sun and the Earth as both the exalted and the detriment. 
Whenever you see the Sun and the Earth in the same line, you know that this is a very important polarity. 
Always. 

Here, the Sun exalted. The Sun does not and cannot hold back its light and thus its influence on every life. 
What we are talking about is quality, the quality of a pattern which can bring light or darkness. 

The other side is the Earth in detriment. This was Hitler's line; he had his Earth there. What he inherited 
from his mother was his design Earth. The absorption of light that in darkness can only promise 
manifestation. 

These are the two sides: The natural expression of leadership, natural in the sense of bringing a direct 
benefit in its transference to society. It is giving them something secure to lead them into the future. The 
other side: The unnatural expression of leadership. By the way, that does not mean bad. I am not a 
moralist. If I look at this activation, I can see that, out of that, its direct effect may have been darkness 

(Hitler, for example) but the indirect transference led to a very enlightened generation that followed. The 
nature of the war and its technologies led to all kinds of advances. We would not have people surviving in 
the world through the medicine that we have if we had not experimented on about a hundred million 
people injured in the field during the war. All kinds of medical techniques, all kinds of devices, all kinds 
of things that now benefit all of us were a direct result of that. 

This is not about morality. Don't get into a trip of saying to a 31.1 in detriment, "Oh my god, this is 
terrible." It is not about that. It is simply about recognizing that there are two ways that bring influence. 
There are patterns that bring light; there are patterns that bring darkness. That is just the way that it works. 

Regarding the term 'darkness', by the way, there are patterns that lead one into the form. There are forms 
which lead one into the spirit. This is all part of leadership. It is there. One side or the other. Leadership, 
good or bad. That is the nature of it. This moral question, good or bad, is how it is perceived on the 
outside, but the reality is that there is no good or bad in leadership. There is only good or bad when you 
are making a moral reference to it. It says very clearly as a basis that leadership is never a guarantee for us 
in terms of whether it is directly of value to us or whether it is a long term process that is of value to us. 

Leadership can appear to be both dark and light in our process. We have that in any kind of political 
leadership. The moment that we are unhappy with a political leader, we immediately demonize them and 
try to turn them into a dark force rather than into a light force. The moment we elect them, we are very 
excited about them and turn them into a light force. After all, a leader is dependent on the energy of the 
followers. This is never to be forgotten. All leaders are simply a representation of the energy of their 
followers. 

31.2 Arrogance 

When you get to the second line, you get to a line that is called Arrogance. Remember that the nature of 
this hexagram is to transfer a pattern. In that way, you lead. When you come to the second line, you come 
to people that are projecting out that they are the leader. Well, yes, but then again, leadership is something 
that takes time. You have to develop certain skills. You have to go through a process. If you are five years 
old and you are yelling, "I am the leader. Follow mel" you may run into difficulties. If you are 40 years 
old and you haven't figured it out and you are yelling, "I am the leader. Follow mel" you will run into 
difficulties. 

Arrogance is Independent action without guidance. "I want to lead the people," and the people are not 
paying any attention. "Maybe I'll do something to get their attention so that they see that I am really there 
to lead them." Or the Mercury in detriment. A reasoned arrogance that out of nervous tension jumps the 
gun and often misfires. This is one of those things that are so difficult for politicians. It is like you are 
planning on running in a political party; you are leading a political party and you are hoping that your 
party will eventually take power and things work out, and all of a sudden you are planning on having a 
coup d'etat. "Well, if it will not work this way, I will jump the gun because they do not pay any attention." 

In the second line, there is no guarantee that that leadership projection carries with it anything worth 
transferring. That can only be checked out by those who want to follow. These people who jump the gun 
and say "I am ready to lead" are often paper tigers and they can't lead at all. It is one of the most common 
things you see in coup d'etats, that you have a bunch of generals who will form a committee in which all 
of them are co-presidents. One of them ends up being a leader. These people here: the one who is the 
ceremonial leader at the time of the coup gets toppled immediately and is gone when the real one shows 
up. 

These people can be paper tigers because they are there saying, "Yes, I am the power to lead." Because 
they have that power to lead, they put out that projection and other people say, "Aren't they arrogant. 
What makes them think that they can actually lead us?" 

By the way, there is a delicious joke to all of this. If you look at the other side of the channel, to the 7.2 
which is its resonance, this is the line of The Democrat. This is one of those things to see about the nature 
of how democracy works. Democracy itself, what we are empowering, is a lot of independent action 
without guidance, which is why we end up with a very corrupt political system. That is another story. 

In London, when the English election had just taken place, there was a short piece about a famous writer, 
Kenneth Clerk. His son, who is in his late sixties and who is somebody that has been in enormous trouble 
with sexual scandals throughout his career, is a conservative representative in a very wealthy 
neighborhood. He was asked by a reporter: "What do your clients expect? What do your constituents 
expect from you?" and he said, "Well. They expect me to keep them rich." The other question was, "What 
about all these sex scandals in your life?" He said: "You know. In politics, to take money is morally 
wrong but sex, I don't know. " 

I mention that because if you have a system that has no way of getting easy money, what you end up with 
is greed and corruption. If you cannot get easy access to the energy, then you have to find some other way 
to get to that energy. Every political party that we have has dirt up their sleeves because they are digging 
for money somewhere and it does not matter how pretty their name is on the surface. When you get down 
into the nitty-gritty, they are all scrounging around for energy. In doing that, all kinds of problems exist, 
not that we can do anything about that. 

31.3 Selectivity 

The nature of a third line is that, in a sense, it is combining the qualities of the first and second line, the 
qualities of introspection and projection. It puts them together into this potential for adaptation. When you 
get to this third line, you get to the key to successful political leadership which lies here. It is called 
Selectivity, which is about recognizing first of all, who should be a follower? This is so important in 
terms of influence. If you influence somebody that cannot implement your pattern, there is very little 
impact. If you influence somebody that can implement your pattern, it will have a lot of impact. This is 
the whole nature of selectivity. It is not about how many people support you. It is about what is the 
quality of that support? Who are they? 

Sun exalted. The ability to carefully assess and choose the proper influence and to tailor one's behavior 
accordingly. Think about that because there is a kind of twist in that. The politician has to be influenced 
by the follower, so we have all of these followers. They have lobbies and causes and they all have their 
way that they try to influence the person who actually acts as the leader. The leader has to recognize that 
every follower that they have has their own agenda. They have to carefully select what influences they 
want to accept from their followers in order to maintain their role as a leader of those followers. So, they 
have to be very careful and clear about with what those followers want to influence them, so that they can 
be their guide, in that sense. 

On the other side, we have Jupiter in detriment. Qualitative selectivity with the risk of a runaway 
enthusiasm that may lead to humiliation. "You want to follow me? Oh, that is wonderful. Let me give you 
all of this stuff to transfer." If that person can't, the energy is wasted and confusion comes out of that. A 
lack of influence is generated out of that. 

In the white book: The capacity to lead enhanced through association with the proper influences. But 
always remember that we are dealing with a third line: adaptation is based on trial and error. You will 

have to deal with bad influences, with the wrong kind of people, the wrong kind of followers, before you 
get to the opportunity to recognize how that really works. 

At the other side of the line, we have: The drive to lead that will accept any follower and the risks. This is 
Jupiter at its worst, in that sense: the expansiveness of Jupiter that says, "Yes, you can come. If you want 
to follow me, that is fine. I'll give you this to do." Thus, you end up with all kinds of difficulties in that. 
The key for anybody who is carrying third lines is always this recognition that you are going to go 
through these processes and you are going to make these mistakes that you will have to learn from. 

What you have to learn is that the third line, because it is not yet transpersonal, has this genetic 
recognition that it can lead, but it has to make mistakes in leadership before it can recognize that it cannot 
do it alone and that it needs the proper forces with it because it is not so much leading with its influence 
as it is taking the influence of its followers and channeling it. That is what a leader does. 

Today, though it is politically correct to condemn it, we have a political environment in which politicians 
very carefully watch the polls. Everybody is screaming and yelling about how we have lost the days 
where our politicians directed us instead of the politicians trying to figure out where we want to go and 
taking us there. This is a real improvement. This is the essence of how things should work in this context 
of influence, that one has to take into account the needs and the direction of the totality, the needs of the
