collective, and act as a focus to represent them. No leader actually has their own influence in that sense. 
They are always taking the influence of the followers and giving it a focal point. That is the nature of this 
line. The third lines learn from its mistakes. 

31.4 Intent 

When we get to this upper trigram, we get to the fourth and fifth lines which are transpersonal. They are 
deeply aware of the other side and deeply aware of the identity and that they need to project out this role 
of being a leader. The fourth line, the line of Intent, is an unusual line. Whenever I meet this line in 
people's readings, I exactly meet the same phenomena in their lives. The fourth line is about externalizing. 
It is about having this one-trackedness that we are very well aware of by now. What you have here is: The 
success of influence based on how it is perceived. 

Think about how this works. You have two people who have exactly the same problem, theoretically. 
They come to the 31.4 with exactly the same problem and the 31.4 transfers their influence to each of 
them and tells each of them exactly the same thing. The 31.4 leads them (this is the voice, "I lead") in this 
way. You have these two people, they have exactly the same problem, they go to the same leader, the 
leader tells them exactly the same thing and one of the two people, no matter how it all comes out, will 
love them and the other one will hate them. One of them thinks that they are the best leader that ever lived 
and the other will think that they are a terrible, manipulative bastard that should not be in the world. 

For the 31 .4, no matter how they externalize it, there are always those that like it and those that do not 
like it, no matter whether it is a good or a bad thing. It makes no difference. This is the nature of intent. 

The Moon exalted. Public acknowledgment of a nurturing and protective influence. Or Mars in detriment: 
Perceived ego aggrandizement and attempted manipulation. If you have that fixed on one side or the 
other, your influence can always be perceived as being very nice and valuable and helpful, or your 
influence is perceived as being terrible. But for most people who have this line, they are always getting 
this polarity, no matter what they do. 

In the white book: External positive recognition of one's capacity to lead, or External negative projection 
of one's capacity to lead. In other words, it does not make any difference. This is just about externalizing 

the influence and, because this is the resonance to the foundation, everybody who is in the position of 
being a leader recognizes that no matter what they do, there will be a segment in the population that hates 
it and another segment in the population that loves it. 

That is the nature of collective direction. You can't please all of the people all of the time. This is what 
this fourth line has to recognize. Very difficult in children. After all, a child that has the 31 st gate is a 
child that has within it a genetic capacity to lead, and if they have the fourth line, even when they lead in a 
successful way, even when their leadership is of value, they will have to deal with other kids in their 
group who will hate them for that, even though other kids love them for the very same leadership. 

This can be very difficult, particularly for people who have an undefined emotional system, to be this 
kind of leader. The 3 1 .4 with an open emotional system will have such a thin skin and will be so easily 
disturbed by the negative side that they will fail to see the positive attributes of their leadership. 

It is very important to understand something intrinsic in the collective process: it is not personal. That is 
one of the reasons why we do not particularly like our leaders personally. The collective is not personal. 
The moment we make it personal, we have a problem. This is collective leadership and, in the collective 
sense, you are always going to meet criticism. You will meet those who are satisfied with you and those 
who are dissatisfied with you. You need to have a thick skin. Whenever I meet somebody with the 3 I tell 
them: you have to have a thick skin because you can't expect that what you do is going to get universal 
approval. It will never get universal approval. You get half of the people and the other half will not like it. 
That is just the way it works. 

31.5 Self-righteousness 

The first line always shows us the basic nature of a hexagram and we have seen that the nature of this gate 
of Influence is to manifest the influence, to make the transference. When we get to the fifth line, we see 
how leadership is perceived by the world and the way people perceive influence and those that carry 
influence is this line of Self-righteousness. It is projected on the universal leader that they are only 
interested in themselves. They are only interested in power, in being the boss, in being in charge. This is 
the standard world view impression of our leaders: that they are in it for their own self-aggrandizement. 

Lack of external influence guaranteed by attitude. Pluto exalted. A natural specialization that one 
develops in isolation. However, when the development is complete, the extremely difficult and generally 
impossible task of externalizing the influence. 

This is a line that is universal. These are the only ones in the first five lines of leadership that are really 
only interested in being their own leader. The fifth line is interested in being its own leader. It is very 
fixed on leading itself. It is not so concerned about being anybody else's leader, but the outside world is 
projecting on them, because they look like people who are leading themselves, that they have influence 
and are comfortable with their direction. Other people project on them and say, "Hey, what about us? 
Why don't you share that with us?" 

The fifth line recognizes the pull that is coming from the other side, but the other side, in the 7.5, is The 
General. This is about only being a leader in times of crisis. This is not your everyday leader. It is a 
difficult task to externalize this quality of leadership and only in times when it is absolutely essential, 
when the pressure is the most profound, is there a possibility for these people to externalize that influence. 

The Moon in detriment. A deep focus on personal experience that is self-fulfilling and has no external 
ambitions. "I am too busy leading my own life, why should I lead yours? My life is much more important 

to me than the collective's life and, aside from that, I do not think that you got it right. " (The resonance to 
the arrogance in the second line.) 

In the white book: A specialization that demands that one lead oneself; or A lack of ambition where one is 
content to lead oneself. These are reluctant leaders, but at the same time, when they do get into power, 
they are very effective. Then they get this whole projection on them that they are the self-righteous ones. 

I always use the illustration of ancient Greece. Athens would get into trouble and they would hire a 
dictator who organized society and the army and got everything done. When everything was coming to a 
conclusion, then all the so-called democrats started saying, "They are only concerned about themselves. 
They are really self-righteous and not really concerned about us, and thus it's time for them to go. " This is 
the real quality of leadership that the outside is projecting on: the self-righteous leader that does not really 
care about you, that only cares about themselves and therefore, one has to be concerned about the nature 
of their leadership. You can see the resonance in the gate of behavior in the 10.5, The Heretic, saying, 
"Why do you force me to lead you? You will only hang me afterwards." 

We saw in the fifth lines throughout that they all have to do with timing. We saw in the 8.5, Dharma, that 
you have to know when to let people out of your taxi cab. We saw in the 33.5 that you have to have the 
right timing in order to know when to release the secrets. The same thing is true for this form of 
leadership. It only works at certain times. The time has to be right and then the power of that leadership 
can be actualized. It is a matter of timing. 

31.6 Application 

When we get to the sixth line, we get to the transition line. We know that the transition is rooted in the 
awareness frequency of trust or not. "Can I really trust in this? Can it really go beyond?" If you are 
looking at the whole logical circuit, "Will this leadership provide humanity with a secure future?" When 
you get to the sixth line, you get to the fundamental recognition of limitation. Sixth lines get to see or get 
to experience the limitation in their own process. 

The sixth line says Application. This is not a gate of action. To manifest logic is very hard. You have to 
go down the talent channel and down the 18/58. It is a long process to get to the energy. That is why our 
collective systems are corrupt. Political parties are looking for money. It is so difficult to get to the 
energy. 

This line says: Actions which match the words and thus guarantee success. The 31.6 says, "Yes, I can say 
that, but whether that is actually going to happen is another story. I can transfer that influence but whether 
it is actually going to manifest is another story. I don't think it really will. I will have to come up with a 
leadership, a pattern that is so vital, so essential that humanity will offer its energy to it. Otherwise, it is 
not going to work." 

When it does not work, when the power to actually manifest as doing is not there, then you get the Moon 
in detriment. A superficiality in application that borders on hypocrisy and is justifiably treated 
accordingly. People who have the 31.6 learn very early in life that when they say, "I lead. I will do this," 
and then they can't because they do not have access to the energy, they then sound like hypocrites. They 
end up saying, "Do what I say not what I do because I can't do it myself." Because they learn that very 
quickly, there is a part of them that stands back and says, "I am not going to lead anything because there 
is no guarantee that I am going to have the energy to be able to manifest my program." That is like 
somebody saying: "I'll be the political leader of this party if you can assure me that everybody is going to 
vote for me and I win; Otherwise, I do not want to be the leader. I mean, why should I be the leader of 
this party when I can't win and actually influence society? Why should I be the leader of this party if all I 

can do is to talk when I won't be able to do anything about it? I won't be able to show that it really 
works." 

The joke is that the 31.6 goes to the 33.1. It goes back to Retreat. It goes to the abstract process. The first 
line of the gate of Retreat is Avoidance which is all about sitting there and going through this process of 
withdrawing so that you can reflect on it. The 31.6 is saying, "What I would really like to be able to see is 
that if I am the head of the party: everybody votes for me and then I bring in this program and we 
actualize it. Then I can sit over here in the 33rd gate and I can look back at it and say, "Yes, based on 
experience, I made a real contribution to society." Puffing the horse before the cart is the whole trap in the 
collective process. Don't expect these people to lead you unless they have a chance to get everything. If 
they do not have a chance to get it all, if they can't win and direct, they are not going to be in such a hurry 
to lead at all. 

HEXAGRAM 32 DURATION 

The 32nd hexagram is part of the channel of Transformation, a design of being driven. It is fueled by the 
energy of the 54th gate, the Marrying Maiden, the gate of ambition. The 32nd gate, like all gates in the 
splenic awareness, like all gates of awareness, is a gate of fear, and the fear of the 32nd gate is the fear of 
failure. Because it is the nature of the fear that is associated with this gate, every single line of the 32nd 
gate is dealing at some level or another with the fear of failure. 

The 32nd gate is Duration, and it is the gate of continuity. It is a deeply conservative gate. It is the mirror 
of the emotional revolutionary in the 49 on the other side. It is conservative for the benefit of the tribe. It 
is trying to conserve the material success because it does not want to be a failure. Everything about the 
instinctive stream has to do with achieving material success for the tribe. The 32nd gate is deeply 
concerned about whether or not it will be a success and is very much afraid of failure. 

It is an instinctive stream which is deeply related to the nose. People with the 32nd gate can smell failure 
coming because they have an attribute which is the remembrance of failure, unlike the 54th gate that can 
only remember victory. That is why it is inherently conservative. It can recognize that transformation can 
always take place. 

The awareness here is to recognize what can be transformed, what should be transformed, or not. The 
ambition of the 54 does not always have to be satisfied. There is a time to move up the ladder. There is a 
time to change your product line. There is a time to go through these processes. The awareness in the 32 
is trying to judge clearly what can and what cannot be transformed. 

The awareness potential: this is a liquid regulator. Our memory is in our water. The water in the cells 
carries our memory. This is all about a memory stream. Any activation in this stream is always going to 
be an indication of deep cellular memory in a human being. There is a memory for what did not work. By 
the way, the smell of failure builds up over a lifetime of seeing what does not work and getting a smell of 
what does not work so that you can pick up a whiff of that when it is coming. 

When you look in the Rave I'Ching at the heading above the line for the 32nd hexagram, it says: The only 
thing which endures is change. Don't misunderstand the nature of the 32nd gate. It is conservative, but 
radical conservatism leads to annihilation, leads to the end, leads to failure. For example, you have all 
these people who are still trying to produce teletype machines after the telefax came. It is time to 
recognize that you can only get to some point and then you have to change it. If you don't change, you are 
going to be left by the wayside. 

Built into the nature of the 32nd gate is always a recognition that what truly endures is change, which is 
the evolutionary process. This is about being conservative in terms of what you will change to. This is the 
nature of the conservativeness here. It is not about rejecting change. This is very important to understand 
because it helps us to recognize that the tribe can be changed because, at its most conservative gate, 
change is its nature. It is how one approaches that change. 

32.1 Conservation 

In the first line, we start with introspection. We are starting with the foundation of the house. The first line 
will look inwards. It is the most conservative of all of these lines. 

It is called Conservation. A life sustaining respect and attention to all aspects of a process. This is the 
ideal of the introspective field. In other words, yes, change is inevitable but I will make sure that I have 
all the details before I get involved with that change and leave behind tradition. 

Mars in detriment. An uncontrollable urge to bypass essentials which inevitably leads to the disruption of 
continuity. Because it is the tribe and because it is inherently conservative, if you jump over the details, 
you will not be able to make the transition from what was old to what can be new. There will be 
something missing and you will end up with all kinds of problems associated with this. 

The first line: because it is essential to the tribe, the detail is essential. What you have with the detriment 
are tribes that make jumps. For example, you can see that we find some Neolithic tribes in the middle of 
the Amazonian jungle, and what do we bring them? We bring them frying pans and mirrors. We bring 
them this whole leap, this whole transformation in their culture, and all the detail is missing in between. 
So many aboriginal people have suffered because there has been this enormous gap between their culture 
and the one that is coming and imposing their way upon them without the detail being there. Those within 
the aboriginal culture who made that jump, because they do not have the details, that inevitably leads to 
problems. They do not have continuity. They lose their culture. They jump into the other culture. They 
don't have the ability to bring the culture along and allow it to mature with new technology and new 
input. 

The first line is about introspection. When the introspection is missing, failure can happen. The failure 
will be there in the continuity. The fear is that, once you see that the change is inevitable (this is the 
channel of being driven), there is this enormous urge to just change. Damn the details. "I want that mirror; 
I don't care about the Madonna." 

One has to be careful with this. It is intended to be very conservative. It is the foundation of the tribe's 
success. The material success in the tribe is, "Okay, but let's keep our continuity." All the aboriginal 
people that were integrated into other cultures now make their living by selling their aboriginal art. They 
kept their culture and it becomes a material success for them because their continuity is of value. They've 
brought the past into the future and they can offer it and still provide for the nature of the tribe. 

When you are looking at the ego circuit, you are looking at the two streams that go to the ego. The 
emotional stream that goes to the ego, the stream of sensitivity, is all about communal life. The communal 
life is looking for the initiation (25/51). Here, you have a natural flow that takes place and this is not 
about communal life but life in the corporate culture. It is about the work structure. Who is working with 
whom and how we work together is organized in this stream. It begins in the 45th gate which is the owner 
of the company. The 21st gate is the president, the 26th gate is the salesman or the head of sales, the 44th 
gate is the personnel manager and the 32nd gate is the financial officer. 

The 32nd gate decides whether money is spent or not and on what money is spent. They have a great deal 
of power because of that and because below the financial manager are all these people in the 54 who try 
to climb up the corporate ladder, the Marrying Maidens who want to go all the way up to the top and be 
the CEO. The 54's are always trying to be familiar with the 32's. The 32s are always in a situation where 
the Marrying Maidens, with their ambition, are trying to get the financial officer to invest in things so that 
the transformation and the change can take place.

Ilm the Rave I'Ching it says: The control of power for the.benefitand enhancement of Jrarmony. "I will

The other side of this jupiter in detriment. A tendency in frustration, ;particularly from a position of

Restraint is what the note is here. The potential for transformation that may be beneficial to others. But

The frustration with controls or being controlled. The frustration of having to control people all the time.

For analysts, all second lines are difficult to read because, basically, we do not want to tell people things

A second line is not by its very nature a problem and, at the same time, design is a duality. The restraint

This is one of the things we had when we were living in a second line phase that existed around the birth

Indecision in times of transformation. "What do I do and who do I do it with? Do I do it with you? If I do

The other side of this: A lack of instinct in times of transformation. Not being able to get it at the right

The instinct to maintain one's principles in times of change; or The instinct to maintain one's principles as

32.5 Flexibility 

The fifth line is the fulfillment of the essence of what the hexagram is. It is the capacity to universalize, to 
be able to bring it out, not only to the gate that is at the other end of the channel, but to begin the process 
of moving into the circuitry. This is something that has a broader movement. Due to its collective 
keynote, it is an aspect that can bring the tribe to collective change. 

This is something that we deal with in the tension of the world today. For example, the United Nations, as 
a collective organization, wants the Bosnians, the Serbs and the Croats, who are tribal, to make peace 
with each other. If you want to look at the fulfillment of this hexagram, it is about the flexible projection 
of power. Fifth lines resonate to second lines. It is no longer the pure projection of the second line. This is 
the next step up in this structure. This projection here is all about recognizing that one has to be flexible in 
the way one projects outwards. 

Flexibility. Easy adaptation to circumstances. Moon exalted. Superficiality is a valuable tool that while 
masking the inner light permits adaptation to prevailing conditions. This is all about keeping it 
underneath. You know that you have the power to project but circumstances are not allowing you to 
project your power at this moment. So you bide your time. You wait and see. You wait for your 
opportunity and then you project it out. 

Mars on the other side: The urge to express oneself in direct and often violent rejection of conformity. 
Conformity is the nature of the tribe which is deeply conservative. The violence in this is mirrored on the 
other side in the 49.5. It is mirrored in the possibility of being able to fulfill revolution so that revolution 
becomes a universalized process. In that, there is always the possibility here for vast change in the nature 
of the tribe. Suddenly, the tribe can be brought to a point of becoming one with the collective, in that 
sense. 

An instinct for adaptation in times of change. To know when to project your power and when not to. 
Remember, underneath that is the fear of failure. "I'd better not project my power out because, if I do so, I 
destabilize everything so I'd better hold that all back inside of me and wait and see what happens." 

The potential of the instinct to reject adaptation and conformity in times of change. The keynote: in times 
of change. That is the only time this is going to come into play. These are the kind of people that you 
want holding the purse strings when there is a vast change in the society around you. They are the ones 
who should be in power in those moments. What happens is that they are the ones that naturally have the 
greatest impact in times of change. 

One of the classic examples that you know about is in corporations and what they call downsizing. This is 
the detriment. This is very common. We are not going to look after all the people in the company 
anymore who have been loyal to us for 25 years, who have been our family and allowed us to become 
wealthy. We will fire all of them because our shareholders need profits. We are in times of change 
because we have a globalizing economy, and I am sorry you have to be the victim. We really wanted to 
do this five years ago, but now we can do it. " 

It depends on where you are in that. If you are victim, this is a terrible thing. It appears to be deeply 
violent in that sense. If you are not the victim, it can just mean being flexible. The person who is making

and all my other 25,000 workers will lose their jobs and my shareholders will go mad." That is the other 
side of the story. These things are not one -dimensional. That is the universalizing element. 

Whenever you see fifth lines in a chart, whenever you see transits that are affecting fifth lines, you know
