larger field. This is a universalizing process. 

32.6 Tranquility 

Here, we get to the roof of the house and we are not in the house anymore. The nature of the hexagram is 
going through a transformation. This is one of those lines that I kept running into so often because it can 

be depressive and because we had Neptune activating the other side of it. Therefore, we have a whole 
generation of people in the early 1990's that went into all kinds of severe depressions due to the nature of 
this line. 

Consider that the tribe is essentially materialist even when it is being communal at the other side. 
Communalism is all about coming up with a bargain so that everybody has what they need. Tribal life is, 
by its very nature, material. This aspect of the tribe, moving up to the instinctive stream, is what is 
essential. It is the ability to recognize what will work, what change to accommodate, in order that the 
continuity of the material success of the tribe can survive, so that we need not be afraid of failure. 

The fear of failure is a theme that we all live with. It is a global theme: this deep sense that we cannot fail, 
that we must have the material that we need. When you get to the sixth line, it is kind of like, "Well, I am 
not really interested in just that. There must be something else other than just climbing up the corporate 
ladder, making our bread and butter, doing our job." 

The sixth line is called Tranquility. Change is inevitable. The projection of power in the 32nd hexagram is 
trying to make sure that transformation can take place, that there won't be a failure. It is trying to be 
conservative, trying to continue things. This line says, "Yes, okay, but everything changes. Nothing stays 
the same. Everything just keeps on changing. Am I supposed to control that?" 

The sixth line is not about control anymore. It is a need now. The need to calmly face impermanence. 
Pluto exalted. An underlying acceptance of change that may or may not lead to tranquility. It may, or it 
may not. On the other side, Neptune in detriment. Impermanence as proof of meaninglessness with its 
attendant manifestations, depression, delusion, and in the extreme, self-destruction. "The tribe is 
meaningless, this business is meaningless. Why should I spend 20 years of my life investing in this 
business when it will fall apart anyway due to changes in the society? Why did I spend all this money 
making hula-hoops? It will change. Why did I get involved with 8-track tapes? It will change." There is 
this sense of: "Why bother? Nothing is stable, nothing will last. I will kill myself." 

In the white book: The instinctive awareness to accept change and transformation; or The fear engendered 
when change is experienced as impermanence and the potential for depression. 

Whenever you come to the nature of the sixth line, please recognize that it is always looking for the next 
hexagram. The next hexagram is the 50, the values, and the first line is The Immigrant. The whole thing 
for the sixth line to recognize is that transition is always there and they will always be The Immigrant. 
This is their whole thing. These are not the people to establish a business that is going to last forever. 
They have to be very clear that all of this is coming anyway. They are here to ride the wave so that they 
can be the immigrants that can establish the new values out of what the change brings. These people can 
be visionaries. They can look ahead and say: "I will not do this because I can see what is coming. What is 
coming is either going to frighten them or it gives them a sense of tranquility. "Yes, I can see the change 
is coming. I do not want to get involved with this. I can wait to discover what my values will be in what is 
coming." 

HEXAGRAM 33 RETREAT 

We will now look at one of the two collective gates of identity, this one in the abstract process. (The other 
is the logic process in the 31.) The channel 33/13 is the channel of the Prodigal; it is the channel of the 
witness. The identity of the abstract process is rooted in what we call reflection and remembrance. 
Reflection and remembrance are part of this 13/33. The voice of the 33rd gate is not a voice that says, "I 
know I can contribute." This is a voice that says, "I remember," or "I don't remember". This is the 
remembrance that takes place at the end of an abstract process and the 33rd gate is one of the three gates 
of aloneness. The 12th gate, the 40th gate and the 33rd gate are the three gates of aloneness. 

Whenever I am dealing with abstract people, whether they have this gate or not, or the 13, I always 
remind them that, in order for them to truly make sense out of their life, they have to have time in which 
they reflect. At the end of each day, at the end of each ongoing process, they would benefit from making 
an auric space for themselves where they are not being influenced so that they can have an opportunity to 
reflect on the experience that they have been through. 

This 33rd gate, Retreat, is the gate of privacy. It is the privacy that says, "I will not be able to remember 
everything unless I am left alone so that I can reflect on this process, and then I will be able to remember 
that and, in remembering that, I'll share my reflection with you. The 33rd gate, at its mystical level, is the 
gate of revelation. The unconscious 33 can speak of an unconscious remembrance that emerges out of the 
unconscious and, as such, can have a deep mystical impact. 

Above the lines, it says: Active withdrawal... This is not passive withdrawal; this is not running away. 
This is not a gate that says, "I want to be alone because I have to hide." This is a gate that says, "I need to 
be alone in order to survive. I need to be alone in order to be clear." ...and the transformation of a weak 
position into a strength. Every abstract person is at their weakest point at the moment that an experience 
ends. This is the weakest point for an abstract person because their temptation is to jump into the next 
experience without reflecting on what they have been through. What happens to so many abstract people 
is that they keep on repeating the same experience and that is not what the abstract process is about. It is 
about having an experience, reflecting on it, recognizing its fundamental worth and then going on to the 
next experience, thus turning a weak position into a strength. The weakest position of the abstract being is 
the moment that the experience is over and it is at that point that privacy, separateness, aloneness and the 
opportunity for reflection is essential. This is a minor point. 

The abstract process being what it is, you can never know anything while you are in it. An abstract person 
can never know anything about the experience while they are in it. That is why the key to the abstract 
process is the 46/29, which begins with the concept that you have made a commitment and, in that 
commitment, you are in the right place at the right time. The 29 makes a commitment and the 46 says, "I 
am in the right place at the right time." As long as you accept that, it does not matter what is going on in 
the experience because you can know nothing about it while you are in it. You can only learn from the 
experience when it is over. So, it is very important for abstract people to reflect on their experience and 
not simply to collect experiences. 

33.1 Avoidance 

The first line, the foundation of this hexagram, says Avoidance., After all, this is the framework of the 
identity of the abstract person: avoid everyone until you have reflected and then you can share your 
remembrance. Then you can offer your witnessing. That is what it is about, offering the witnessing. 

The wisdom in a weak position... ('Weak position' meaning that you finish an experience: that is your 
weakest point.) ... to recognize that survival demands complete withdrawal. Pulling away is the key to the 

nature of Retreat. Retreat is there to build strength and abstract strength is built through reflection. 
Without reflection one can be a fool over and over again. It is okay to be a fool once. If you reflect on it 
and understand the nature of what you have experienced, you don't have to be the fool the second time. 

Mars in detriment. Where courage is just plain foolishness. This is a person that will not reflect but jump 
to the next thing. Or, in the sense that it is the identity out of the throat, "I will not reflect on my 
experience and remember it in depth. I will simply babble it all out the moment that it is over." The 
moment that the experience is over, the abstract person does not know anything about it. Whatever they 
babble out will only be an aspect of the wave that they have been through, and not the proper reflection. 

In the white book: Retreating when one realizes that one is in a weak position. Again, at the end of the 
experience is the weakest point. On the other side: Unable to retreat when overwhelmed by stimulation. 
This is the key to that. The abstract person that is pulled from one experience immediately to the next, this 
is always going to be a problem for them. When you are an abstract person and you are in the middle of a 
process and, all of a sudden, there is an emergency, if you are drawn away, in that moment, from what 
you are doing, you lose the value of everything that you have been doing because you won't be able to 
reflect on it. If you can't reflect on it when the experience is over, you will not remember it. You will not 
be able to bring out of that the necessary qualities for the remembrance. 

In the relationship between the hexagram and the genetic codon structure, we have three genetic codons 
that are called stop codons. Stop codons literally are the punctuation points at the end of a genetic 
expression. Two of the genetic stop codons are in the abstract process in the throat. We will see in the 
56th gate the abstract voice that says, "I believe" or "I don't believe". This is a stop codon. In other words, 
the conceptual idea is nothing that goes any further than its capacity to be able to express and share it. The 
33rd hexagram is a stop codon and so is the 12. Here, the process comes to an end when the reflection is 
complete. We saw that the introspection of the first line is the recognition of the value of privacy and its 
power, because one can grow in that. 

33.2 Surrender 

When you get to the second line, you get to a projected field and you get to somebody who projects 
outwards that they are private. They are projecting outwards that they are the reflecting ones. They are 
projecting outwards that they are the ones that remember. Remember the nature of the paper tiger. They 
may or may not remember; they may or may not enjoy their privacy. All of these things are possibilities 
in their process. 

Jupiter exalted. The recognition that surrender to superior forces... ('Superior forces' are anything that is 
going to pull you into a new experience. After all, the abstract being is trapped by the experiential wheel. 
These are people that are really on the wheel. There is this constant pressure on them to enter into another 
experience.) ...can be an opportunity to expand one's own strength and eventually triumph. In other 
words, it is better to wait and avoid a temptation and build up one's reflective capacity, and that may lead 
to success in the future. 

In the white book: Embracing powerful forces in order to lay the foundation for future success. Because 
this is a projected field, you have people who are saying "Leave me alone," but they do not necessarily 
know why. They know that they need to be left alone at the end of an experience, but it is not like they are 
actually using that to get into a deep reflective process. They may or they may not. What they recognize 
genetically is that it is better for them to be apart, to have this aloneness and the opportunity to be separate 
than it is to get hooked up into another experience. This is the genetic structure in that. Remember, this is 
a stop codon saying, "Okay, no more." These are people that can be very withdrawn, without that 

necessarily being an advantage. These are the people that can complain about having to be alone, for 
example. 

Neptune in detriment. Unlike the reasoned and calculated surrender above, the deeper and personal 
surrender. The feeling that one's original position was a delusion and the impressionability that makes 
might right. In the white book: A public embrace of powerful forces and a private resentment of their 
power. There is a deep resentment when one cannot complete one's process and, the moment that 
powerful forces are there and pulling on you to remember, if you are not clear (in this line we are dealing 
with projection), you can really feel like, "Oh, that whole experience was a waste." Imagine what this is 
like for somebody who is going through an experience and, when they finish that experience, before they 
really have a chance to reflect on it in order to see what its value really was, they get pulled by other 
forces; they get pulled to remember and share their witnessing. What they say does not carry the clarity of 
their experience. 

In that moment, by not having impact on those that are pulling that out, they can feel like, "Well, that 
whole experience was a waste because I did not really get to see what it was. My reflection on that is not 
of value," and they put that out into the world and get smashed for that by the outside because they are not 
paying any attention to it. 

This is all about the process of development, of being able to project these things outwards, but every 
time that you have a second line, you always have to see that you are going to be challenged in that 
process. Anybody who is projecting out is going to meet a very strong challenge coming back at them. 
The 33rd gate, because it is the gate of privacy, is the gate of being closed in, in that sense. That is, being 
closed in a room, or somebody that is forced to go into retreat by being sent to jail or by ending up in a 
monastery, or retreat through illness and states of paralysis. In the second line, you see people that are 
locking themselves up in a room and, when you get to the fifth line, you can see that the outside world 
will lock you up in the room. 

33.3 Spirit 

With the third line, we reach the end of the lower trigram process. Here the bond that is being made and 
broken is the bond of privacy. These are people that will naturally seek out their privacy, that is part of 
their process, but it will not be like the second line which is just focused on that. In the third line, there is 
the beginning of the recognition that there is the other. It is the beginning of that process. It is not really 
there until the fourth line. In the capacity to adapt is the recognition that one has to come out of the 
privacy when it cannot just be held back inside. 

The attitude that turns retreat into victory. The victory comes after the reflection. This is the whole 
beauty. The weakest point is at the end of the experience. The power comes after the reflection and then 
the real value of the remembrance can bring about victory, the completion of this process. 

Jupiter exalted. The responsible and principled retreat based on preservation, but with the determination 
to persevere. In other words, "Yes, leave me alone now. I have to think about all of this but I'll see you 
tomorrow." This is not "Leave me alone, I never want to see you again." This is the other side of this line 
with Mars in detriment. A lack of responsibility in retreat. The bridge burner. "I have reflected on all of 
this. I never want to have anything to do with you again. It's over." These people go into retreat, reflect 
and break whatever the bond was. This is the kind of person that says "Leave me alone now. I want to go 
home and think. I will see you tomorrow." The next day, they will call you up and say, "I don't want to 
see you anymore, I have thought about it." In other words, they can just simply break the bond at that 
point. 

This line is called Spirit. The spirit that lies within the whole nature of Retreat is that these people are 
essential for us. If these people do not tell us about the experience, we don't learn. So, there is also a part 
of us that is trying to get them out of that retreat so that they share their secrets, their reflections, with us. 
After all, this is a collective gate. There is a lot of pressure on these people to share what it is that they 
have inside of them. 

In the white book: Privacy as a path to success; or A drive for privacy that will cut off its relationships, 
often abruptly. All of this is due to the nature of reflection. These people know that they have to go into 
retreat and they know that they have to reflect, but the moment that the reflection is not positive for them, 
it is very easy for them to break off the contact. These people can be disliked for that. There is the 
moment where they'll cut you off and you don't get access to their remembrance, to their experience, 
anymore. 

33.4 Dignity 

Remember, you are dealing here with a collective channel, a collective process and identity. The 
collective is rooted in sharing and when you get to the upper trigram, you get to the transpersonal lines in 
which they are very much aware that there is a harmonic gate at the other side. The harmonic gate to the 
33 is the 13, the Fellowship of Man, the gate of secrets. There are secrets in the 13 that the 33 can be 
aware of and recognize that it has to get access to these secrets. When it gets access to those secrets 
through reflection, it can then reveal them. The fourth line of the 33 is as close as you come to finding a 
line that is religious. I did not say spiritual and I did not say mystical, I said religious. 

The whole abstract process is rooted in belief and this fourth line, which is about externalization and 
about being onetracked, is called Dignity. A lack of turmoil in retreat. 

Pluto exalted. The underlying faith in resurrection that turns retreat into an opportunity for renewal and 
regeneration. 

This is the kind of retreat where people say, "I have to go and meditate. I have to go and be silent in order 
to be empowered." In that silence or in that retreat, they seek out that power in order for them to feel 
better about what it is that they have gone through as an experience in life. 

But the terminology itself (renewal, regeneration, resurrection, all of these processes), when you get to the 
Neptunian detriment: Without the guiding light of resurrection, the inevitable dissolution that leads to 
degeneration. These people are very fixed on being able to see that what they can reflect on can truly be 
of value. They understand that they have a responsibility, genetically speaking, to be a witness. There is 
an aspect of them (see the resonance to the first line, first principle: avoid the outside) that needs this deep 
reflective process in their life. They will be the kind of people that get involved in all kinds of different 
levels of meditation. 

In terms of the white book: The healthy retreat for regeneration. "I need to get away from everything. I 
need to go through my process and I think things out, and I need to make sense out of my life." This is a 
common attribute for these people. If they can't make sense out of their life, out of that process when they 
are in retreat, unless they have faith, they are going to get depressed. Unless they have faith, they will feel 
like the whole thing is just a waste and they can become very sad people. 

These people really need some cosmic level of hope, even if it is not true, that the time in their aloneness 
is of value for them. They will seek out formulas for that like sitting in a church on Sundays, getting 
down on their knees on Fridays, going up on the Himalayas on any given day. All of these rituals are 

there to go through this process of being separate and at the same time, in stillness, with the hope that, in 
this quietness, somehow life can be resolved. 

33.5 Timing 

You know that the fifth line operates in a wave that we call 'the seducer and the seduced.' So it is all about 
seduction. It is one of the things to recognize about the nature of all fifth lines: they all are deeply related 
to the question of timing. This line personifies that in its name. This is the line of timing. 

The fifth line is always getting projected on. So, in that sense, they are getting projected on that they are 
the seducer, but because of the projection coming from the outside, it does not mean that they are ready to 
fulfill that projection at the time when the projection is there. There is always this pressure of the fifth line 
where there is this projected field on the outside which is trying to pull them into some kind of response 
that they may or may not be ready for. 

If you have a child with the 33.5, you have a parent that says, "Why don't you stay in your room and play 
by yourself and close the door?" It is being projected on that child that he or she needs that privacy and 
that withdrawal. This is a projected field, and a lot of 33.5 children get locked up in their rooms very 
often. It is projected on them that they need to be alone and private. Due to this projection, it is even 
projected on them that they are not really social, or capable of it. 

Timing. Pluto exalted. As important as the timing itself is the ability to keep secret one's intentions until 
the appropriate moment. This is the magic: that remembrance can bring in the right timing. Everything 
about this process is about reflection: going through it and completing it, and only then the capacity to be 
able to act on that and verbalize that, as in this particular case. What that means is that, until the reflection 
is done, you cannot give in to the pressure from the outside. You can't. Only in the right moment, only 
when the reflection is done, then you have the power to universalize that reflection. 

In the white book: The ability to keep one's intentions secret. You keep the secret until you know. In other 
words, the reflective abstract person is always at risk when they try to involve others in that process 
because they do not have their own opportunity to go through it and see it clearly. They can only express 
themselves when they are ready. 

Jupiter in detriment. A tendency to want others to participate in the selection of the timing, which can lead 
to confusion. In the white book: Without a sense for timing, letting others in on the secret prematurely 
with resulting confusion. Let us say that you are reflecting on how you experience your work, day by day, 
and you recognize, as you reflect each day at the end of your work, that you really do not like your job. 
Day by day, each reflection brings you closer to that point where you are really clear about that. "This is 
not a work for me. I have reflected on that. I am clear about that." At the moment that you are really clear, 
you can quit your job, but only at that moment. That is the exalted. 

The detriment works in another way. You have this ongoing process on reflecting about the quality of 
your workplace and you do not like it. Then you start talking to somebody that you work with and you 
say to them, "You know. I don't really like this job and I am really thinking that maybe this is not for me, 
and maybe I should do something else." In that moment of seeking out somebody else's reflection, 
experience or guidance, in that moment anything is possible. That person can have a friend who needs 
your job and can go to the boss and say, "Louise is not happy. She is thinking of quitting." Louise goes 
home that night, goes through her reflective process and realizes, "I really do like my job. I just have bad 
days." She comes into the office the next morning and the boss comes over and says, "You are fired. We 
do not like to work with people who hate their job." Whether this event is good or bad for Louise is open. 
This is not about a moral question. This is simply about mechanics. 

There are going to be these people who will always let others in. They just do. Sometimes that will be 
very confusing and sometimes that confusion will work its way through. It is not about whether this is 
good or bad. It is just about recognizing that that is the mechanic. To recognize that something is a 
mechanic is in order that you can come to grips with accepting yourself. If you are somebody that cannot 
get to the point where you have the right timing and you know that that timing is going to be disturbed by 
others, at least, you can see that that is correct for you. It is not about changing it. It is about recognizing 
what is correct for you. The moment that you recognize that that mechanism is you and correct for you, 
the moment you surrender to that, you will find out what its value is. It is not without value. It is just one 
of many ways in which this reflective process works. 

33.6 Disassociation 

We get to the sixth line, to the transition line. The formula for the sixth line is that they are not necessarily 
going to be fulfilling the potential of the gate. There is something that is of greater importance to them 
because the sixth line is not simply transpersonal in the sense that it understands the harmonic gate; in this 
case it knows the secrets of the other end. It is more than that. It wants to see the whole complete circuit. 
It wants to see that the reflection covers everything, so that, out of that reflection, the proper remembrance 
can be established so that humanity can be guided. After all, this is at the root of what we call history and 
philosophy. All of this information, all of this capacity to be guided by past experience, so much of it is 
rooted here at the end of this abstract process in the 33rd gate. 

We have a line here of Disassociation. The ability to let go. This is a kind of withdrawal in which the 
retreat can be so complete that these people can walk through the world and be totally disconnected from 
it. The nature of reflection can be nothing more than an ongoing personal process because no reflection is 
really of value to the totality unless it can be a reflection that can add to the experience of humanity and 
humanity will accept that as a way to see themselves. 

In the white book: The ability to let go in retreat, to enjoy privacy. These people can enjoy privacy for its 
own sake and feel no pressure to be brought out of their privacy. They can be private all the time. These 
are the kind of people that are private when they are public or when they intimate. They can always be 
private. These are people that will always hold things inside of them because there is no sense in 
revealing what they remember unless it can make a contribution to society. 

We have this funny twist that goes in the abstract. It is very beautiful. When we are looking at the 56.6, at 
the abstract belief process, "I can stimulate you with my belief," we see that it goes to the 31.1 which is 
the gate of Influence, the gate of saying "I lead," or "I do not lead". So it goes from the abstract 56.6 to the 
logical leadership. Here, in the 33.6, the very next line is the 7.1. The 7 and the 31 form the channel of 
logical leadership together. In other words, both aspects of the abstract process, both the mental process 
and its identity, what they really want most of all is that it is just not another idea. That it is just not 
another experience. That it can be of value to guide humanity into the future. 

Human beings always want to be what they want. Logical people want to be able to reflect on the past, 
and abstract people want to be able to project into the future. Here, in this Disassociation, there is the 
capacity to simply just let go of all that because, unless that you have a reflection that is going to guide 
humanity and lead them, it is not worthwhile. 

I am born into a generation that has Pluto in this gate. I have my design Pluto in 33.6, in Disassociation, 
this letting go completely. I lived for three and a half years totally alone and wild without any sense or 
need to go back in. Not only that, but with all the information that was going on inside of me, there was 

no need to share it with anybody because, at that point, it just did not seem to be something to give to 
humanity, not that I was thinking in those terms. 

The reality is that when you get to the sixth line, there is this "Why should I bother? Why should I trust in 
this?" And as we see, the logic is trying to go to the abstract to see that its projection into the future can be 
experienced and recognized for its value and the abstract wants to project into the future and wants 
everybody to know that its experience can really be of value to the collective. This is this twist that goes 
on in the collective process. 

Every sixth line carries within it what some people call a potential for satori, or transcendence. We have 
many words for that. All sixth lines are about that. What that really means is that the sixth line has much 
tougher criteria for living out its nature than the other lines. In other words, it is much more concerned 
with larger principles. As such, it can end up being transcendent, wise and of value to society as a whole. 
But, being what it is, the vast majority of human beings never really get to live out their sixth lines. They 
tend to be the opposite of what the hexagram says. An enormous amount of arrogance is projected onto 
people with sixth lines from the outside. You can see that in the 44.6, in the nature of aloofness. There is 
this sense that they are not really participating. 

If you hook into somebody's sixth line in an electro-magnetic connection, it is not like hooking into any of 
the other lines. You do not even know if they are really responding to you. They may. They may not. It 
depends on whether the hookup that they get from you can go beyond into many other things. I never 
have seen a design that did not impress me. I am not saying that to be quaint. This is the nature of what it 
is. The fact that we all do not live out what we are is another story. Very few people live out the potential 
that is there in their design. They live out the potential of their conditioning. Not only do they not get an 
opportunity to live out the true nature of the 6, they do not even get to live out themselves first. You can't 
get there anyway. It is quite a process. A 33.6, at the end of their reflection process can say, "Never 
again!" as a kind of value for humanity. 

HEXAGRAM 34 THE POWER OF THE GREAT 

When you from the 14.6 to the first line of the 34, you step into another process, but it is a continuing 
process, in that sense. The 34th gate and the 20, the 40 and the 37, and the 23 and 43 are the three 
oppositions in the zodiac that form definitions in the Rave chart. You are dealing with a high level of 
commonality here. In other words, there is a greater abundance of those six gates because they happen 
more often in the polarity of opposition of Sun/Earth and Nodes. 

This 34th gate of Power is an extremely complex gate; it does not just look for one thing. It has three 
different ways in which it can go and it is a very intense power field. The 34th gate, due to its 
commonality, has a very special value, like the 3rd gate. The 3rd gate tells us about the nature of what it is 
to be alive. 

The nature of confusion and that the transcending of confusion leads to order. This is the nature of life, 
but the 34th gate speaks of the energy for survival itself. It is one thing to be alive, but it is another thing 
to die. The 3 is not there to keep us alive. The 34 is. It is the nature of the 34th gate to enhance our 
survival of individuals. It is literally there to fuel life itself. The power to individuate comes out of the 
34th gate. 

34.1 The Bully 

When you look at any gate, the first line speaks for its nature. The nature of what it is to empower 
survival, the basis and foundation of empowering survival, is to be a bully. Above the lines it says: Power 
is only great when its display or use serves the common good. 'Its display...' Power people never have to 
use their power all the time; they can show it. If you watch animals confronting each other because they 
have a conflict over territory, they put on an incredible show. Listen to two cats arguing over who belongs 
in the backyard. This is an incredible performance of display. There is no real power being used. The 
power is secondary. Someone who has the 34th gate in an undefined sacral center is not the kind person 
that will be able to push their power out all the time. 

The Bully. The indiscriminate use of power. Saturn exalted. The less negative, the resort to power as a 
manifestation of frustration. To stay alive is a frustrating process because it is an ongoing, moment by 
moment, day by day process. You can have a job and feed yourself today, but if you do not go to work the 
next day then you give all that up. How will you survive? It is an ongoing process of releasing that power. 

Pluto in detriment. The comeuppance that is the inevitable destiny of the bully. In order to survive you 
have to be able to show your power. If you don't do that, you will only stay alive out of the generosity or 
kindness of others. Don't bet on it. You have to live out your own power to stay alive. 

The energy to display power as a response to frustration. The frustration is all about: "Don't get in the way 
of my survivall" We are here to be able to survive alone. That is our nature. It doesn't matter whether you 
have the 34th gate or not. You get it all the time from other people or transits. 

The ever present risk of retaliation to power displays. This line does not say: use power. This is the 
indiscriminate display of power. It is not the use of power. The bully does not really have to do anything 
to you other than scare you. The 34. 1 realizes that it has this power and it knows that if it does not show 
this power, it will be difficult for it to stay alive. This is the whole thing for human beings to understand. I 
meet so many people who, through conditioning, have been made weak. I am a pure individual and I ride 
this wave of how wonderful it is to be empowered and alone in the survival of life. How difficult it is for 
people to show their power. How difficult it is for them to see that there is somebody in their life that isn't 

good for them and they do not have the power to defend their survival and say, "Please, I cannot survive 
with you." People who have jobs that they hate and do not have the power to say, "I cannot do this. This 
is not for me." 

The 34th gate goes to the 57. It goes to the creation of the archetype for survival, to be alive as a human 
being. The fear of the 57th gate is the fear of tomorrow, the fear of consequences, the fear of what can 
happen to us. It is so important to understand that the very basis of power is display. In the animal world, 
display works most of the time and conflict is generally avoided and survival is ensured. Somebody 
usually backs down and it is over. This is the beginning of the use of power. It is not about violence. It is 
about the display of one's power to survive on one's own. After all, this is individual. 

The 34 and the 27 are the only gates of the sacral center that are pointed at a functional awareness. As we 
go through the lines of the 34, -)lease understand that there are so many different variations of this. The 
34 connected to the 20 is always displaying heir power. This is part of their doing. The 34 connected to 
the 10 has a totally different process because it has to do with the empowerment of their identity. The 34 
and the 57 is another process. 

So again, we are looking at the basis of this as energies, but how it actually works out in someone's chart 
is dependent on what is the nature of their integration system and how is this working in that 
configuration, not simply what it is in the gate itself because again, there are so many different qualities at 
work. When the 34 is connected to the 57, the power is aware. An aware bully is very different from an 
unaware bully. The awareness about what it takes to survive. "I know what it takes to survive," is 
different from the blind need to survive. Please understand that you have to take into consideration the 
way it operates in the actual design. 

34.2 Momentum 

When you come to the second line, they project outwards. The first line is not what you think. The first 
line is not the obvious bully. Like all first lines, they can be hidden bullies and if you scratch them the 
wrong way, you will see a display of power. The second line is always projecting out this power. "I have 
the power to survive." In the black book, this is all about victory. It is not about winning anything. It is 
about "I can do it. I can survive. I can be my archetype. I can follow my convictions. I can do what I want 
to do." I mentioned all the other gates in that statement. 

Momentum. Mars exalted. The ability when victory is in sight not to lose perspective. Venus in detriment. 
A tendency to be emotionally carried away by the smell of victory. "My power is bringing me to the 
capacity to survive. I want to use more power." Because momentum is a projected field, these people can 
really crumble. They look enormously powerful because they project out all this power, when underneath 
they are very insecure and very frightened. They need to know that the victory is there, otherwise they fall 
apart. 

The power that grows when victory is insight; or The power for growth limited by impatience. This is the 
negative side. The whole process of being a second line is that you don't really know what is there and 
you have to deal with the consequences of your actions all the time because you cite going to be found 
out. What people say about the 34.2 is, "Their bark is worse than their bite." They bark a lot but they don't 
always bite. 

34.3 Machismo 

We saw that the first line knows that it has power and that it may have to use its power to protect itself to 
survive. Ve know that the second line projects out this power and can be found to be weak inside, a paper 

tiger. When you get to the third line you get to Machismo. You get to the real display of power. 
Remember something about the nature of the third line: it is the adaptive line. It is preparing the ground 
for the transpersonal process. It knows that there is something else at work. Because it is trial and error, it 
will make mistakes in its display of power. 

The indiscriminate display of power. Saturn exalted. The great malefic, where machismo unfortunately is 
invariably backed up by natural and uncontrived power. In the white book: The display of power that 
defines any role. Understand what that is all about. The third line is saying, "I cannot be a surviving 
human being unless power display is part of my role. " These people will look for ways in which they can 
display their power in life to enhance their survival success. In other words, "I will not succeed as a 
businessman unless I am really powerful and display my power." "I will not succeed as a lover until I beat 
up my woman." This is the need to display power in any role to guarantee the survival of their way and 
their conviction. There is a great deal of violence that can come out of this line because it is about trial 
and error. There is a lot of battering that goes on. Children, couples. It is the display of power and, unless 
the mistakes become part of an awareness process, every role gets imbued with this. 

Mercury in detriment. A reasoned and calculated display. The communication of disinformation. "I will 
cut your throat unless you pay your bill." That is not necessarily true, but it frightens. The person that is 
saying that to you is using that power in their role because they will not be able to feed themselves unless 
they get that bill back and they have no way of asking nicely. They have to display their power. It may 
not be true. They may not come and cut your throat but ... pay them, will you? 

It is so easy to take that description and say. "Terriblel" It is not true. There are certain roles that require 
that kind of display of power. Nothing can be done about that. That is the nature of being human after all. 
When push becomes shove, you'd better be ready. This is a competitive field. We are here to survive and 
there are all kinds of competition for survival in the world, on all kinds of levels and the reality is that 
certain roles need to have this power. Otherwise, you can never get to the sixth line, its resonance, and 
recognize what common sense is in terms of what power is really for. Trial and error is a learning process. 

34.4 Triumph 

When you get to the upper trigram, you get to the line of externalization. There is no question anymore 
that the power is there and they know it. They know that they have to put that power out across the 
channel. In this case, there are three channels. It is putting its power out in a very strong way. This line is 
called Triumph. The freedom in absolute victory to unlimited use of power. Victory in this is being left 
alone. Victory is being allowed to survive out of your own power and not being interfered with, not being 
conditioned away from your individual responsibility for survival. 

In the white book: The inherent confidence to use power subtly. These people are fixed in showing their 
power. They show less power the less they are interfered with. If you do not get in their way, you think 
that they are very nice. If you get in their way, they are nasty. If you do not get in their way, they get more 
and more confident as they grow older and these are the kind of people that have a great reservoir of 
power but they do not use it in an uncomfortable way. It is subtle; they know how to manage it. 

If that confidence is broken, and most of the time that happens already early in childhood, the moment 
that there is interference, you get this abuse of power. Then they are pushing harder and harder with their 
power, in order to be able to get that triumph they know is inherently their right. This is also a gate that 
can lead to all kinds of problems. Violence is something that can also be there in the detriment of the 
fourth line. There is always the potential for abuse because people refuse to get out of the way. These are 
people that are pushed out of the way, finally, in that display of power. 

Ego gratification in the unrestrained use of power with impunity, inevitably leading to abuse. This is very 
important, for example, in children coming into the world. We have a whole generation that has been born 
with this Pluto transit. We have a whole generation of children that carry each of these lines, millions of 
them in the world now. They will come into their maturity in the new century. It is very important to be 
clear about that if you have a fourth line child in your life; you have to encourage their confidence by 
allowing them to express their individual process. If you do not encourage that confidence, you will have 
a child that will have all kinds of problems. 

By the way, the abuse in this can be brought out by a parent as a mirror. The parent says, "No, we do not 
do it your way," and they beat the child. You get the whole thing reflected back on the child. It is very 
important to keep in mind whenever you are looking at long term transits, that every day and every 
moment, there are thousands and thousands of children coming into the world with that configuration. 
This knowledge is very important for raising these chile ren so that we have a generation of children who 
have great power (Pluto in 34) with the capacity to work this out ause they have not had negative, better 
unaware, conditioning in their process. 

34.5 Annihilation 

f line is the nature of the hexagram and the fifth line is the way the world looks at it. Everybody projects 
onto thos who carry the 34.5 that they have power. Due to that, they are rarely interfered with. The line 
says Annihilation. The way in which we see that power at its universal level is that it eliminates 
everything. For some people, that is a frightening term. The total annihilation of resistance. It comes out 
of the projection. I have the 57.5 and I have three parts of the integration but I do not have the 34. When I 
was in public school, there was a bunch of guys beating up weaker guys, a typical male trip, but they 
never bothered me. I did not have to do anything. I did not have to put on any scene. The fifth line always 
gets a projection. These people are being projected on as having so much power that you would not want 
to interfere with them because you will get burnt. Like the second line, it can be a paper tiger. Nobody is 
really sure because they are projecting onto that power. 

The resistance to release power other than when necessary. Because the power is already projected on 
them, they do not have to let it out all the time, only when there is interference. This is the kind of person 
where, once they use their power, it enhances their power reputation a thousand times. By the way, if they 
blow it, they really lose. 

The discomfort with the need to always release power. This is something that becomes very difficult for 
the fifth line. This sense of "No matter how powerful I am, no matter how much they project on me that I 
have the power, there will always be some force that will take it away from me by interfering with me." 
You see that, for example, in the paranoia of dictatorships. Everybody is projecting on the dictator that he 
has all of this power, but at the same time there can be a coup d'etat going on underneath. They are aware 
of that and there is a part of them that says, "All right, I have to keep on maintaining the power," and they 
get tired of being in control all the time, of having to control other people to keep them from interfering 
with them. 

34.6 Common sense 

When you get to sixth line, you get to the end of the whole process. If you look at the 20.6, you have the 
line of Wisdom. If you look at the 10.6, you have the line of the Role Model. If you look at the 57.6, you 
have Utilization, all of which talks about the fact there is much more involved in this life than just the 
release of power. These people learn it very early. Like all sixth lines, they are looking to the whole 
circuitry, and individuality is enormously complex. 

Common sense. Knowing when enough is enough. Earth exalted. The good sense when having bitten off 
more than one can chew to spit part of it out. The classic story: You have somebody who gets in your way 
and you are a power person. You want them out of your way and you push them out of your way; you 
punish them in some way. But it does not stop. They still come back. They are still determined to get in 
your way. There is this sense of: "How many times do I have to hit them? How often do I have to put 
them in their place?" You take on this responsibility. You bite into this responsibility of maintaining your 
power so that you can survive, and then you discover, "Oh". 

One of my dogs went out and killed some chickens from my neighbor so I put my dog on a chain for 
about six hours. She was in deep psychic pain about that treatment. Then I realized what I was doing and I 
took her off the chain. My neighbor came back soon afterwards to tell me that my dog was wandering 
around. "If you do not like it, shoot her. I will not continue to use this power because that is not what it is 
all about. There must be another way." 

The restriction of the release of power when one does not have the strength to maintain it. Why keep on 
dealing with all of this? Very often 34.6 people just withdraw. They pull their power away and they 
simply say, "Enough is enough. I do not want to be like this. I do not just want to be able to survive by 
using my power in relationship to others because I know there is much more." You can thank the stars 
that we have a sixth line and its resonance in the third line. This is what people call the beginning of our 
idealism, the beginning of the understanding that we are more than jysf pn animal. There is something 
else than just maintaining our survival. There has to be. 

The lack of restrictions that can sap one's strength. The moment this kind of person constantly gets 
involved in this display of power, they just fall apart. They get very depressed. It is not what they want. 
They see that power is essential but not that it has to be constantly used against somebody else. 
Somehow, there has to be a way, (the example, the Role Model/, in which that power can be used in a 
healthy fashion. It is not enough that it is there. There has to be much more. It goes to the 9.1, which is 
also in the sacral center. As we go around this wheel, we will see how all of these things are deeply 
related to each other. 

HEXAGRAM 35 PROGRESS 

The 35th gate is the gate of life. Out of that gate we have the human experiential way. Rather than having 
a gate that is opened up to a non-motor splenic system (the 16), we have a gate that opens up to the solar 
plex system and its incredible wave and power. 

The 35th gate is not interested in finding out where the energy is. The energy is always going to be there 
at one level or another. They are always going to meet it whether it is defined or not because that energy 
is only one step away. The 35th gate is a primary gate of action. Due to that, there is very little restriction 
on it. 

The 16 and the 35 and their respective channels, are about talent. Logical talent is about repetition and the 
development of mastery. Abstract talent comes through experience. You play 25 different instruments in 
your life because you can never stay with any of them because your life is full of change and instability. 
But at the end of your career, somebody comes to you and says: "What kind of musical instrument do you 
think I should play?" The experiential person has a background, has a talent from experience, to be able to 
give advice. 

The 35th gate is also a gate that is deeply creative, but it is not creative in the sense of repetition and not 
in the sense of being collective in the need for energy. It is creative in its experiential possibilities. 

Above the lines, it says: By design, progress cannot exist in a vacuum and is dependant on interaction. All 
change is dependent on getting access to the solar plex energy, but progress is the nature of this gate. In 
other words, this is the great changing gate. It does not say, "I experiment," it says, "I feel," and usually, 
"I feel like a change." This 'usually' is the conditioning factor. If they do not repeat, they stay healthy. 
They go through the'experience, but'diily once. You make love in a canoe. You don't have to do that 
twice. You do it once, you get the experience and you always know what it is like to make love in a 
canoe. Don't do it a second time because you may drown. If you survive the first time, hold on to the 
experience; put it away in your memory and go on to another kind of experience. 

35.1 Humility 

The first line, the foundation, is saying Humility. The ability to accept rejection. This is the core of the 
change process, of the feeling process: the ability to accept rejection. 

In this acceptance of rejection, you have Venus exalted. The artist that accepts rejection as part of the 
process. You have the word 'artist' here. At the foundation of the experiential way of life is a deep 
recognition that the experiential path is an artistic path. In other words, to live is also an art. How you live 
is an art. How you experience and how you move through experience, is an art. This is a collective 
process and, as such, it goes up and down on the emotional wave and so there always will be this 
dilemma. 

The Neptunian side is: A self destructive reaction to rejection. Loss of worth. In the white book: 
Acceptance of change and rejection as part of the process. This is an ongoing process. Change comes and 
you have to go through a process where the crisis is initiated and, in that crisis, you have to let go of what 
you were doing and go on to the next thing. There are those that are rejected. There is yourself who can 
be rejected because you can bring out that very stimulus in other people. 

On the other side, you have Change and rejection as humiliation. In the artistic sense of the word, what 
this is really saying is that, like the 16.6, what it is looking for is how is the logic going to feel in life 
itself? "I want to be able to feel it. It is not enough just to know what the mathematics of the skill is. I 

want to be able to feel it. I want art and life to be one." Art and life to be one is a deep drive in these 
people. Of course, there is no way in which the abstract creative person can develop unless they go 
through all kinds of change and crisis. Otherwise, they will never have enough experience collected in 
their process, which means that they have to accept rejection and change until finally what they feel and 
how they feel carries with it creative power. 

35.2 Creative block 

When we come to the second line, we come to projection. We saw with the 16.2 that what is projected 
outwards is this Cynicism. When you come over here to the abstract process, what it projects out is 
boredom. This is the great line of boredom. You have to recognize about the nature of this gate, what it 
represents, is that 'progress cannot exist in a vacuum'. So, the vacuum is always there and that means that 
change and that movement through the experiential way is dependent on getting access to the solar plex 
wave. There is always this sense of vacuum the moment that the wave is not there because there is no 
possibility to be able to manifest. 

This line of boredom is called Creative block. Lack of inspiration which stops progress. Venus exalted. 
Attunement with the vagaries of the muse and the recognition that creativity is energy that ebbs and 
flows. The Moon in detriment. The need to take action, however mundane, to overcome the feeling of 
emptiness. The actions being uninspired do not further progress. These are people that get bored. They do 
not accept that they have to wait for the energy to come to them. They won't know that until they are in 
the resonance to the fifth line, which always knows because it gets projected on. It is the paper tiger. In 
not being able to accept that they have to wait is this sense of boredom, of being locked away from having 
any progression. And on the other side, because of the boredom, the moment that any kind of energy is 
available, they jump to fill up the empty space and it does not make them feel good. These people get into 
a lot of unfortunate collective problems because they jump simply because they have been waiting to 
jump. The moment they get the energy, they go. 

Creativity and the muse will always come and go. It is easy to say that to 35.2's. It does not mean that 
they are going to accept it, like all information. 

The other side of that is: The need for change and the fear of stasis. This gate is all about change, after all. 
There is this deep need for change and there is this fear that, if the energy is not there, they can't do 
anything and that life is horrible. These people can really suffer from this creative block and, because of 
that, they can get into a lot of trouble. 

35.3 Collaboration 

If you want to have a wild and incredible crisis, lots of chaos, enormous turmoil and jump around all over 
the place psychically, than hang out with a 35.3 because that is what you will get. Because it is the end of 
the lower trigram process, it is not yet transpersonal and yet, it is a gate of adaptation. What is built into 
this is Collaboration. This is the blind openness to the emotional wave. 

The whole is greater than the sum of its parts. Very beautiful, very nice, this is a wonderful line. Jupiter 
exalted. Benefic encouragement of others that expands personal as well as communal progress. That 
sounds very nice. It is true. They will give anybody with a defined emotion access to their Throat. It does 
not matter, what it is. They will eventually learn, of course. When they get older, if they survive, they'll 
know not to do that so much. But nonetheless, this is something that they can only learn from experience 
through trial and error. So they go through a lot of messy stuff when they are young. 

On the other side of this, Sun in detriment. The need to be the center that ignores the importance of 
others. "I have to have the experience. I need to have this crisis. I need to check this out. I don't care what 
your problem is in it. I have to go through this process." This line is fixed on the change process. One of 
the things to recognize for these people, for anybody that has the feeling stream that goes from the 41 to 
the 35, is that change is natural. Without change, they can't be healthy. Without crisis, they can't move on 
to the next thing. Their crisis is always a question of inexperience. It is all about getting experience. This 
third line runs into all kinds of experiences. 

The ability to bring progressive change into others' lives. By the way, they do because they bring wild 
crises. Because they bring the depth of crisis, whoever gets that crisis really does learn something and 
there is a progress. That is not about bad or good. They can be very exciting people to be around. I don't 
know if you want them in your bedroom every night but they are very exciting people. 

On the other side we have: The need to be the center for progress. They are the ones that are manifesting 
out of the throat. They are the ones that need to be the center of that process, but all of this is simply about 
them blindly being open to the change and feeling process. To manifest this energy makes them feel 
good. They make a lot of mistakes along their way. 

35.4 Hunger 

The third and the fourth lines have a lot of similarities but there is a major difference between them: the 
third line is always open to the solar plex center and always open to the experience but, of course, because 
it does not really understand the other side, it makes a lot of mistakes since it is not always connected to 
the right kind of energy to fulfill that experience properly. When you get to the fourth line, 
externalization, you get to the capacity to recognize what is on the other side. It is a transpersonal line. It 
is called Hunger. 

The whole fixing and direction of this energy is: The insatiable appetite for progress. These people 
constantly need change. Not only that, but they constantly generate the change mechanism because they 
know exactly who carries the emotional energy on the other side. These people can be deep manipulators 
of others in the sense that they recognize who are the emotional people and who they can take that energy 
from and bring it through so that they can get the experience they need. 

Moon exalted. Less severe. Symbolized by the phases of the Moon, the drive may be obsessive when the 
Moon is full, but like the fading of the Moon, the obsession abates. The Moon describes the emotional 
wave. What this is really saying is: it takes a lifetime. There is no short route. Mastery in the logic sense 
takes a lifetime to reward. Mastery in the abstract sense, experiential mastery, takes a lifetime of 
experiences before there is a depth to that experience so that you can share the value of it with others. 
They are people that control the change mechanism and, because of that, they can take advantage of 
emotional people because they can use their energy to manifest the crisis and change that they need. 
Because of that, they can be very unfair to those people. Remember that the collective process is not 
personal. A lot of people get hurt here. This is a channel that is deeply sexual. A lot of people get hurt 
here because somebody wants to make love to a redhead and the redhead thinks it is because they love 
them, but it is simply an experience. It is just collective and it does not really matter. The person that is 
sitting there with the 35 is just orchestrating that "I feel like" and can take advantage of that person that 
has the energy and then be very cold to them afterwards because the collective experience is over. 

In the white book: Change for change's sake. The drive lessens with age; or The drive for progress that 
will ultimately step on toes and lead to recriminations. These people will ultimately run into crisis 
themselves because they will have people in their lives who will often feel abused by them. Of course, in 

those kinds of situations, they will get the emotional crisis and, depending on where the wave is, how 
bright and burning that crisis will be. 

35.5 Altruism 

The fifth line always tells you how the world projects onto the gate. The world projects onto this gate as a 
gate of experience. The 36th gate is the gate of inexperience and the 35 is the gate of experience. So,

they will share that experience with me, so I can also get it." So it is the 35.5 that is getting this projected 
onto them all the time. They are the ones that have the experience: we project that onto them and then 
they come and hook into it. 

It is called Altruism. The sacr!Rce of personal for communal progress. These are people that have all the 
pressure coming from the outside to bring this outlet of experience to them. Again, like all fifth lines, 
when they are young, all this pressure is being put on them to be the outlet while they themselves do not 
necessarily know the depth yet of what they are themselves. 

Mercury exalted. The principles of interaction and harmony communicated successfully for the benefit of 
the whole. This is their role in life, to open up the way for experience to others. By the way, because it is 
a fifth line and because it is all projected on them, they can be quite hesitant later in life to provide that. 
You can get a taste of that hesitancy in the detriment underneath, which says: Though altruistic and 
cooperative in general, a personal regret that in interaction a greater personal expansion has been lost. 
This is very much like the 16.5. "Yes, I can do this for all the others but I am only giving them the 
experience I already have. What about the new experiences that I need?" 

One of the things that are very boring for this fifth line (remember that the second line, the resonance 
below, is the line of boredom) is that they have all these people that keep on coming to them for that one 
experience they have had, locking them into repeating that very experience for the others when they

is always under enormous pressure because it is under the pressure of the solar plex system. So often, for 
example, people with the fifth line are being projected on when they are young and they may not have the 
experience in whatever that thing is at all. Because it is being projected on them and because they are 
connected to the wave, they take on that role of guiding the experience. They can have quite a crisis in all 
that. That is part of the process of these gates pointed at the solar plex. They are always open to this 
unpredictable and very powerful motor. 

35.6 Rectification 

When you get to the sixth line, this line is very clear. When you go from the 35.6 to the very next 
hexagram you will get to the 45, which is the only possessive gate that exists. It is the only pure 
possessive gate that manifests. It is a voice that says, "I have," or "I don't have," and the 35.6, when it gets 
to the end of that process, says, "What is the point of just another experience? What do I have from that 
experience?" So, here we find an aspect in which the only thing that is important is, "Is that experience 
going to have a corrective value in it, that by doing this experience, or going through it, I really do get 
something other than the experience itself?" 

The 35 is a gate of expectation and the 16 is a gate of identification. The 35 is always saying, "If I do this 
and that, I am going to get that. When you get to the sixth line, it says "I have done this and that, but I did 
not get anything except this and that." The sixth line is saying, "What can I get from that experience? 
What do I have from that experience? Is it really going to be worthwhile? What am I actually getting out 
of that experience?" 

Rectification. The energy to correct. Saturn exalted. The process of crystallization coupled with ambition 
that assures timely and effective correction. In the white book: Progressive change that results from 
correction. They will only get into that change if they see that this is a corrective process. I know so many 
abstract people for whom, after going through all their crises, the only new experience that they were 
interested in is a guru or a therapist so that they can go through a new experience that could be corrective 
for them. By the way, that is not saying that it was, but nonetheless, it is the kind of thing that the 35.6 is 
looking for. "I want an experience that is of value to me, so that, at the end of that experience, I have 
really learned something that is going to add to the quality of my life." 

Mars in detriment. A destructive tendency that in its personal application may be the necessary severity to 
ensure correction, but when applied generally will meet with resistance and tend to reinforce rather than 
rectify situations. "No, I am not just going to do that with you. Sorry, I am not interested in doing that 
because I want to do something that will give me something at the end, rather than just having a good 
time. " It is not about whether it will feel okay to do the experience. What is it going to deliver? 

Correction which brings change through severity and even destruction, and will always meet resistance. 
These people can be very heavy because what they are saying is, "Yeah, but if we will work with this 
energy, we will do something that is deep. We will do something important, something that is really 
going to change us. We will do something that will really bring a reward." This is a very difficult thing. 
One of the things to recognize about this sixth line is that they need to know what they have and what 
they don't have. Otherwise, they will have no peace. An example for the heaviness of this kind of 
emotional correction is in therapy, when you have somebody that is screaming in your face in order to get 
you into a different state. 

HEXAGRAM 36 DARKENING OF THE LIGHT 

We come to the Darkening of the Light, to the 36th hexagram. We come to the beginning of our look at 
possibility gates. This is the possibility to release the emotional energy, the emotional wave. The 36th 
hexagram is by far the most powerful wave-releaser that we have. It has a direct access to the throat: the 
channel of Transitoriness, the design of a Jack of all trades, the design of the experiential way, the design 
of gaining experience. 

This is all about the experiential path and this hexagram is enormously powerful in that. When people see 
that it is the gate of crisis, the thing to recognize is the nature of this gate and why there is crisis there. 

This is gate of inexperience. It has been initiated by the 41st hexagram, which initiates the fantasy, the 
beginning of a possible new experience. It finally gets into the solar plex system in the 30 and there, it 
becomes a feeling and a yearning to be able to fulfill the nature of that feeling. When it gets to the 36, that 
feeling is fully conceptualized in the emotional sense of the word. What is there is the readiness, the 
depth, if you will. It is the mirror of the 48 (to attempt the experience and the deep frustration) and it is 
dependent on the presence of the 35 to release it, which puts the 35 under enormous pressure. 

This is the human way. Because it is the gate of inexperience, what happens is that, regardless of what the 
experience is going to be, there is always a point of crisis, maybe a tiny crisis, maybe a huge crisis, but 
inexperience always leads to that. You can't help but make mistakes when you have never tried something 
before. You have to be very lucky to avoid that. In that sense, this is the nature of crisis here. 

The awareness and power to generate a feeling or not: this is the energy to generate a feeling, to generate 
it outwards to drive an experience. In sexual terms, this is the gate of sexual penetration. This is the gate 
where you have to do it. By the time you get to the 36, you have to do it, whatever the experience is. You 
have all this energy built up in you so that you are prepared for it at any given moment. The change can 
be so sudden, in that sense. 

This awareness possibility is the hunger wave of hope and pain. Here, the frustration is very powerful. I 
must penetrate this experience. I must have this experience. This is the energy that is there and, of course, 
when you are hopeful it is like "Yes, I get it." When you are full of pain it is, "Why can't I get it?" and the 
frustration that comes with that. What usually happens is that what you can't get from one source, you 
usually give to somebody else. It is not personal after all. This is the classic story of someone who is full 
of desire and they go looking for their lover and their lover is not home, and they find another one in the 
bar. This is strictly impersonal. This is simply about living out the experience. If there is nobody there for 
that experience, there will be someone else. That is why crisis is so common in this. It is not personal; it 
just pops out all the time. 

Keep in mind that the 36 is exactly opposite the 6, which generates the motor, and the 36 is its mirror. 
Nothing generates a wave like the 36. It is quite an expressive thing to see it in motion. 

36.1 Resistance 

When you come to the first line, you come to the foundation and the line of introspection. More than 
anything else, all first lines, if you look at them, are very clear about describing the intrinsic nature of the 
gate. 

Above the lines it says: The rule of cycles in which decline is a natural but not enduring stage. 'Decline,' 
in this sense, is the limitation of the inexperience. After all, these people are of enormous value to us. On 
the logical side, we see that we cannot have solutions without experimentation. Here, we cannot make 

sense out of life unless we've had enough experience. It is all about getting the experience. It is 
impersonal and sometimes it can be very painful, but it is part of our human way. 

The first line is called Resistance. Mars exalted. The energy and determination to persevere in the face of 
opposition. The 'opposition' is the limitation. They are looking for the 35. Jupiter in detriment. An over- 
principled resistance that rather than being selective in resistance and thus less at risk, will maintain 
normal patterns and incur opposition. 

In the Book of Letters, you can see how it moves both sides. On one side you have: The emotional power 
to handle crisis. The 36th gate is about that. These people always handle their crisis. It is the other that has 
problems with the crisis. They both have a crisis, but the 36th gate cruises through it and the other person 
has a shattering experience. It is very good for them. By the way, it is an ancient end-of-the -wheel gate. It 
carries a lot of wisdom in that experience. So, every time you get shattered in crisis, there is something to 
be learned. There is a new birth that can take place. 

By the very nature of the hexagram, they are equipped to handle the crisis, but on the other side: A 
resistance to change that will always bring crisis. On the other side, they realize how much that crisis 
causes havoc. The people with the 36th gate that are part of my life are so aware of how much crisis they 
have brought. They know that. There is a part of them that says, "I really did not have to do this thing 
because I am sure that it will lead to problems. Better I leave this." You can't do that until you have 
reached your midlife point. There are only few exceptions. After all, the 35/36 is a mirror of the 16/48, 
and they are both about talent and talent takes time. In the logical process, it takes repetition and depth, 
and in the abstract process, it takes a great deal of experience and fortitude to survive the crises and keep 
on going on in the experiential way. Slowly in their lives, they begin to recognize that not only do they go 
through crisis, but they can generate a great deal of crisis. Later in life, they become much more selective. 
This is the maturing process that is built into this hexagram. 

Remember that it is the last hexagram in the wheel before you come to the 25, the alpha and the omega. It 
is both Pisces and Aries. So, the 36 is completing a process. Without going through crisis and without 
getting to the experience, we do not get to the next experience. We do not start again in the wheel, being 
innocent. The 36.6 will lead to the 25.1, to the beginning of an initiating process, to the innocence, to the 
start of a new cycle. It is a very important energy. It simply means that there are wounded ones along the 
way. 

36.2 Support 

When you come to the second line, you come to the line of projection. These people can be quite 
something. They are not introspective. They can come up to you and out of the blue they say the most 
outrageous things. "I think that you need a good love affair." They are really quite accurate in all that. It is 
very uncomfortable to have them explode on you in their wave. 

Support. Assistance to others in times of decline. They really are. This is not to be misunderstood. They 
are of enormous value but they do cause havoc. They just project out that quality exactly at the moment 
where you really do need it. They can generate a terrible crisis in that moment. They are very good in 
bringing out crisis in other people, which is quite healing. 

Neptune exalted. The application of imagination to schemes which benefit others. In the Book of Letters, 
it says: Feelings that can benefit others in times of crisis. Otherwise, they are a pain in the neck. In times 
of crisis, they are perfect. They will get it out of you. You will go through that experience and you will 
get it. They know that you need the experience. Even if you don't, they know. That is the whole thing to 
understand about this gate. The nature of this gate can be seen in the Espionage line. They have a sense 

of, "Aha, they need it." Here in the second line, this is the beginning of this power, to recognize the 
moment to bring that force into somebody's life. By the way, at the same time, they get their experience. 
They are great in initiating that crisis so that they can get the experience. "I knew that they needed it." It is 
not personal, but it can be deeply beneficial. This is the nature of crisis. The whole abstract process is 
about beginnings and middles and ends, and crisis is just the path along the way. 

When you get to the other side, Moon in detriment. The more practical and individual assistance but only 
when unavoidable and not as a general principal. That is, Selective assistance in times of crisis. They 
don't always do it. They don't always get you at that moment. Sometimes that is very cruel and brings its 
own crisis. Crisis is necessary for us to develop our experience and the moment we stop seeing crisis as 
something that is bad instead of seeing it as something exciting, it is all about making life exciting. I have 
a lot of 35/36 people in my life. They are hilarious. They need that excitement. They have to have it. For 
them, a crisis is great. They crank it up to a higher level and everybody is blowing up around them and 
they are fine afterwards. They tell others "You all needed that. You deserved it. If I did not tell you, 
somebody else would. " 

36.3 Transition 

The third line, the upper part of the lower trigram, is a line of adaptation. It is called Transition. It says: 
The point at which decline has exhausted its power. These people are very different from the second line 
people who can generate the crisis exactly in the moment and the crisis really is for the other person. By 
the time you get to the third line, you are interested in the recognition that you have to deal with what is 
on the other side of the channel. What happens to 36.3 people is that they always get the big crisis. The 
others get a little crisis and they get the big one. 

In the second line, it is the other way around. The third line people have to deal with the phenomena of 
the change that takes place. There are the ones who really meet the change, which affects them more 
deeply than it affects the other. Remember that this channel is social in its very nature, like all collective 
channels. Therefore, this is a social enterprise of sharing. In that sharing, they are the ones that have 
difficulties with the change that takes place. 

Pluto exalted. The ability to establish a new order out of the ashes of the old. That means that the change 
deeply affects them. What they thought they were, what they thought that they felt, they get the crisis 
because, suddenly, they realize that in the adaptation to the other, something totally different has 
happened to them in their experience. Out of that, they have a whole new process to go through. 

Jupiter in detriment. The tendency in renewal to try to assimilate the remains of the old order into the new 
with the risk that it may rise against the new order once it has regained its strength. These people did not 
really want that change, they only wanted the experience and they got something else with it. When you 
make love to someone and they get pregnant, you did not want all that. You just wanted the experience 
and, all of a sudden, they have to deal with it and they end up with the crisis. This is something to keep in 
mind about the nature of the third line. 

Here in the Book of Letters: The emotional depth to endure crisis and embrace change. The change will 
always come for these people. They are forced to adapt. 

The embrace of the change but with feelings that won't let go of the past. Resisting the nature of the 
change. You can hear these people say, "I wish I hadn't done that. Why did they make me do it?" 

36.4 Espionage 

We come to the fourth line and we begin the process of the upper trigram. The fourth line is about 
externalization which has a narrow field to it. It is fixed; it has this one-pointedness about its nature. The 
moment that you get into the upper trigram, you get into the social context. After all, we have a collective 
circuit here which is social by its very nature. Its keynote is to share and, by the time you get to the upper 
trigram, what you are looking towards is the other side. The fourth line is about mastering the nature of 
the other. This line is deeply perceptive of the other. They are interested in getting their change and in 
fulfilling their experience and their one-pointedness is that they can only do that by knowing the other. 
That knowing of the other can be beneficial or detrimental. It depends on the perspective, whether you are
